## [1722] "felt strangely as though he had entered a very strict library; he"            
## [1723] "swallowed a lot of new questions that had just occurred to him and"           
## [1724] "looked instead at the thousands of narrow boxes piled neatly right up"        
## [1725] "to the ceiling. For some reason, the back of his neck prickled. The"          
## [1726] "very dust and silence in here seemed to tingle with some secret"              
## [1727] "magic.　　\"Good afternoon,\" said a soft voice. Harry jumped. Hagrid"        
## [1728] "must have jumped, too, because there was a loud crunching noise and he"       
## [1729] "got quickly off the spindly chair.　　An old man was standing before"         
## [1730] "them, his wide, pale eyes shining like moons through the gloom of the"        
## [1731] "shop.　　\"Hello,\" said Harry awkwardly.　　\"Ah yes,\" said the man."       
## [1732] "\"Yes, yes. I thought I'd be seeing you soon. Harry Potter.\" It wasn't a"    
## [1733] "question. \"You have your mother's eyes. It seems only yesterday she was"     
## [1734] "in here herself, buying her first wand. Ten and a quarter inches long,"       
## [1735] "swishy, made of willow. Nice wand for charm work.\"　　Mr. Ollivander"        
## [1736] "moved closer to Harry. Harry wished he would blink. Those silvery eyes"       
## [1737] "were a bit creepy.　　\"Your father, on the other hand, favored a"            
## [1738] "mahogany wand. Eleven inches. Pliable. A little more power and"               
## [1739] "excellent for transfiguration. Well, I say your father favored it --"         
## [1740] "it's really the wand that chooses the wizard, of course.\"　　Mr."            
## [1741] "Ollivander had come so close that he and Harry were almost nose to"           
## [1742] "nose. Harry could see himself reflected in those misty eyes.　　\"And"        
## [1743] "that's where...\"　　Mr. Ollivander touched the lightning scar on"            
## [1744] "Harry's forehead with a long, white finger.　　\"I'm sorry to say I sold"     
## [1745] "the wand that did it,\" he said softly. \"Thirteen-and-a-half inches."        
## [1746] "Yew. Powerful wand, very powerful, and in the wrong hands... well, if"        
## [1747] "I'd known what that wand was going out into the world to do....\"　　He"      
## [1748] "shook his head and then, to Harry's relief, spotted Hagrid.　　\"Rubeus!"     
## [1749] "Rubeus Hagrid! How nice to see you again.... Oak, sixteen inches,"            
## [1750] "rather bendy, wasn't it?\"　　\"It was, sir, yes,\" said Hagrid.　　\"Good"   
## [1751] "wand, that one. But I suppose they snapped it in half when you got"           
## [1752] "expelled?\" said Mr. Ollivander, suddenly stern.　　\"Er -- yes, they"        
## [1753] "did, yes,\" said Hagrid, shuffling his feet. \"I've still got the pieces,"    
## [1754] "though,\" he added brightly.　　\"But you don't use them?\" said Mr."         
## [1755] "Ollivander sharply.　　\"Oh, no, sit,\" said Hagrid quickly. Harry"           
## [1756] "noticed he gripped his pink umbrella very tightly as he"                      
## [1757] "spoke.　　\"Hmmm,\" said Mr. Ollivander, giving Hagrid a piercing look."      
## [1758] "\"Well, now -- Mr. Potter. Let me see.\" He pulled a long tape measure"       
## [1759] "with silver markings out of his pocket. \"Which is your wand"                 
## [1760] "arm?\"　　\"Er -- well, I'm right-handed,\" said Harry.　　\"Hold out your"   
## [1761] "arm. That's it.\" He measured Harry from shoulder to finger, then wrist"      
## [1762] "to elbow, shoulder to floor, knee to armpit and round his head. As he"        
## [1763] "measured, he said, \"Every Ollivander wand has a core of a powerful"          
## [1764] "magical substance, Mr. Potter. We use unicorn hairs, phoenix tail"            
## [1765] "feathers, and the heartstrings of dragons. No two Ollivander wands are"       
## [1766] "the same, just as no two unicorns, dragons, or phoenixes are quite the"       
## [1767] "same. And of course, you will never get such good results with another"       
## [1768] "wizard's wand.\"　　Harry suddenly realized that the tape measure, which"     
## [1769] "was measuring between his nostrils, was doing this on its own. Mr."           
## [1770] "Ollivander was flitting around the shelves, taking down boxes.　　\"That"     
## [1771] "will do,\" he said, and the tape measure crumpled into a heap on the"         
## [1772] "floor. \"Right then, Mr. Potter. Try this one. Beechwood and dragon"          
## [1773] "heartstring. Nine inches. Nice and flexible. just take it and give it a"      
## [1774] "wave.\"　　Harry took the wand and (feeling foolish) waved it around a"       
## [1775] "bit, but Mr. Ollivander snatched it out of his hand almost at"                
## [1776] "once.　　\"Maple and phoenix feather. Seven inches. Quite whippy. Try"        
## [1777] "--\"　　Harry tried -- but he had hardly raised the wand when it, too,"       
## [1778] "was snatched back by Mr. Ollivander.　　\"No, no -here, ebony and"            
## [1779] "unicorn hair, eight and a half inches, springy. Go on, go on, try it"         
## [1780] "out.\"　　Harry tried. And tried. He had no idea what Mr. Ollivander was"     
## [1781] "waiting for. The pile of tried wands was mounting higher and higher on"       
## [1782] "the spindly chair, but the more wands Mr. Ollivander pulled from the"         
## [1783] "shelves, the happier he seemed to become.　　\"Tricky customer, eh? Not"      
## [1784] "to worry, we'll find the perfect match here somewhere -- I wonder, now"       
## [1785] "- - yes, why not -- unusual combination -- holly and phoenix feather,"        
## [1786] "eleven inches, nice and supple.\"　　Harry took the wand. He felt a"          
## [1787] "sudden warmth in his fingers. He raised the wand above his head,"             
## [1788] "brought it swishing down through the dusty air and a stream of red and"       
## [1789] "gold sparks shot from the end like a firework, throwing dancing spots"        
## [1790] "of light on to the walls. Hagrid whooped and clapped and Mr. Ollivander"      
## [1791] "cried, \"Oh, bravo! Yes, indeed, oh, very good. Well, well, well... how"      
## [1792] "curious... how very curious... \"　　He put Harry's wand back into its"       
## [1793] "box and wrapped it in brown paper, still muttering, \"Curious..."             
## [1794] "curious..　　\"Sorry,\" said Harry, \"but what's curious?\"　　Mr."           
## [1795] "Ollivander fixed Harry with his pale stare.　　\"I remember every wand"       
## [1796] "I've ever sold, Mr. Potter. Every single wand. It so happens that the"        
## [1797] "phoenix whose tail feather is in your wand, gave another feather --"          
## [1798] "just one other. It is very curious indeed that you should be destined"        
## [1799] "for this wand when its brother why, its brother gave you that"                
## [1800] "scar.\"　　Harry swallowed.　　\"Yes, thirteen-and-a-half inches. Yew."       
## [1801] "Curious indeed how these things happen. The wand chooses the wizard,"         
## [1802] "remember.... I think we must expect great things from you, Mr."               
## [1803] "Potter.... After all, He- Who-Must-Not-Be-Named did great things --"          
## [1804] "terrible, yes, but great.\"　　Harry shivered. He wasn't sure he liked"       
## [1805] "Mr. Ollivander too much. He paid seven gold Galleons for his wand, and"       
## [1806] "Mr. Ollivander bowed them from his shop.　　The late afternoon sun hung"      
## [1807] "low in the sky as Harry and Hagrid made their way back down Diagon"           
## [1808] "Alley, back through the wall, back through the Leaky Cauldron, now"           
## [1809] "empty. Harry didn't speak at all as they walked down the road; he"            
## [1810] "didn't even notice how much people were gawking at them on the"               
## [1811] "Underground, laden as they were with all their funny-shaped packages,"        
## [1812] "with the snowy owl asleep in its cage on Harry's lap. Up another"             
## [1813] "escalator, out into Paddington station; Harry only realized where they"       
## [1814] "were when Hagrid tapped him on the shoulder.　　\"Got time fer a bite to"     
## [1815] "eat before yer train leaves,\" he said.　　He bought Harry a hamburger"       
## [1816] "and they sat down on plastic seats to eat them. Harry kept looking"           
## [1817] "around. Everything looked so strange, somehow.　　\"You all right,"           
## [1818] "Harry? Yer very quiet,\" said Hagrid.　　Harry wasn't sure he could"          
## [1819] "explain. He'd just had the best birthday of his life -- and yet -- he"        
## [1820] "chewed his hamburger, trying to find the words.　　\"Everyone thinks I'm"     
## [1821] "special,\" he said at last. \"All those people in the Leaky Cauldron,"        
## [1822] "Professor Quirrell, Mr. Ollivander... but I don't know anything about"        
## [1823] "magic at all. How can they expect great things? I'm famous and I can't"       
## [1824] "even remember what I'm famous for. I don't know what happened when"           
## [1825] "Vol-, sorry -- I mean, the night my parents died.\"　　Hagrid leaned"         
## [1826] "across the table. Behind the wild beard and eyebrows he wore a very"          
## [1827] "kind smile.　　\"Don' you worry, Harry. You'll learn fast enough."            
## [1828] "Everyone starts at the beginning at Hogwarts, you'll be just fine. just"      
## [1829] "be yerself. I know it's hard. Yeh've been singled out, an' that's"            
## [1830] "always hard. But yeh'll have a great time at Hogwarts -- I did -- still"      
## [1831] "do, 'smatter of fact.\"　　Hagrid helped Harry on to the train that"          
## [1832] "would take him back to the Dursleys, then handed him an"                      
## [1833] "envelope.　　\"Yer ticket fer Hogwarts, \" he said. \"First o' September"     
## [1834] "-- King's Cross -- it's all on yer ticket. Any problems with the"             
## [1835] "Dursleys, send me a letter with yer owl, she'll know where to find"           
## [1836] "me.... See yeh soon, Harry.\"　　The train pulled out of the station."        
## [1837] "Harry wanted to watch Hagrid until he was out of sight; he rose in his"       
## [1838] "seat and pressed his nose against the window, but he blinked and Hagrid"      
## [1839] "had gone.　　 THE JOURNEY FROM PLATFORM NINE AND"                             
## [1840] "THREE-QUARTERS　　Harry's last month with the Dursleys wasn't fun."           
## [1841] "True, Dudley was now so scared of Harry he wouldn't stay in the same"         
## [1842] "room, while Aunt Petunia and Uncle Vernon didn't shut Harry in his"           
## [1843] "cupboard, force him to do anything, or shout at him -- in fact, they"         
## [1844] "didn't speak to him at all. Half terrified, half furious, they acted as"      
## [1845] "though any chair with Harry in it were empty. Although this was an"           
## [1846] "improvement in many ways, it did become a bit depressing after a"             
## [1847] "while.　　Harry kept to his room, with his new owl for company. He had"       
## [1848] "decided to call her Hedwig, a name he had found in A History of Magic."       
## [1849] "His school books were very interesting. He lay on his bed reading late"       
## [1850] "into the night, Hedwig swooping in and out of the open window as she"         
## [1851] "pleased. It was lucky that Aunt Petunia didn't come in to vacuum"             
## [1852] "anymore, because Hedwig kept bringing back dead mice. Every night"            
## [1853] "before he went to sleep, Harry ticked off another day on the piece of"        
## [1854] "paper he had pinned to the wall, counting down to September the"              
## [1855] "first.　　On the last day of August he thought he'd better speak to his"      
## [1856] "aunt and uncle about getting to King's Cross station the next day, so"        
## [1857] "he went down to the living room where they were watching a quiz show on"      
## [1858] "television. He cleared his throat to let them know he was there, and"         
## [1859] "Dudley screamed and ran from the room.　　\"Er -- Uncle"                      
## [1860] "Vernon?\"　　Uncle Vernon grunted to show he was listening.　　\"Er -- I"     
## [1861] "need to be at King's Cross tomorrow to -- to go to Hogwarts.\"　　Uncle"      
## [1862] "Vernon grunted again.　　\"Would it be all right if you gave me a"            
## [1863] "lift?\"　　Grunt. Harry supposed that meant yes.　　\"Thank you.\"　　He"     
## [1864] "was about to go back upstairs when Uncle Vernon actually"                     
## [1865] "spoke.　　\"Funny way to get to a wizards' school, the train. Magic"          
## [1866] "carpets all got punctures, have they?\"　　Harry didn't say"                  
## [1867] "anything.　　\"Where is this school, anyway?\"　　\"I don't know,\" said"     
## [1868] "Harry, realizing this for the first time. He pulled the ticket Hagrid"        
## [1869] "had given him out of his pocket.　　\"I just take the train from"             
## [1870] "platform nine and three-quarters at eleven o'clock,\" he read.　　His"        
## [1871] "aunt and uncle stared.　　\"Platform what?\"　　\"Nine and"                   
## [1872] "three-quarters.\"　　\"Don't talk rubbish,\" said Uncle Vernon. \"There is"   
## [1873] "no platform nine and three-quarters.\"　　\"It's on my"                       
## [1874] "ticket.\"　　\"Barking,\" said Uncle Vernon, \"howling mad, the lot of"       
## [1875] "them. You'll see. You just wait. All right, we'll take you to King's"         
## [1876] "Cross. We're going up to London tomorrow anyway, or I wouldn't"               
## [1877] "bother.\"　　\"Why are you going to London?\" Harry asked, trying to keep"    
## [1878] "things friendly.　　\"Taking Dudley to the hospital,\" growled Uncle"         
## [1879] "Vernon. \"Got to have that ruddy tail removed before he goes to"              
## [1880] "Smeltings.\"　　Harry woke at five o'clock the next morning and was too"      
## [1881] "excited and nervous to go back to sleep. He got up and pulled on his"         
## [1882] "jeans because he didn't want to walk into the station in his wizard's"        
## [1883] "robes -- he'd change on the train. He checked his Hogwarts list yet"          
## [1884] "again to make sure he had everything he needed, saw that Hedwig was"          
## [1885] "shut safely in her cage, and then paced the room, waiting for the"            
## [1886] "Dursleys to get up. Two hours later, Harry's huge, heavy trunk had been"      
## [1887] "loaded into the Dursleys' car, Aunt Petunia had talked Dudley into"           
## [1888] "sitting next to Harry, and they had set off.　　They reached King's"          
## [1889] "Cross at half past ten. Uncle Vernon dumped Harry's trunk onto a cart"        
## [1890] "and wheeled it into the station for him. Harry thought this was"              
## [1891] "strangely kind until Uncle Vernon stopped dead, facing the platforms"         
## [1892] "with a nasty grin on his face.　　\"Well, there you are, boy. Platform"       
## [1893] "nine -- platform ten. Your platform should be somewhere in the middle,"       
## [1894] "but they don't seem to have built it yet, do they?\"　　He was quite"         
## [1895] "right, of course. There was a big plastic number nine over one platform"      
## [1896] "and a big plastic number ten over the one next to it, and in the"             
## [1897] "middle, nothing at all.　　\"Have a good term,\" said Uncle Vernon with"      
## [1898] "an even nastier smile. He left without another word. Harry turned and"        
## [1899] "saw the Dursleys drive away. All three of them were laughing. Harry's"        
## [1900] "mouth went rather dry. What on earth was he going to do? He was"              
## [1901] "starting to attract a lot of funny looks, because of Hedwig. He'd have"       
## [1902] "to ask someone.　　He stopped a passing guard, but didn't dare mention"       
## [1903] "platform nine and three-quarters. The guard had never heard of Hogwarts"      
## [1904] "and when Harry couldn't even tell him what part of the country it was"        
## [1905] "in, he started to get annoyed, as though Harry was being stupid on"           
## [1906] "purpose. Getting desperate, Harry asked for the train that left at"           
## [1907] "eleven o'clock, but the guard said there wasn't one. In the end the"          
## [1908] "guard strode away, muttering about time wasters. Harry was now trying"        
## [1909] "hard not to panic. According to the large clock over the arrivals"            
## [1910] "board, he had ten minutes left to get on the train to Hogwarts and he"        
## [1911] "had no idea how to do it; he was stranded in the middle of a station"         
## [1912] "with a trunk he could hardly lift, a pocket full of wizard money, and a"      
## [1913] "large owl.　　Hagrid must have forgotten to tell him something you had"       
## [1914] "to do, like tapping the third brick on the left to get into Diagon"           
## [1915] "Alley. He wondered if he should get out his wand and start tapping the"       
## [1916] "ticket inspector's stand between platforms nine and ten.　　At that"          
## [1917] "moment a group of people passed just behind him and he caught a few"          
## [1918] "words of what they were saying.　　\"-- packed with Muggles, of course"       
## [1919] "--\"　　Harry swung round. The speaker was a plump woman who was talking"     
## [1920] "to four boys, all with flaming red hair. Each of them was pushing a"          
## [1921] "trunk like Harry's in front of him -- and they had an owl.　　Heart"          
## [1922] "hammering, Harry pushed his cart after them. They stopped and so did"         
## [1923] "he, just near enough to hear what they were saying.　　\"Now, what's the"     
## [1924] "platform number?\" said the boys' mother.　　\"Nine and three-quarters!\""    
## [1925] "piped a small girl, also red-headed, who was holding her hand, \"Mom,"        
## [1926] "can't I go... \"　　\"You're not old enough, Ginny, now be quiet. All"        
## [1927] "right, Percy, you go first.\"　　What looked like the oldest boy marched"     
## [1928] "toward platforms nine and ten. Harry watched, careful not to blink in"        
## [1929] "case he missed it -- but just as the boy reached the dividing barrier"        
## [1930] "between the two platforms, a large crowd of tourists came swarming in"        
## [1931] "front of him and by the time the last backpack had cleared away, the"         
## [1932] "boy had vanished.　　\"Fred, you next,\" the plump woman said.　　\"I'm"      
## [1933] "not Fred, I'm George,\" said the boy. \"Honestly, woman, you call"            
## [1934] "yourself our mother? CarA you tell I'm George?\"　　\"Sorry, George,"         
## [1935] "dear.\"　　\"Only joking, I am Fred,\" said the boy, and off he went. His"    
## [1936] "twin called after him to hurry up, and he must have done so, because a"       
## [1937] "second later, he had gone -- but how had he done it?　　Now the third"        
## [1938] "brother was walking briskly toward the barrier he was almost there --"        
## [1939] "and then, quite suddenly, he wasn't anywhere.　　There was nothing else"      
## [1940] "for it.　　\"Excuse me,\" Harry said to the plump woman.　　\"Hello,"         
## [1941] "dear,\" she said. \"First time at Hogwarts? Ron's new, too.\"　　She"         
## [1942] "pointed at the last and youngest of her sons. He was tall, thin, and"         
## [1943] "gangling, with freckles, big hands and feet, and a long nose.　　\"Yes,\""    
## [1944] "said Harry. \"The thing is -- the thing is, I don't know how to"              
## [1945] "--\"　　\"How to get onto the platform?\" she said kindly, and Harry"         
## [1946] "nodded.　　\"Not to worry,\" she said. \"All you have to do is walk"          
## [1947] "straight at the barrier between platforms nine and ten. Don't stop and"       
## [1948] "don't be scared you'll crash into it, that's very important. Best do it"      
## [1949] "at a bit of a run if you're nervous. Go on, go now before Ron.\"　　\"Er"     
## [1950] "-- okay,\" said Harry.　　He pushed his trolley around and stared at the"     
## [1951] "barrier. It looked very solid.　　He started to walk toward it. People"       
## [1952] "jostled him on their way to platforms nine and ten. Harry walked more"        
## [1953] "quickly. He was going to smash right into that barrier and then he'd be"      
## [1954] "in trouble -- leaning forward on his cart, he broke into a heavy run --"      
## [1955] "the barrier was coming nearer and nearer -- he wouldn't be able to stop"      
## [1956] "-- the cart was out of control -- he was a foot away -- he closed his"        
## [1957] "eyes ready for the crash --　　It didn't come... he kept on running..."       
## [1958] "he opened his eyes. A scarlet steam engine was waiting next to a"             
## [1959] "platform packed with people. A sign overhead said Hogwarts Express,"          
## [1960] "eleven O'clock. Harry looked behind him and saw a wrought-iron archway"       
## [1961] "where the barrier had been, with the words Platform Nine and"                 
## [1962] "Three-Quarters on it, He had done it.　　Smoke from the engine drifted"       
## [1963] "over the heads of the chattering crowd, while cats of every color wound"      
## [1964] "here and there between their legs. Owls hooted to one another in a"           
## [1965] "disgruntled sort of way over the babble and the scraping of heavy"            
## [1966] "trunks.　　The first few carriages were already packed with students,"        
## [1967] "some hanging out of the window to talk to their families, some fighting"      
## [1968] "over seats. Harry pushed his cart off down the platform in search of an"      
## [1969] "empty seat. He passed a round-faced boy who was saying, \"Gran, I've"         
## [1970] "lost my toad again.\"　　\"Oh, Neville,\" he heard the old woman"             
## [1971] "sigh.　　A boy with dreadlocks was surrounded by a small"                     
## [1972] "crowd.　　\"Give us a look, Lee, go on.\"　　The boy lifted the lid of a"     
## [1973] "box in his arms, and the people around him shrieked and yelled as"            
## [1974] "something inside poked out a long, hairy leg.　　Harry pressed on"            
## [1975] "through the crowd until he found an empty compartment near the end of"        
## [1976] "the train. He put Hedwig inside first and then started to shove and"          
## [1977] "heave his trunk toward the train door. He tried to lift it up the steps"      
## [1978] "but could hardly raise one end and twice he dropped it painfully on his"      
## [1979] "foot.　　\"Want a hand?\" It was one of the red-haired twins he'd"            
## [1980] "followed through the barrier.　　\"Yes, please,\" Harry panted.　　\"Oy,"     
## [1981] "Fred! C'mere and help!\"　　With the twins' help, Harry's trunk was at"       
## [1982] "last tucked away in a corner of the compartment.　　\"Thanks,\" said"         
## [1983] "Harry, pushing his sweaty hair out of his eyes.　　\"What's that?\" said"     
## [1984] "one of the twins suddenly, pointing at Harry's lightning"                     
## [1985] "scar.　　\"Blimey,\" said the other twin. \"Are you　　\"He is,\" said the"   
## [1986] "first twin. \"Aren't you?\" he added to Harry.　　\"What?\" said"             
## [1987] "Harry.　　\"Harry Potter, \"chorused the twins.　　\"Oh, him,\" said Harry."  
## [1988] "\"I mean, yes, I am.\"　　The two boys gawked at him, and Harry felt"         
## [1989] "himself turning red. Then, to his relief, a voice came floating in"           
## [1990] "through the train's open door.　　\"Fred? George? Are you"                    
## [1991] "there?\"　　\"Coming, Mom.\"　　With a last look at Harry, the twins"         
## [1992] "hopped off the train.　　Harry sat down next to the window where, half"       
## [1993] "hidden, he could watch the red-haired family on the platform and hear"        
## [1994] "what they were saying. Their mother had just taken out her"                   
## [1995] "handkerchief.　　\"Ron, you've got something on your nose.\"　　The"          
## [1996] "youngest boy tried to jerk out of the way, but she grabbed him and"           
## [1997] "began rubbing the end of his nose.　　\"Mom -- geroff\" He wriggled"          
## [1998] "free.　　\"Aaah, has ickle Ronnie got somefink on his nosie?\" said one"      
## [1999] "of the twins.　　\"Shut up,\" said Ron.　　\"Where's Percy?\" said their"     
## [2000] "mother.　　\"He's coming now.\"　　The oldest boy came striding into"         
## [2001] "sight. He had already changed into his billowing black Hogwarts robes,"       
## [2002] "and Harry noticed a shiny silver badge on his chest with the letter P"        
## [2003] "on it.　　\"Can't stay long, Mother,\" he said. \"I'm up front, the"          
## [2004] "prefects have got two compartments to themselves --\"　　\"Oh, are you a"     
## [2005] "prefect, Percy?\" said one of the twins, with an air of great surprise."      
## [2006] "\"You should have said something, we had no idea.\"　　\"Hang on, I think"    
## [2007] "I remember him saying something about it,\" said the other twin. \"Once"      
## [2008] "--\"　　\"Or twice --\"　　\"A minute --\"　　\"All summer --\"　　\"Oh, shut"
## [2009] "up,\" said Percy the Prefect.　　\"How come Percy gets new robes,"            
## [2010] "anyway?\" said one of the twins.　　\"Because he's a prefect,\" said their"   
## [2011] "mother fondly. \"All right, dear, well, have a good term -- send me an"       
## [2012] "owl when you get there.\"　　She kissed Percy on the cheek and he left."      
## [2013] "Then she turned to the twins.　　\"Now, you two -- this year, you behave"     
## [2014] "yourselves. If I get one more owl telling me you've -- you've blown up"       
## [2015] "a toilet or --\"　　\"Blown up a toilet? We've never blown up a"              
## [2016] "toilet.\"　　\"Great idea though, thanks, Mom.\"　　\"It's not funny. And"    
## [2017] "look after Ron.\"　　\"Don't worry, ickle Ronniekins is safe with"            
## [2018] "us.\"　　\"Shut up,\" said Ron again. He was almost as tall as the twins"     
## [2019] "already and his nose was still pink where his mother had rubbed"              
## [2020] "it.　　\"Hey, Mom, guess what? Guess who we just met on the"                  
## [2021] "train?\"　　Harry leaned back quickly so they couldn't see him"               
## [2022] "looking.　　\"You know that black-haired boy who was near us in the"          
## [2023] "station? Know who he is?\"　　\"Who?\"　　\"Harry Potter!\"　　Harry heard"   
## [2024] "the little girl's voice.　　\"Oh, Mom, can I go on the train and see"         
## [2025] "him, Mom, eh please....\"　　\"You've already seen him, Ginny, and the"       
## [2026] "poor boy isn't something you goggle at in a zoo. Is he really, Fred?"         
## [2027] "How do you know?\"　　\"Asked him. Saw his scar. It's really there - like"    
## [2028] "lightning.\"　　\"Poor dear - no wonder he was alone, I wondered. He was"     
## [2029] "ever so polite when he asked how to get onto the platform.\"　　\"Never"      
## [2030] "mind that, do you think he remembers what You-Know-Who looks"                 
## [2031] "like?\"　　Their mother suddenly became very stern.　　\"I forbid you to"     
## [2032] "ask him, Fred. No, don't you dare. As though he needs reminding of that"      
## [2033] "on his first day at school.\"　　\"All right, keep your hair on.\"　　A"      
## [2034] "whistle sounded.　　\"Hurry up!\" their mother said, and the three boys"      
## [2035] "clambered onto the train. They leaned out of the window for her to kiss"      
## [2036] "them good-bye, and their younger sister began to cry.　　\"Don't, Ginny,"     
## [2037] "we'll send you loads of owls.\"　　\"We'll send you a Hogwarts toilet"        
## [2038] "seat.\"　　\"George!\"　　\"Only joking, Mom.\"　　The train began to move."  
## [2039] "Harry saw the boys' mother waving and their sister, half laughing, half"      
## [2040] "crying, running to keep up with the train until it gathered too much"         
## [2041] "speed, then she fell back and waved.　　Harry watched the girl and her"       
## [2042] "mother disappear as the train rounded the corner. Houses flashed past"        
## [2043] "the window. Harry felt a great leap of excitement. He didn't know what"       
## [2044] "he was going to but it had to be better than what he was leaving"             
## [2045] "behind.　　The door of the compartment slid open and the youngest"            
## [2046] "redheaded boy came in.　　\"Anyone sitting there?\" he asked, pointing at"    
## [2047] "the seat opposite Harry. \"Everywhere else is full.\"　　Harry shook his"     
## [2048] "head and the boy sat down. He glanced at Harry and then looked quickly"       
## [2049] "out of the window, pretending he hadn't looked. Harry saw he still had"       
## [2050] "a black mark on his nose.　　\"Hey, Ron.\"　　The twins were"                 
## [2051] "back.　　\"Listen, we're going down the middle of the train -- Lee"           
## [2052] "Jordan's got a giant tarantula down there.\"　　\"Right,\" mumbled"           
## [2053] "Ron.　　\"Harry,\" said the other twin, \"did we introduce ourselves? Fred"   
## [2054] "and George Weasley. And this is Ron, our brother. See you later,"             
## [2055] "then.　　\"Bye,\" said Harry and Ron. The twins slid the compartment door"    
## [2056] "shut behind them.　　\"Are you really Harry Potter?\" Ron blurted"            
## [2057] "out.　　Harry nodded.　　\"Oh -well, I thought it might be one of Fred"       
## [2058] "and George's jokes,\" said Ron. \"And have you really got -- you"             
## [2059] "know...\"　　He pointed at Harry's forehead.　　Harry pulled back his"        
## [2060] "bangs to show the lightning scar. Ron stared.　　\"So that's where"           
## [2061] "You-Know-Who　　\"Yes,\" said Harry, \"but I can't remember"                  
## [2062] "it.\"　　\"Nothing?\" said Ron eagerly.　　 \"Well -- I remember a lot of"    
## [2063] "green light, but nothing else.\"　　\"Wow,\" said Ron. He sat and stared"     
## [2064] "at Harry for a few moments, then, as though he had suddenly realized"         
## [2065] "what he was doing, he looked quickly out of the window again.　　\"Are"       
## [2066] "all your family wizards?\" asked Harry, who found Ron just as"                
## [2067] "interesting as Ron found him.　　\"Er -- Yes, I think so,\" said Ron. \"I"    
## [2068] "think Mom's got a second cousin who's an accountant, but we never talk"       
## [2069] "about him.\"　　\"So you must know loads of magic already.\"　　The"          
## [2070] "Weasleys were clearly one of those old wizarding families the pale boy"       
## [2071] "in Diagon Alley had talked about.　　\"I heard you went to live with"         
## [2072] "Muggles,\" said Ron. \"What are they like?\"　　\"Horrible -well, not all"    
## [2073] "of them. My aunt and uncle and cousin are, though. Wish I'd had three"        
## [2074] "wizard brothers.\"　　\"Five,\" said Ron. For some reason, he was looking"    
## [2075] "gloomy. \"I'm the sixth in our family to go to Hogwarts. You could say"       
## [2076] "I've got a lot to live up to. Bill and Charlie have already left --"          
## [2077] "Bill was head boy and Charlie was captain of Quidditch. Now Percy's a"        
## [2078] "prefect. Fred and George mess around a lot, but they still get really"        
## [2079] "good marks and everyone thinks they're really funny. Everyone expects"        
## [2080] "me to do as well as the others, but if I do, it's no big deal, because"       
## [2081] "they did it first. You never get anything new, either, with five"             
## [2082] "brothers. I've got Bill's old robes, Charlie's old wand, and Percy's"         
## [2083] "old rat.\"　　Ron reached inside his jacket and pulled out a fat gray"        
## [2084] "rat, which was asleep.　　\"His name's Scabbers and he's useless, he"         
## [2085] "hardly ever wakes up. Percy got an owl from my dad for being made a"          
## [2086] "prefect, but they couldn't aff -- I mean, I got Scabbers"                     
## [2087] "instead.\"　　Ron's ears went pink. He seemed to think he'd said too"         
## [2088] "much, because he went back to staring out of the window.　　Harry"            
## [2089] "didn't think there was anything wrong with not being able to afford an"       
## [2090] "owl. After all, he'd never had any money in his life until a month ago,"      
## [2091] "and he told Ron so, all about having to wear Dudley's old clothes and"        
## [2092] "never getting proper birthday presents. This seemed to cheer Ron"             
## [2093] "up.　　\"... and until Hagrid told me, I didn't know anything about be"       
## [2094] "ing a wizard or about my parents or Voldemort\"　　Ron"                       
## [2095] "gasped.　　\"What?\" said Harry.　　\"You said You-Know-Who's name!\" said"   
## [2096] "Ron, sounding both shocked and impressed. \"I'd have thought you, of all"     
## [2097] "people --\"　　\"I'm not trying to be brave or anything, saying the"          
## [2098] "name,\" said Harry, I just never knew you shouldn't. See what I mean?"        
## [2099] "I've got loads to learn.... I bet,\" he added, voicing for the first"         
## [2100] "time something that had been worrying him a lot lately, \"I bet I'm the"      
## [2101] "worst in the class.\"　　\"You won't be. There's loads of people who come"    
## [2102] "from Muggle families and they learn quick enough.\"　　While they had"        
## [2103] "been talking, the train had carried them out of London. Now they were"        
## [2104] "speeding past fields full of cows and sheep. They were quiet for a"           
## [2105] "time, watching the fields and lanes flick past.　　Around half past"          
## [2106] "twelve there was a great clattering outside in the corridor and a"            
## [2107] "smiling, dimpled woman slid back their door and said, \"Anything off the"     
## [2108] "cart, dears?\"　　Harry, who hadn't had any breakfast, leapt to his"          
## [2109] "feet, but Ron's ears went pink again and he muttered that he'd brought"       
## [2110] "sandwiches. Harry went out into the corridor.　　He had never had any"        
## [2111] "money for candy with the Dursleys, and now that he had pockets rattling"      
## [2112] "with gold and silver he was ready to buy as many Mars Bars as he could"       
## [2113] "carry -- but the woman didn't have Mars Bars. What she did have were"         
## [2114] "Bettie Bott's Every Flavor Beans, Drooble's Best Blowing Gum, Chocolate"      
## [2115] "Frogs. Pumpkin Pasties, Cauldron Cakes, Licorice Wands, and a number of"      
## [2116] "other strange things Harry had never seen in his life. Not wanting to"        
## [2117] "miss anything, he got some of everything and paid the woman eleven"           
## [2118] "silver Sickles and seven bronze Knuts.　　Ron stared as Harry brought"        
## [2119] "it all back in to the compartment and tipped it onto an empty"                
## [2120] "seat.　　\"Hungry, are you?\"　　\"Starving,\" said Harry, taking a large"    
## [2121] "bite out of a pumpkin pasty.　　Ron had taken out a lumpy package and"        
## [2122] "unwrapped it. There were four sandwiches inside. He pulled one of them"       
## [2123] "apart and said, \"She always forgets I don't like corned beef.\"　　\"Swap"   
## [2124] "you for one of these,\" said Harry, holding up a pasty. \"Go on"              
## [2125] "--\"　　\"You don't want this, it's all dry,\" said Ron. \"She hasn't got"    
## [2126] "much time,\" he added quickly, \"you know, with five of us.\"　　\"Go on,"    
## [2127] "have a pasty,\" said Harry, who had never had anything to share before"       
## [2128] "or, indeed, anyone to share it with. It was a nice feeling, sitting"          
## [2129] "there with Ron, eating their way through all Harry's pasties, cakes,"         
## [2130] "and candies (the sandwiches lay forgotten).　　\"What are these?\" Harry"     
## [2131] "asked Ron, holding up a pack of Chocolate Frogs. \"They're not really"        
## [2132] "frogs, are they?\" He was starting to feel that nothing would surprise"       
## [2133] "him.　　\"No,\" said Ron. \"But see what the card is. I'm missing"            
## [2134] "Agrippa.\"　　\"What?\"　　\"Oh, of course, you wouldn't know -- Chocolate"   
## [2135] "Frogs have cards, inside them, you know, to collect -- famous witches"        
## [2136] "and wizards. I've got about five hundred, but I haven't got Agrippa or"       
## [2137] "Ptolemy.\"　　Harry unwrapped his Chocolate Frog and picked up the card."     
## [2138] "It showed a man's face. He wore half- moon glasses, had a long, crooked"      
## [2139] "nose, and flowing silver hair, beard, and mustache. Underneath the"           
## [2140] "picture was the name Albus Dumbledore.　　\"So this is Dumbledore!\" said"    
## [2141] "Harry.　　\"Don't tell me you'd never heard of Dumbledore!\" said Ron."       
## [2142] "\"Can I have a frog? I might get Agrippa -- thanks　　Harry turned over"      
## [2143] "his card and read:　　ALBUS DUMBLEDORE　　CURRENTLY HEADMASTER OF"            
## [2144] "HOGWARTS　　Considered by many the greatest wizard of modern times,"          
## [2145] "Dumbledore is particularly famous for his defeat of the dark wizard"          
## [2146] "Grindelwald in 1945, for the discovery of the twelve uses of dragon's"        
## [2147] "blood, and his work on alchemy with his partner, Nicolas Flamel."             
## [2148] "Professor Dumbledore enjoys chamber music and tenpin bowling.　　Harry"       
## [2149] "turned the card back over and saw, to his astonishment, that"                 
## [2150] "Dumbledore's face had disappeared.　　\"He's gone!\"　　\"Well, you can't"    
## [2151] "expect him to hang around all day,\" said Ron. \"He'll be back. No, I've"     
## [2152] "got Morgana again and I've got about six of her... do you want it? You"       
## [2153] "can start collecting.\"　　Ron's eyes strayed to the pile of Chocolate"       
## [2154] "Frogs waiting to be unwrapped.　　\"Help yourself,\" said Harry. \"But in,"   
## [2155] "you know, the Muggle world, people just stay put in photos.\"　　\"Do"        
## [2156] "they? What, they don't move at all?\" Ron sounded amazed."                    
## [2157] "\"weird!\"　　Harry stared as Dumbledore sidled back into the picture on"     
## [2158] "his card and gave him a small smile. Ron was more interested in eating"       
## [2159] "the frogs than looking at the Famous Witches and Wizards cards, but"          
## [2160] "Harry couldn't keep his eyes off them. Soon he had not only Dumbledore"       
## [2161] "and Morgana, but Hengist of Woodcroft, Alberic Grunnion, Circe,"              
## [2162] "Paracelsus, and Merlin. He finally tore his eyes away from the druidess"      
## [2163] "Cliodna, who was scratching her nose, to open a bag of Bertie Bott's"         
## [2164] "Every Flavor Beans.　　\"You want to be careful with those,\" Ron warned"     
## [2165] "Harry. \"When they say every flavor, they mean every flavor -- you know,"     
## [2166] "you get all the ordinary ones like chocolate and peppermint and mar-"         
## [2167] "malade, but then you can get spinach and liver and tripe. George"             
## [2168] "reckons he had a booger- flavored one once.\"　　Ron picked up a green"       
## [2169] "bean, looked at it carefully, and bit into a corner.　　\"Bleaaargh --"       
## [2170] "see? Sprouts.\"　　They had a good time eating the Every Flavor Beans."       
## [2171] "Harry got toast, coconut, baked bean, strawberry, curry, grass, coffee,"      
## [2172] "sardine, and was even brave enough to nibble the end off a funny gray"        
## [2173] "one Ron wouldn't touch, which turned out to be pepper.　　The"                
## [2174] "countryside now flying past the window was becoming wilder. The neat"         
## [2175] "fields had gone. Now there were woods, twisting rivers, and dark green"       
## [2176] "hills.　　There was a knock on the door of their compartment and the"         
## [2177] "round-faced boy Harry had passed on platform nine and threequarters"          
## [2178] "came in. He looked tearful.　　\"Sorry,\" he said, \"but have you seen a"     
## [2179] "toad at all?\"　　When they shook their heads, he wailed, \"I've lost"        
## [2180] "him! He keeps getting away from me!\"　　\"He'll turn up,\" said"             
## [2181] "Harry.　　\"Yes,\" said the boy miserably. \"Well, if you see"                
## [2182] "him...\"　　He left.　　\"Don't know why he's so bothered,\" said Ron. \"If"  
## [2183] "I'd brought a toad I'd lose it as quick as I could. Mind you, I brought"      
## [2184] "Scabbers, so I can't talk.\"　　The rat was still snoozing on Ron's"          
## [2185] "lap.　　\"He might have died and you wouldn't know the difference,\" said"    
## [2186] "Ron in disgust. \"I tried to turn him yellow yesterday to make him more"      
## [2187] "interesting, but the spell didn't work. I'll show you, look...\"　　He"       
## [2188] "rummaged around in his trunk and pulled out a very battered-looking"          
## [2189] "wand. It was chipped in places and something white was glinting at the"       
## [2190] "end.　　\"Unicorn hair's nearly poking out. Anyway　　He had just raised"     
## [2191] "his 'wand when the compartment door slid open again. The toadless boy"        
## [2192] "was back, but this time he had a girl with him. She was already wearing"      
## [2193] "her new Hogwarts robes.　　\"Has anyone seen a toad? Neville's lost"          
## [2194] "one,\" she said. She had a bossy sort of voice, lots of bushy brown"          
## [2195] "hair, and rather large front teeth.　　\"We've already told him we"           
## [2196] "haven't seen it,\" said Ron, but the girl wasn't listening, she was"          
## [2197] "looking at the wand in his hand.　　\"Oh, are you doing magic? Let's see"     
## [2198] "it, then.\"　　She sat down. Ron looked taken aback.　　\"Er -- all"          
## [2199] "right.\"　　He cleared his throat.　　\"Sunshine, daisies, butter mellow,"    
## [2200] "Turn this stupid, fat rat yellow.\"　　He waved his wand, but nothing"        
## [2201] "happened. Scabbers stayed gray and fast asleep.　　\"Are you sure that's"     
## [2202] "a real spell?\" said the girl. \"Well, it's not very good, is it? I've"       
## [2203] "tried a few simple spells just for practice and it's all worked for me."      
## [2204] "Nobody in my family's magic at all, it was ever such a surprise when I"       
## [2205] "got my letter, but I was ever so pleased, of course, I mean, it's the"        
## [2206] "very best school of witchcraft there is, I've heard -- I've learned all"      
## [2207] "our course books by heart, of course, I just hope it will be enough --"       
## [2208] "I'm Hermione Granger, by the way, who are you.　　She said all this"          
## [2209] "very fast.　　Harry looked at Ron, and was relieved to see by his"            
## [2210] "stunned face that he hadn't learned all the course books by heart"            
## [2211] "either.　　\"I'm Ron Weasley,\" Ron muttered.　　\"Harry Potter,\" said"      
## [2212] "Harry.　　\"Are you really?\" said Hermione. \"I know all about you, of"      
## [2213] "course -- I got a few extra books. for background reading, and you're"        
## [2214] "in Modern Magical History and The Rise and Fall of the Dark Arts and"         
## [2215] "Great Wizarding Events of the Twentieth Century.　　\"Am I?\" said Harry,"    
## [2216] "feeling dazed.　　\"Goodness, didn't you know, I'd have found out"            
## [2217] "everything I could if it was me,\" said Hermione. \"Do either of you know"    
## [2218] "what house you'll be in? I've been asking around, and I hope I'm in"          
## [2219] "Gryffindor, it sounds by far the best; I hear Dumbledore himself was in"      
## [2220] "it, but I suppose Ravenclaw wouldn't be too bad.... Anyway, we'd better"      
## [2221] "go and look for Neville's toad. You two had better change, you know, I"       
## [2222] "expect we'll be there soon.\"　　And she left, taking the toadless boy"       
## [2223] "with her.　　\"Whatever house I'm in, I hope she's not in it,\" said Ron."    
## [2224] "He threw his wand back into his trunk. \"Stupid spell -- George gave it"      
## [2225] "to me, bet he knew it was a dud.\"　　\"What house are your brothers in?\""   
## [2226] "asked Harry.　　\"Gryffindor,\" said Ron. Gloom seemed to be settling on"     
## [2227] "him again. \"Mom and Dad were in it, too. I don't know what they'll say"      
## [2228] "if I'm not. I don't suppose Ravenclaw would be too bad, but imagine if"       
## [2229] "they put me in Slytherin.\"　　\"That's the house Vol-, I mean,"              
## [2230] "You-Know-Who was in?\"　　\"Yeah,\" said Ron. He flopped back into his"       
## [2231] "seat, looking depressed.　　\"You know, I think the ends of Scabbers'"        
## [2232] "whiskers are a bit lighter,\" said Harry, trying to take Ron's mind off"      
## [2233] "houses. \"So what do your oldest brothers do now that they've left,"          
## [2234] "anyway?\"　　Harry was wondering what a wizard did once he'd finished"        
## [2235] "school.　　\"Charlie's in Romania studying dragons, and Bill's in Africa"     
## [2236] "doing something for Gringotts,\" said Ron. \"Did you hear"                    
## [2237] "about　　Gringotts? It's been all over the Daily Prophet, but I don't"        
## [2238] "suppose you get that with the Muggles -- someone tried to rob a high"         
## [2239] "security vault.\"　　Harry stared.　　\"Really? What happened to"             
## [2240] "them?\"　　\"Nothing, that's why it's such big news. They haven't been"       
## [2241] "caught. My dad says it must've been a powerful Dark wizard to get round"      
## [2242] "Gringotts, but they don't think they took anything, that's what's odd."       
## [2243] "'Course, everyone gets scared when something like this happens in case"       
## [2244] "You-Know-Who's behind it.\"　　Harry turned this news over in his mind."      
## [2245] "He was starting to get a prickle of fear every time You- Know-Who was"        
## [2246] "mentioned. He supposed this was all part of entering the magical world,"      
## [2247] "but it had been a lot more comfortable saying \"Voldemort\" without"          
## [2248] "worrying.　　\"What's your Quidditch team?\" Ron asked.　　\"Er -- I don't"   
## [2249] "know any,\" Harry confessed.　　\"What!\" Ron looked dumbfounded. \"Oh, you"  
## [2250] "wait, it's the best game in the world --\" And he was off, explaining"        
## [2251] "all about the four balls and the positions of the seven players,"             
## [2252] "describing famous games he'd been to with his brothers and the"               
## [2253] "broomstick he'd like to get if he had the money. He was just taking"          
## [2254] "Harry through the finer points of the game when the compartment door"         
## [2255] "slid open yet again, but it wasn't Neville the toadless boy, or"              
## [2256] "Hermione Granger this time.　　Three boys entered, and Harry recognized"      
## [2257] "the middle one at once: it was the pale boy from Madam Malkin's robe"         
## [2258] "shop. He was looking at Harry with a lot more interest than he'd shown"       
## [2259] "back in Diagon Alley.　　\"Is it true?\" he said. \"They're saying all"       
## [2260] "down the train that Harry Potter's in this compartment. So it's you, is"      
## [2261] "it?\"　　\"Yes,\" said Harry. He was looking at the other boys. Both of"      
## [2262] "them were thickset and looked extremely mean. Standing on either side"        
## [2263] "of the pale boy, they looked like bodyguards.　　\"Oh, this is Crabbe"        
## [2264] "and this is Goyle,\" said the pale boy carelessly, noticing where Harry"      
## [2265] "was looking. \"And my name's Malfoy, Draco Malfoy.\"　　Ron gave a slight"    
## [2266] "cough, which might have been hiding a snigget. Draco Malfoy looked at"        
## [2267] "him.　　\"Think my name's funny, do you? No need to ask who you are. My"      
## [2268] "father told me all the Weasleys have red hair, freckles, and more"            
## [2269] "children than they can afford.\"　　He turned back to Harry. \"You'll"        
## [2270] "soon find out some wizarding families are much better than others,"           
## [2271] "Potter. You don't want to go making friends with the wrong sort. I can"       
## [2272] "help you there.\"　　He held out his hand to shake Harry's, but Harry"        
## [2273] "didn't take it.　　\"I think I can tell who the wrong sort are for"           
## [2274] "myself, thanks,\" he said coolly.　　Draco Malfoy didn't go red, but a"       
## [2275] "pink tinge appeared in his pale cheeks.　　\"I'd be careful if I were"        
## [2276] "you, Potter,\" he said slowly. \"Unless you're a bit politer you'll go"       
## [2277] "the same way as your parents. They didn't know what was good for them,"       
## [2278] "either. You hang around with riffraff like the Weasleys and that"             
## [2279] "Hagrid, and it'll rub off on you.\"　　Both Harry and Ron stood"              
## [2280] "up.　　\"Say that again,\" Ron said, his face as red as his hair.　　\"Oh,"   
## [2281] "you're going to fight us, are you?\" Malfoy sneered.　　\"Unless you get"     
## [2282] "out now,\" said Harry, more bravely than he felt, because Crabbe and"         
## [2283] "Goyle were a lot bigger than him or Ron.　　\"But we don't feet like"         
## [2284] "leaving, do we, boys? We've eaten all our food and you still seem to"         
## [2285] "have some.\"　　Goyle reached toward the Chocolate Frogs next to Ron -"       
## [2286] "Ron leapt forward, but before he'd so much as touched Goyle, Goyle let"       
## [2287] "out a horrible yell.　　Scabbers the rat was hanging off his finger,"         
## [2288] "sharp little teeth sunk deep into Goyle's knuckle - Crabbe and Malfoy"        
## [2289] "backed away as Goyle swung Scabbers round and round, howling, and when"       
## [2290] "Scabbets finally flew off and hit the window, all three of them"              
## [2291] "disappeared at once. Perhaps they thought there were more rats lurking"       
## [2292] "among the sweets, or perhaps they'd heard footsteps, because a second"        
## [2293] "later, Hermione Granger had come in.　　\"What has been going on?\" she"      
## [2294] "said, looking at the sweets all over the floor and Ron picking up"            
## [2295] "Scabbers by his tail.　　I think he's been knocked out,\" Ron said to"        
## [2296] "Harry. He looked closer at Scabbers. \"No -- I don't believe it -- he's"      
## [2297] "gone back to sleep-\"　　And so he had.　　\"You've met Malfoy"               
## [2298] "before?\"　　Harry explained about their meeting in Diagon"                   
## [2299] "Alley.　　\"I've heard of his family,\" said Ron darkly. \"They were some"    
## [2300] "of the first to come back to our side after You-Know-Who disappeared."        
## [2301] "Said they'd been bewitched. My dad doesn't believe it. He says Malfoy's"      
## [2302] "father didn't need an excuse to go over to the Dark Side.\" He turned to"     
## [2303] "Hermione. \"Can we help you with something?\"　　\"You'd better hurry up"     
## [2304] "and put your robes on, I've just been up to the front to ask the"             
## [2305] "conductor, and he says we're nearly there. You haven't been fighting,"        
## [2306] "have you? You'll be in trouble before we even get there!\"　　\"Scabbers"     
## [2307] "has been fighting, not us,\" said Ron, scowling at her. \"Would you mind"     
## [2308] "leaving while we change?\"　　\"All right -- I only came in here because"     
## [2309] "people outside are behaving very childishly, racing up and down the"          
## [2310] "corridors,\" said Hermione in a sniffy voice. \"And you've got dirt on"       
## [2311] "your nose, by the way, did you know?\"　　Ron glared at her as she left."     
## [2312] "Harry peered out of the window. It was getting dark. He could see"            
## [2313] "mountains and forests under a deep purple sky. The train did seem to be"      
## [2314] "slowing down.　　He and Ron took off their jackets and pulled on their"       
## [2315] "long black robes. Ron's were a bit short for him, you could see his"          
## [2316] "sneakers underneath them.　　A voice echoed through the train: \"We will"     
## [2317] "be reaching Hogwarts in five minutes' time. Please leave your luggage"        
## [2318] "on the train, it will be taken to the school separately.\"　　Harry's"        
## [2319] "stomach lurched with nerves and Ron, he saw, looked pale under his"           
## [2320] "freckles. They crammed their pockets with the last of the sweets and"         
## [2321] "joined the crowd thronging the corridor.　　The train slowed right down"      
## [2322] "and finally stopped. People pushed their way toward the door and out on"      
## [2323] "to a tiny, dark platform. Harry shivered in the cold night air. Then a"       
## [2324] "lamp came bobbing over the heads of the students, and Harry heard a"          
## [2325] "familiar voice: \"Firs' years! Firs' years over here! All right there,"       
## [2326] "Harry?\"　　Hagrid's big hairy face beamed over the sea of"                   
## [2327] "heads.　　\"C'mon, follow me -- any more firs' years? Mind yer step,"         
## [2328] "now! Firs' years follow me!\"　　Slipping and stumbling, they followed"       
## [2329] "Hagrid down what seemed to be a steep, narrow path. It was so dark on"        
## [2330] "either side of them that Harry thought there must be thick trees there."      
## [2331] "Nobody spoke much. Neville, the boy who kept losing his toad, sniffed"        
## [2332] "once or twice.　　\"Ye' all get yer firs' sight o' Hogwarts in a sec,\""      
## [2333] "Hagrid called over his shoulder, \"jus' round this bend here.\"　　There"     
## [2334] "was a loud \"Oooooh!\"　　The narrow path had opened suddenly onto the"       
## [2335] "edge of a great black take. Perched atop a high mountain on the other"        
## [2336] "side, its windows sparkling in the starry sky, was a vast castle with"        
## [2337] "many turrets and towers.　　\"No more'n four to a boat!\" Hagrid called,"     
## [2338] "pointing to a fleet of little boats sitting in the water by the shore."       
## [2339] "Harry and Ron were followed into their boat by Neville and Hermione."         
## [2340] "\"Everyone in?\" shouted Hagrid, who had a boat to himself. \"Right then"     
## [2341] "-- FORWARD!\"　　And the fleet of little boats moved off all at once,"        
## [2342] "gliding across the lake, which was as smooth as glass. Everyone was"          
## [2343] "silent, staring up at the great castle overhead. It towered over them"        
## [2344] "as they sailed nearer and nearer to the cliff on which it"                    
## [2345] "stood.　　\"Heads down!\" yelled Hagrid as the first boats reached the"       
## [2346] "cliff; they all bent their heads and the little boats carried them"           
## [2347] "through a curtain of ivy that hid a wide opening in the cliff face."          
## [2348] "They were carried along a dark tunnel, which seemed to be taking them"        
## [2349] "right underneath the castle, until they reached a kind of underground"        
## [2350] "harbor, where they clambered out onto rocks and pebbles.　　\"Oy, you"        
## [2351] "there! Is this your toad?\" said Hagrid, who was checking the boats as"       
## [2352] "people climbed out of them.　　\"Trevor!\" cried Neville blissfully,"         
## [2353] "holding out his hands. Then they clambered up a passageway in the rock"       
## [2354] "after Hagrid's lamp, coming out at last onto smooth, damp grass right"        
## [2355] "in the shadow of the castle.　　 They walked up a flight of stone steps"      
## [2356] "and crowded around the huge, Oak front door.　　\"Everyone here? You"         
## [2357] "there, still got yer toad?\"　　Hagrid raised a gigantic fist and"            
## [2358] "knocked three times on the castle door.　　 THE SORTING HAT　　The door"      
## [2359] "swung open at once. A tall, black-haired witch in emerald-green robes"        
## [2360] "stood there. She had a very stern face and Harry's first thought was"         
## [2361] "that this was not someone to cross.　　\"The firs' years, Professor"          
## [2362] "McGonagall,\" said Hagrid.　　\"Thank you, Hagrid. I will take them from"     
## [2363] "here.\"　　She pulled the door wide. The entrance hall was so big you"        
## [2364] "could have fit the whole of the Dursleys' house in it. The stone walls"       
## [2365] "were lit with flaming torches like the ones at Gringotts, the ceiling"        
## [2366] "was too high to make out, and a magnificent marble staircase facing"          
## [2367] "them led to the upper floors.　　They followed Professor McGonagall"          
## [2368] "across the flagged stone floor. Harry could hear the drone of hundreds"       
## [2369] "of voices from a doorway to the right -the rest of the school must"           
## [2370] "already be here -- but Professor McGonagall showed the first years into"      
## [2371] "a small, empty chamber off the hall. They crowded in, standing rather"        
## [2372] "closer together than they would usually have done, peering about"             
## [2373] "nervously.　　\"Welcome to Hogwarts,\" said Professor McGonagall. \"The"      
## [2374] "start-of-term banquet will begin shortly, but before you take your"           
## [2375] "seats in the Great Hall, you will be sorted into your houses. The"            
## [2376] "Sorting is a very important ceremony because, while you are here, your"       
## [2377] "house will be something like your family within Hogwarts. You will have"      
## [2378] "classes with the rest of your house, sleep in your house dormitory, and"      
## [2379] "spend free time in your house common room.　　\"The four houses are"          
## [2380] "called Gryffindor, Hufflepuff, Ravenclaw, and Slytherin. Each house has"      
## [2381] "its own noble history and each has produced outstanding witches and"          
## [2382] "wizards. While you are at Hogwarts, your triumphs will earn your house"       
## [2383] "points, while any rulebreaking will lose house points. At the end of"         
## [2384] "the year, the house with the most points is awarded the house cup, a"         
## [2385] "great honor. I hope each of you will be a credit to whichever house"          
## [2386] "becomes yours.　　\"The Sorting Ceremony will take place in a few"            
## [2387] "minutes in front of the rest of the school. I suggest you all smarten"        
## [2388] "yourselves up as much as you can while you are waiting.\"　　Her eyes"        
## [2389] "lingered for a moment on Neville's cloak, which was fastened under his"       
## [2390] "left ear, and on Ron's smudged nose. Harry nervously tried to flatten"        
## [2391] "his hair.　　\"I shall return when we are ready for you,\" said Professor"    
## [2392] "McGonagall. \"Please wait quietly.\"　　She left the chamber. Harry"          
## [2393] "swallowed.　　\"How exactly do they sort us into houses?\" he asked"          
## [2394] "Ron.　　\"Some sort of test, I think. Fred said it hurts a lot, but I"        
## [2395] "think he was joking.\"　　Harry's heart gave a horrible jolt. A test? In"     
## [2396] "front of the whole school? But he didn't know any magic yet -- what on"       
## [2397] "earth would he have to do? He hadn't expected something like this the"        
## [2398] "moment they arrived. He looked around anxiously and saw that everyone"        
## [2399] "else looked terrified, too. No one was talking much except Hermione"          
## [2400] "Granger, who was whispering very fast about all the spells she'd"             
## [2401] "learned and wondering which one she'd need. Harry tried hard not to"          
## [2402] "listen to her. He'd never been more nervous, never, not even when he'd"       
## [2403] "had to take a school report home to the Dursleys saying that he'd"            
## [2404] "somehow turned his teacher's wig blue. He kept his eyes fixed on the"         
## [2405] "door. Any second now, Professor McGonagall would come back and lead him"      
## [2406] "to his doom.　　Then something happened that made him jump about a foot"      
## [2407] "in the air -- several people behind him screamed.　　\"What the"              
## [2408] "--?\"　　He gasped. So did the people around him. About twenty ghosts"        
## [2409] "had just streamed through the back wall. Pearly-white and slightly"           
## [2410] "transparent, they glided across the room talking to one another and"          
## [2411] "hardly glancing at the first years. They seemed to be arguing. What"          
## [2412] "looked like a fat little monk was saying: \"Forgive and forget, I say,"       
## [2413] "we ought to give him a second chance --\"　　\"My dear Friar, haven't we"     
## [2414] "given Peeves all the chances he deserves? He gives us all a bad name"         
## [2415] "and you know, he's not really even a ghost -- I say, what are you all"        
## [2416] "doing here?\"　　A ghost wearing a ruff and tights had suddenly noticed"      
## [2417] "the first years.　　Nobody answered.　　\"New students!\" said the Fat"       
## [2418] "Friar, smiling around at them. \"About to be Sorted, I suppose?\"　　A"       
## [2419] "few people nodded mutely.　　\"Hope to see you in Hufflepuff!\" said the"     
## [2420] "Friar. \"My old house, you know.\"　　\"Move along now,\" said a sharp"       
## [2421] "voice. \"The Sorting Ceremony's about to start.\"　　Professor McGonagall"    
## [2422] "had returned. One by one, the ghosts floated away through the opposite"       
## [2423] "wall.　　\"Now, form a line,\" Professor McGonagall told the first years,"    
## [2424] "\"and follow me.\"　　Feeling oddly as though his legs had turned to"         
## [2425] "lead, Harry got into line behind a boy with sandy hair, with Ron behind"      
## [2426] "him, and they walked out of the chamber, back across the hall, and"           
## [2427] "through a pair of double doors into the Great Hall.　　Harry had never"       
## [2428] "even imagined such a strange and splendid place. It was lit by"               
## [2429] "thousands and thousands of candles that were floating in midair over"         
## [2430] "four long tables, where the rest of the students were sitting. These"         
## [2431] "tables were laid with glittering golden plates and goblets. At the top"       
## [2432] "of the hall was another long table where the teachers were sitting."          
## [2433] "Professor McGonagall led the first years up here, so that they came to"       
## [2434] "a halt in a line facing the other students, with the teachers behind"         
## [2435] "them. The hundreds of faces staring at them looked like pale lanterns"        
## [2436] "in the flickering candlelight. Dotted here and there among the"               
## [2437] "students, the ghosts shone misty silver. Mainly to avoid all the"             
## [2438] "staring eyes, Harry looked upward and saw a velvety black ceiling"            
## [2439] "dotted with stars. He heard　　Hermione whisper, \"Its bewitched to look"     
## [2440] "like the sky outside. I read about it in Hogwarts, A History.\"　　It"        
## [2441] "was hard to believe there was a ceiling there at all, and that the"           
## [2442] "Great Hall didn't simply open on to the heavens.　　Harry quickly"            
## [2443] "looked down again as Professor McGonagall silently placed a four-legged"      
## [2444] "stool in front of the first years. On top of the stool she put a"             
## [2445] "pointed wizard's hat. This hat was patched and frayed and extremely"          
## [2446] "dirty. Aunt Petunia wouldn't have let it in the house.　　Maybe they"         
## [2447] "had to try and get a rabbit out of it, Harry thought wildly, that"            
## [2448] "seemed the sort of thing -- noticing that everyone in the hall was now"       
## [2449] "staring at the hat, he stared at it, too. For a few seconds, there was"       
## [2450] "complete silence. Then the hat twitched. A rip near the brim opened"          
## [2451] "wide like a mouth -- and the hat began to sing:　　\"Oh, you may not"         
## [2452] "think I'm pretty,　　But don't judge on what you see,　　I'll eat"            
## [2453] "myself if you can find　　A smarter hat than me.　　You can keep your"        
## [2454] "bowlers black,　　Your top hats sleek and tall,　　For I'm the Hogwarts"      
## [2455] "Sorting Hat　　And I can cap them all.　　There's nothing hidden in"          
## [2456] "your head　　The Sorting Hat can't see,　　So try me on and I will tell"      
## [2457] "you　　Where you ought to be.　　You might belong in"                         
## [2458] "Gryffindor,　　Where dwell the brave at heart,　　Their daring, nerve,"       
## [2459] "and chivalry Set Gryffindors apart;　　You might belong in"                   
## [2460] "Hufflepuff,　　Where they are just and loyal,　　Those patient"               
## [2461] "Hufflepuffis are true And unafraid of toil;　　Or yet in wise old"            
## [2462] "Ravenclaw,　　if you've a ready mind,　　 Where those of wit and"             
## [2463] "learning,　　Will always find their kind;　　Or perhaps in"                   
## [2464] "Slytherin　　You'll make your real friends,　　Those cunning folk use"        
## [2465] "any means　　To achieve their ends.　　So put me on! Don't be"                
## [2466] "afraid!　　And don't get in a flap!　　You're in safe hands (though I"        
## [2467] "have none)　　For I'm a Thinking Cap!\"　　The whole hall burst into"         
## [2468] "applause as the hat finished its song. It bowed to each of the four"          
## [2469] "tables and then became quite still again.　　\"So we've just got to try"      
## [2470] "on the hat!\" Ron whispered to Harry. \"I'll kill Fred, he was going on"      
## [2471] "about wrestling a troll.\"　　Harry. smiled weakly. Yes, trying on the"       
## [2472] "hat was a lot better than having to do a spell, but he did wish they"         
## [2473] "could have tried it on without everyone watching. The hat seemed to be"       
## [2474] "asking rather alot; Harry didn't feel brave or quick-witted or any of"        
## [2475] "it at the moment. If only the hat had mentioned a house for people who"       
## [2476] "felt a bit queasy, that would have been the one for him.　　Professor"        
## [2477] "McGonagall now stepped forward holding a long roll of"                        
## [2478] "parchment.　　\"When I call your name, you will put on the hat and sit"       
## [2479] "on the stool to be sorted,\" she said. \"Abbott, Hannah!\"　　A pink-faced"   
## [2480] "girl with blonde pigtails stumbled out of line, put on the hat, which"        
## [2481] "fell right down over her eyes, and sat down. A moments pause"                 
## [2482] "--　　\"HUFFLEPUFF!\" shouted the hat.　　The table on the right cheered"     
## [2483] "and clapped as Hannah went to sit down at the Hufflepuff table. Harry"        
## [2484] "saw the ghost of the Fat Friar waving merrily at her.　　\"Bones,"            
## [2485] "Susan!\"　　\"HUFFLEPUFF!\" shouted the hat again, and Susan scuttled off"    
## [2486] "to sit next to Hannah.　　\"Boot, Terry!\"　　\"RAVENCLAW!\"　　The table"    
## [2487] "second from the left clapped this time; several Ravenclaws stood up to"       
## [2488] "shake hands with Terry as he joined them.　　\" Brocklehurst, Mandy\""        
## [2489] "went to Ravenclaw too, but \"Brown, Lavender\" became the first new"          
## [2490] "Gryffindor, and the table on the far left exploded with cheers; Harry"        
## [2491] "could see Ron's twin brothers catcalling.　　\"Bulstrode, Millicent\""        
## [2492] "then became a Slytherin. Perhaps it was Harry's imagination, after all"       
## [2493] "he'd heard about Slytherin, but he thought they looked like an"               
## [2494] "unpleasant lot. He was starting to feel definitely sick now. He"              
## [2495] "remembered being picked for teams during gym at his old school. He had"       
## [2496] "always been last to be chosen, not because he was no good, but because"       
## [2497] "no one wanted Dudley to think they liked him.　　\"Finch-Fletchley,"          
## [2498] "Justin!\"　　\"HUFFLEPUFF!\"　　Sometimes, Harry noticed, the hat shouted"    
## [2499] "out the house at once, but at others it took a little while to decide."       
## [2500] "\"Finnigan, Seamus,\" the sandy-haired boy next to Harry in the line, sat"    
## [2501] "on the stool for almost a whole minute before the hat declared him a"         
## [2502] "Gryffindor.　　\"Granger, Hermione!\"　　Hermione almost ran to the stool"    
## [2503] "and jammed the hat eagerly on her head.　　\"GRYFFINDOR!\" shouted the"       
## [2504] "hat. Ron groaned.　　A horrible thought struck Harry, as horrible"            
## [2505] "thoughts always do when you're very nervous. What if he wasn't chosen"        
## [2506] "at all? What if he just sat there with the hat over his eyes for ages,"       
## [2507] "until Professor McGonagall jerked it off his head and said there had"         
## [2508] "obviously been a mistake and he'd better get back on the train?　　When"      
## [2509] "Neville Longbottom, the boy who kept losing his toad, was called, he"         
## [2510] "fell over on his way to the stool. The hat took a long time to decide"        
## [2511] "with Neville. When it finally shouted, \"GRYFFINDOR,\" Neville ran off"       
## [2512] "still wearing it, and had to jog back amid gales of laughter to give it"      
## [2513] "to \"MacDougal, Morag.\"　　Malfoy swaggered forward when his name was"       
## [2514] "called and got his wish at once: the hat had barely touched his head"         
## [2515] "when it screamed, \"SLYTHERIN!\"　　Malfoy went to join his friends"          
## [2516] "Crabbe and Goyle, looking pleased with himself.　　There weren't many"        
## [2517] "people left now. \"Moon\" \"Nott\" \"Parkinson\" then a pair of twin girls,"  
## [2518] "\"Patil\" and \"Patil\" then \"Perks, Sally-Anne\" and then, at last --"      
## [2519] "\"Potter, Harry!\"　　As Harry stepped forward, whispers suddenly broke"      
## [2520] "out like little hissing fires all over the hall.　　\"Potter, did she"        
## [2521] "say?\"　　The Harry Potter?\"　　The last thing Harry saw before the hat"     
## [2522] "dropped over his eyes was the hall full of people craning to get a good"      
## [2523] "look at him. Next second he was looking at the black inside of the hat."      
## [2524] "He waited.　　Hmm,\" said a small voice in his ear. \"Difficult. Very"        
## [2525] "difficult. Plenty of courage, I see. Not a bad mind either. There's"          
## [2526] "talent, A my goodness, yes -- and a nice thirst to prove yourself, now"       
## [2527] "that's interesting.... So where shall I put you?\"　　Harry gripped the"      
## [2528] "edges of the stool and thought, Not Slytherin, not Slytherin.　　\"Not"       
## [2529] "Slytherin, eh?\" said the small voice. \"Are you sure? You could be"          
## [2530] "great, you know, it's all here in your head, and Slytherin will help"         
## [2531] "you on the way to greatness, no doubt about that -- no? Well, if you're"      
## [2532] "sure -- better be GRYFFINDOR!\"　　Harry heard the hat shout the last"        
## [2533] "word to the whole hall. He took off the hat and walked shakily toward"        
## [2534] "the Gryffindor table. He was so relieved to have been chosen and not"         
## [2535] "put in Slytherin, he hardly noticed that he was getting the loudest"          
## [2536] "cheer yet. Percy the Prefect got up and shook his hand vigorously,"           
## [2537] "while the Weasley twins yelled, \"We got Potter! We got Potter!\" Harry"      
## [2538] "sat down opposite the ghost in the ruff he'd seen earlier. The ghost"         
## [2539] "patted his arm, giving Harry the sudden, horrible feeling he'd just"          
## [2540] "plunged it into a bucket of ice-cold water.　　He could see the High"         
## [2541] "Table properly now. At the end nearest him sat Hagrid, who caught his"        
## [2542] "eye and gave him the thumbs up. Harry grinned back. And there, in the"        
## [2543] "center of the High Table, in a large gold chair, sat Albus Dumbledore."       
## [2544] "Harry recognized him at once from the card he'd gotten out of the"            
## [2545] "Chocolate Frog on the train. Dumbledore's silver hair was the only"           
## [2546] "thing in the whole hall that shone as brightly as the ghosts. Harry"          
## [2547] "spotted Professor Quirtell, too, the nervous young man from the Leaky"        
## [2548] "Cauldron. He was looking very peculiar in a large purple turban.　　And"      
## [2549] "now there were only three people left to be sorted. \"Thomas, Dean,\" a"      
## [2550] "Black boy even taller than Ron, joined Harry at the Gryffindor table."        
## [2551] "\"Turpin, Lisa,\" became a Ravenclaw and then it was Ron's turn. He was"      
## [2552] "pale green by now. Harry crossed his fingers under the table and a"           
## [2553] "second later the hat had shouted, \"GRYFFINDOR!\"　　Harry clapped loudly"    
## [2554] "with the rest as Ron collapsed into the chair next to him.　　\"Well"         
## [2555] "done, Ron, excellent,\" said Percy Weasley Pompously across Harry as"         
## [2556] "\"Zabini, Blaise,\" was made a Slytherin. Professor McGonagall rolled up"     
## [2557] "her scroll and took the Sorting Hat away.　　Harry looked down at his"        
## [2558] "empty gold plate. He had only just realized how hungry he was. The"           
## [2559] "pumpkin pasties seemed ages ago.　　Albus Dumbledore had gotten to his"       
## [2560] "feet. He was beaming at the students, his arms opened wide, as if"            
## [2561] "nothing could have pleased him more than to see them all"                     
## [2562] "there.　　\"Welcome,\" he said. \"Welcome to a new year at Hogwarts!"         
## [2563] "Before we begin our banquet, I would like to say a few words. And here"       
## [2564] "they are: Nitwit! Blubber! Oddment! Tweak!　　\"Thank you!\"　　He sat"       
## [2565] "back down. Everybody clapped and cheered. Harry didn't know whether to"       
## [2566] "laugh or not.　　 \"Is he -- a bit mad?\" he asked Percy"                     
## [2567] "uncertainly.　　\"Mad?\" said Percy airily. \"He's a genius! Best wizard"     
## [2568] "in the world! But he is a bit mad, yes. Potatoes, Harry?\"　　Harry's"        
## [2569] "mouth fell open. The dishes in front of him were now piled with food."        
## [2570] "He had never seen so many things he liked to eat on one table: roast"         
## [2571] "beef, roast chicken, pork chops and lamb chops, sausages, bacon and"          
## [2572] "steak, boiled potatoes, roast potatoes, fries, Yorkshire pudding, peas,"      
## [2573] "carrots, gravy, ketchup, and, for some strange reason, peppermint"            
## [2574] "humbugs.　　The Dursleys had never exactly starved Harry, but he'd"           
## [2575] "never been allowed to eat as much as he liked. Dudley had always taken"       
## [2576] "anything that Harry really wanted, even if It made him sick. Harry"           
## [2577] "piled his plate with a bit of everything except the peppermints and"          
## [2578] "began to eat. It was all delicious.　　\"That does look good,\" said the"     
## [2579] "ghost in the ruff sadly, watching Harry cut up his steak,　　\"Can't you"     
## [2580] "--?\"　　I haven't eaten for nearly four hundred years,\" said the ghost."    
## [2581] "\"I don't need to, of course, but one does miss it. I don't think I've"       
## [2582] "in troduced myself? Sir Nicholas de Mimsy-Porpington at your service."        
## [2583] "Resident ghost of Gryffindor Tower.\"　　\"I know who you are!\" said Ron"    
## [2584] "suddenly. \"My brothers told me about you -- you're Nearly Headless"          
## [2585] "Nick!\"　　\"I would prefer you to call me Sir Nicholas de Mimsy --\" the"    
## [2586] "ghost began stiffly, but sandy-haired Seamus Finnigan"                        
## [2587] "interrupted.　　\"Nearly Headless? How can you be nearly"                     
## [2588] "headless?\"　　Sir Nicholas looked extremely miffed, as if their little"      
## [2589] "chat wasn't going at all the way he wanted.　　\"Like this,\" he said"        
## [2590] "irritably. He seized his left ear and pulled. His whole head swung off"       
## [2591] "his neck and fell onto his shoulder as if it was on a hinge. Someone"         
## [2592] "had obviously tried to behead him, but not done it properly. Looking"         
## [2593] "pleased at the stunned looks on their faces, Nearly Headless Nick"            
## [2594] "flipped his head back onto his neck, coughed, and said, \"So -- new"          
## [2595] "Gryffindors! I hope you're going to help us win the house championship"       
## [2596] "this year? Gryffindors have never gone so long without winning."              
## [2597] "Slytherins have got the cup six years in a row! The Bloody Baron's"           
## [2598] "becoming almost unbearable -- he's the Slytherin ghost.\"　　Harry"           
## [2599] "looked over at the Slytherin table and saw a horrible ghost sitting"          
## [2600] "there, with blank staring eyes, a gaunt face, and robes stained with"         
## [2601] "silver blood. He was right next to Malfoy who, Harry was pleased to"          
## [2602] "see, didn't look too pleased with the seating arrangements.　　\"How did"     
## [2603] "he get covered in blood?\" asked Seamus with great interest.　　\"I've"       
## [2604] "never asked,\" said Nearly Headless Nick delicately.　　When everyone"        
## [2605] "had eaten as much as they could, the remains of the food faded from the"      
## [2606] "plates, leaving them sparkling clean as before. A moment later the"           
## [2607] "desserts appeared. Blocks of ice cream in every flavor you could think"       
## [2608] "of, apple pies, treacle tarts, chocolate eclairs and jam doughnuts,"          
## [2609] "trifle, strawberries, Jell-O, rice pudding -- \"　　As Harry helped"          
## [2610] "himself to a treacle tart, the talk turned to their families.　　\"I'm"       
## [2611] "half-and-half,\" said Seamus. \"Me dad's a Muggle. Mom didn't tell him"       
## [2612] "she was a witch 'til after they were married. Bit of a nasty shock for"       
## [2613] "him.\"　　The others laughed.　　\"What about you, Neville?\" said"           
## [2614] "Ron.　　\"Well, my gran brought me up and she's a witch,\" said Neville,"     
## [2615] "\"but the family thought I was all- Muggle for ages. My Great Uncle"          
## [2616] "Algie kept trying to catch me off my guard and force some magic out of"       
## [2617] "me -- he pushed me off the end of Blackpool pier once, I nearly drowned"      
## [2618] "-- but nothing happened until I was eight. Great Uncle Algie came round"      
## [2619] "for dinner, and he was hanging me out of an upstairs window by the"           
## [2620] "ankles when my Great Auntie Enid offered him a meringue and he"
