## [2621] "accidentally let go. But I bounced -- all the way down the garden and"        
## [2622] "into the road. They were all really pleased, Gran was crying, she was"        
## [2623] "so happy. And you should have seen their faces when I got in here --"         
## [2624] "they thought I might not be magic enough to come, you see. Great Uncle"       
## [2625] "Algie was so pleased he bought me my toad.\"　　On Harry's other side,"       
## [2626] "Percy Weasley and Hermione were talking about lessons (\"I do hope they"      
## [2627] "start right away, there's so much to learn, I'm particularly interested"      
## [2628] "in Transfiguration, you know, turning something into something else, of"      
## [2629] "course, it's supposed to be very difficult-\"; \"You'll be starting"          
## [2630] "small, just matches into needles and that sort of thing --"                   
## [2631] "\").　　Harry, who was starting to feel warm and sleepy, looked up"           
## [2632] "at　　the High Table again. Hagrid was drinking deeply from his goblet."      
## [2633] "Professor McGonagall was talking to Professor Dumbledore. Professor"          
## [2634] "Quirrell, in his absurd turban, was talking to a teacher with greasy"         
## [2635] "black hair, a hooked nose, and sallow skin.　　It happened very"              
## [2636] "suddenly. The hook-nosed teacher looked past Quirrell's turban straight"      
## [2637] "into Harry's eyes -- and a sharp, hot pain shot across the scar on"           
## [2638] "Harry's forehead.　　\"Ouch!\" Harry clapped a hand to his head.　　\"What"   
## [2639] "is it?\" asked Percy.　　\"N-nothing.\"　　The pain had gone as quickly as"   
## [2640] "it had come. Harder to shake off was the feeling Harry had gotten from"       
## [2641] "the teacher's look -- a feeling that he didn't like Harry at"                 
## [2642] "all.　　\"Who's that teacher talking to Professor Quirrell?\" he asked"       
## [2643] "Percy.　　\"Oh, you know Quirrell already, do you? No wonder he's"            
## [2644] "looking so nervous, that's Professor Snape. He teaches Potions, but he"       
## [2645] "doesn't want to -- everyone knows he's after Quirrell's job. Knows an"        
## [2646] "awful lot about the Dark Arts, Snape.\"　　Harry watched Snape for a"         
## [2647] "while, but Snape didn't look at him again.　　At last, the desserts too"      
## [2648] "disappeared, and Professor Dumbledore got to his feet again. The hall"        
## [2649] "fell silent.　　\"Ahern -- just a few more words now that we are all fed"     
## [2650] "and watered. I have a few start-of-term notices to give you.　　\"First"      
## [2651] "years should note that the forest on the grounds is forbidden to all"         
## [2652] "pupils. And a few of our older students would do well to remember that"       
## [2653] "as well.\"　　Dumbledore's twinkling eyes flashed in the direction of"        
## [2654] "the Weasley twins.　　\"I have also been asked by Mr. Filch, the"             
## [2655] "caretaker, to remind you all that no magic should be used between"            
## [2656] "classes in the corridors.　　\"Quidditch trials will be held in the"          
## [2657] "second week of the term. Anyone interested in playing for their house"        
## [2658] "teams should contact Madam Hooch.　　\"And finally, I must tell you that"     
## [2659] "this year, the third-floor corridor on the right-hand side is out of"         
## [2660] "bounds to everyone who does not wish to die a very painful"                   
## [2661] "death.\"　　Harry laughed, but he was one of the few who did.　　\"He's"      
## [2662] "not serious?\" he muttered to Percy.　　\"Must be,\" said Percy, frowning"    
## [2663] "at Dumbledore. \"It's odd, because he usually gives us a reason why"          
## [2664] "we're not allowed to go somewhere -- the forest's full of dangerous"          
## [2665] "beasts, everyone knows that. I do think he might have told us prefects,"      
## [2666] "at least.\"　　\"And now, before we go to bed, let us sing the school"        
## [2667] "song!\" cried Dumbledore. Harry noticed that the other teachers' smiles"      
## [2668] "had become rather fixed.　　Dumbledore gave his wand a little flick, as"      
## [2669] "if he was trying to get a fly off the end, and a long golden ribbon"          
## [2670] "flew out of it, which rose high above the tables and twisted itself,"         
## [2671] "snakelike, into words.　　\"Everyone pick their favorite tune,\" said"        
## [2672] "Dumbledore, \"and off we go!\" And the school bellowed:　　\"Hogwarts,"       
## [2673] "Hogwarts, Hoggy Warty Hogwarts,　　Teach us something"                        
## [2674] "please,　　Whether we be old and bald　　Or young with scabby"                
## [2675] "knees,　　Our heads could do with filling　　With some interesting"           
## [2676] "stuff,　　For now they're bare and full of air,　　Dead flies and bits"       
## [2677] "of fluff,　　So teach us things worth knowing,　　Bring back what we've"      
## [2678] "forgot,　　just do your best, we'll do the rest,　　And learn until our"      
## [2679] "brains all rot.　　Everybody finished the song at different times. At"        
## [2680] "last, only the Weasley twins were left singing along to a very slow"          
## [2681] "funeral march. Dumbledore conducted their last few lines with his wand"       
## [2682] "and when they had finished, he was one of those who clapped"                  
## [2683] "loudest.　　\"Ah, music,\" he said, wiping his eyes. \"A magic beyond all"    
## [2684] "we do here! And now, bedtime. Off you trot!\"　　The Gryffindor first"        
## [2685] "years followed Percy through the chattering crowds, out of the Great"         
## [2686] "Hall, and up the marble staircase. Harry's legs were like lead again,"        
## [2687] "but only because he was so tired and full of food. He was too sleepy"         
## [2688] "even to be surprised that the people in the portraits along the"              
## [2689] "corridors whispered and pointed as they passed, or that twice Percy led"      
## [2690] "them through doorways hidden behind sliding panels and hanging"               
## [2691] "tapestries. They climbed more staircases, yawning and dragging their"         
## [2692] "feet, and Harry was just wondering how much farther they had to go when"      
## [2693] "they came to a sudden halt.　　A bundle of walking sticks was floating"       
## [2694] "in midair ahead of them, and as Percy took a step toward them they"           
## [2695] "started throwing themselves at him.　　\"Peeves,\" Percy whispered to the"    
## [2696] "first years. \"A poltergeist.\" He raised his voice, \"Peeves -- show"        
## [2697] "yourself\"　　A loud, rude sound, like the air being let out of a"            
## [2698] "balloon, answered.　　\"Do you want me to go to the Bloody"                   
## [2699] "Baron?\"　　There was a pop, and a little man with wicked, dark eyes and"     
## [2700] "a wide mouth appeared, floating cross- legged in the air, clutching the"      
## [2701] "walking sticks.　　\"Oooooooh!\" he said, with an evil cackle. \"Ickle"       
## [2702] "Firsties! What fun!\"　　He swooped suddenly at them. They all"               
## [2703] "ducked.　　\"Go away, Peeves, or the Baron'll hear about this, I mean"        
## [2704] "it!\" barked Percy.　　Peeves stuck out his tongue and vanished,"             
## [2705] "dropping the walking sticks on Neville's head. They heard him zooming"        
## [2706] "away, rattling coats of armor as he passed.　　\"You want to watch out"       
## [2707] "for Peeves,\" said Percy, as they set off again. \"The Bloody Baron's the"    
## [2708] "only one who can control him, he won't even listen to us prefects. Here"      
## [2709] "we are.\"　　At the very end of the corridor hung a portrait of a very"       
## [2710] "fat woman in a pink silk dress.　　\"Password?\" she said. \"Caput"           
## [2711] "Draconis,\" said Percy, and the portrait swung forward to reveal a round"     
## [2712] "hole in the wall. They all scrambled through it -- Neville needed a leg"      
## [2713] "up -- and found themselves in the Gryffindor common room, a cozy, round"      
## [2714] "room full of squashy armchairs.　　Percy directed the girls through one"      
## [2715] "door to their dormitory and the boys through another. At the top of a"        
## [2716] "spiral staircase -- they were obviously in one of the towers -- they"         
## [2717] "found their beds at last: five four-posters hung with deep red, velvet"       
## [2718] "curtains. Their trunks had already been brought up. Too tired to talk"        
## [2719] "much, they pulled on their pajamas and fell into bed.　　\" Great food,"      
## [2720] "isn't it?\" Ron muttered to Harry through the hangings. \"Get off,"           
## [2721] "Scabbers! He's chewing my sheets.\"　　Harry was going to ask Ron if"         
## [2722] "he'd had any of the treacle tart, but he fell asleep almost at"               
## [2723] "once.　　Perhaps Harry had eaten a bit too much, because he had a very"       
## [2724] "strange dream. He was wearing Professor Quirrell's turban, which kept"        
## [2725] "talking to him, telling him he must transfer to Slytherin at once,"           
## [2726] "because it was his destiny. Harry told the turban he didn't want to be"       
## [2727] "in Slytherin; it got heavier and heavier; he tried to pull it off but"        
## [2728] "it tightened painfully -- and there was Malfoy, laughing at him as he"        
## [2729] "struggled with it -then Malfoy turned into the hook-nosed teacher,"           
## [2730] "Snape, whose laugh became high and cold -- there was a burst of green"        
## [2731] "light and Harry woke, sweating and shaking.　　He rolled over and fell"       
## [2732] "asleep again, and when he woke next day, he didn't remember the dream"        
## [2733] "at all.　　 THE POTIONS MASTER　　There, look.\"　　\"Where?\"　　\"Next to"  
## [2734] "the tall kid with the red hair.\"　　\"Wearing the glasses?\"　　\"Did you"   
## [2735] "see his face?\"　　\"Did you see his scar?\"　　Whispers followed Harry"      
## [2736] "from the moment he left his dormitory the next day. People lining up"         
## [2737] "outside classrooms stood on tiptoe to get a look at him, or doubled"          
## [2738] "back to pass him in the corridors again, staring. Harry wished they"          
## [2739] "wouldn't, because he was trying to concentrate on finding his way to"         
## [2740] "classes.　　There were a hundred and forty-two staircases at Hogwarts:"       
## [2741] "wide, sweeping ones; narrow, rickety ones; some that led somewhere"           
## [2742] "different on a Friday; some with a vanishing step halfway up that you"        
## [2743] "had to remember to jump. Then there were doors that wouldn't open"            
## [2744] "unless you asked politely, or tickled them in exactly the right place,"       
## [2745] "and doors that weren't really doors at all, but solid walls just"             
## [2746] "pretending. It was also very hard to remember where anything was,"            
## [2747] "because it all seemed to move around a lot. The people in the portraits"      
## [2748] "kept going to visit each other, and Harry was sure the coats of armor"        
## [2749] "could walk.　　The ghosts didn't help, either. It was always a nasty"         
## [2750] "shock when one of them glided suddenly through a door you were trying"        
## [2751] "to open. Nearly Headless Nick was always happy to point new Gryffindors"      
## [2752] "in the right direction, but Peeves the Poltergeist was worth two locked"      
## [2753] "doors and a trick staircase if you met him when you were late for"            
## [2754] "class. He would drop wastepaper baskets on your head, pull rugs from"         
## [2755] "under your feet, pelt you with bits of chalk, or sneak up behind you,"        
## [2756] "invisible, grab your nose, and screech, \"GOT YOUR CONK!\"　　Even worse"     
## [2757] "than Peeves, if that was possible, was the caretaker, Argus Filch."           
## [2758] "Harry and Ron managed to get on the wrong side of him on their very"          
## [2759] "first morning. Filch found them trying to force their way through a"          
## [2760] "door that unluckily turned out to be the entrance to the out-of-bounds"       
## [2761] "corridor on the third floor. He wouldn't believe they were lost, was"         
## [2762] "sure they were trying to break into it on purpose, and was threatening"       
## [2763] "to lock them in the dungeons when they were rescued by Professor"             
## [2764] "Quirrell, who was passing.　　Filch owned a cat called Mrs. Norris, a"        
## [2765] "scrawny, dust-colored creature with bulging, lamp like eyes just like"        
## [2766] "Filch's. She patrolled the corridors alone. Break a rule in front of"         
## [2767] "her, put just one toe out of line, and she'd whisk off for Filch, who'd"      
## [2768] "appear, wheezing, two seconds later. Filch knew the secret passageways"       
## [2769] "of the school better than anyone (except perhaps the Weasley twins) and"      
## [2770] "could pop up as suddenly as any of the ghosts. The students all hated"        
## [2771] "him, and it was the dearest ambition of many to give Mrs. Norris a good"      
## [2772] "kick.　　And then, once you had managed to find them, there were the"         
## [2773] "classes themselves. There was a lot more to magic, as Harry quickly"          
## [2774] "found out, than waving your wand and saying a few funny words.　　They"       
## [2775] "had to study the night skies through their telescopes every Wednesday"        
## [2776] "at midnight and learn the names of different stars and the movements of"      
## [2777] "the planets. Three times a week they went out to the greenhouses behind"      
## [2778] "the castle to study Herbology, with a dumpy little witch called"              
## [2779] "Professor Sprout, where they learned how to take care of all the"             
## [2780] "strange plants and fungi, and found out what they were used"                  
## [2781] "for.　　Easily the most boring class was History of Magic, which was"         
## [2782] "the only one taught by a ghost. Professor Binns had been very"                
## [2783] "old　　indeed when he had fallen asleep in front of the staff room fire"      
## [2784] "and got up next morning to teach, leaving his body behind him. Binns"         
## [2785] "droned on and on while they scribbled down names and dates, and got"          
## [2786] "Emetic the Evil and Uric the Oddball mixed up.　　Professor Flitwick,"        
## [2787] "the Charms teacher, was a tiny little wizard who had to stand on a pile"      
## [2788] "of books to see over his desk. At the start of their first class he"          
## [2789] "took the roll call, and when he reached Harry's name he gave an excited"      
## [2790] "squeak and toppled out of sight.　　Professor McGonagall was again"           
## [2791] "different. Harry had been quite right to think she wasn't a teacher to"       
## [2792] "cross. Strict and clever, she gave them a talking-to the moment they"         
## [2793] "sat down in her first class.　　\"Transfiguration is some of the most"        
## [2794] "complex and dangerous magic you will learn at Hogwarts,\" she said."          
## [2795] "\"Anyone messing around in my class will leave and not come back. You"        
## [2796] "have been warned.\"　　Then she changed her desk into a pig and back"         
## [2797] "again. They were all very impressed and couldn't wait to get started,"        
## [2798] "but soon realized they weren't going to be changing the furniture into"       
## [2799] "animals for a long time. After taking a lot of complicated notes, they"       
## [2800] "were each given a match and started trying to turn it into a needle. By"      
## [2801] "the end of the lesson, only Hermione Granger had made any difference to"      
## [2802] "her match; Professor McGonagall showed the class how it had gone all"         
## [2803] "silver and pointy and gave Hermione a rare smile.　　The class everyone"      
## [2804] "had really been looking forward to was Defense Against the Dark Arts,"        
## [2805] "but Quirrell's lessons turned out to be a bit of a joke. His classroom"       
## [2806] "smelled strongly of garlic, which everyone said was to ward off a"            
## [2807] "vampire he'd met in Romania and was afraid would be coming back to get"       
## [2808] "him one of these days. His turban, he told them, had been given to him"       
## [2809] "by an African prince as a thank-you for getting rid of a troublesome"         
## [2810] "zombie, but they weren't sure they believed this story. For one thing,"       
## [2811] "when Seamus Finnigan asked eagerly to hear how Quirrell had fought off"       
## [2812] "the zombie, Quirrell went pink and started talking about the weather;"        
## [2813] "for another, they had noticed that a funny smell hung around the"             
## [2814] "turban, and the Weasley twins insisted that it was stuffed full of"           
## [2815] "garlic as well, so that Quirrell was protected wherever he"                   
## [2816] "went.　　Harry was very relieved to find out that he wasn't miles"            
## [2817] "behind everyone else. Lots of people had come from Muggle families and,"      
## [2818] "like him, hadn't had any idea that they were witches and wizards. There"      
## [2819] "was so much to learn that even people like Ron didn't have much of a"         
## [2820] "head start.　　Friday was an important day for Harry and Ron. They"           
## [2821] "finally managed to find their way down to the Great Hall for breakfast"       
## [2822] "without getting lost once.　　\"What have we got today?\" Harry asked Ron"    
## [2823] "as he poured sugar on his porridge.　　\"Double Potions with the"             
## [2824] "Slytherins,\" said Ron. \"Snape's Head of Slytherin House. They say he"       
## [2825] "always favors them -- we'll be able to see if it's true.\"　　\"Wish"         
## [2826] "McGonagall favored us, \" said Harry. Professor McGonagall was head of"       
## [2827] "Gryffindor House, but it hadn't stopped her from giving them a huge"          
## [2828] "pile of homework the day before.　　Just then, the mail arrived. Harry"       
## [2829] "had gotten used to this by now, but it had given him a bit of a shock"        
## [2830] "on the first morning, when about a hundred owls had suddenly streamed"        
## [2831] "into the Great Hall during breakfast, circling the tables until they"         
## [2832] "saw their owners, and dropping letters and packages onto their"               
## [2833] "laps.　　Hedwig hadn't brought Harry anything so far. She sometimes"          
## [2834] "flew in to nibble his ear and have a bit of toast before going off to"        
## [2835] "sleep in the owlery with the other school owls. This morning, however,"       
## [2836] "she fluttered down between the marmalade and the sugar bowl and dropped"      
## [2837] "a note onto Harry's plate. Harry tore it open at once. It said, in a"         
## [2838] "very untidy scrawl:　　Dear Harry,　　I know you get Friday afternoons"       
## [2839] "off, so would you like to come and have a cup of tea with me around"          
## [2840] "three?　　I want to hear all about your first week. Send us an answer"        
## [2841] "back with Hedwig.　　Hagrid　　Harry borrowed Ron's quill, scribbled"         
## [2842] "Yes, please, see you later on the back of the note, and sent Hedwig off"      
## [2843] "again.　　It was lucky that Harry had tea with Hagrid to look forward"        
## [2844] "to, because the Potions lesson turned out to be the worst thing that"         
## [2845] "had happened to him so far.　　At the start-of-term banquet, Harry had"       
## [2846] "gotten the idea that Professor Snape disliked him. By the end of the"         
## [2847] "first Potions lesson, he knew he'd been wrong. Snape didn't dislike"          
## [2848] "Harry -- he hated him.　　Potions lessons took place down in one of the"      
## [2849] "dungeons. It was colder here than up in the main castle, and would have"      
## [2850] "been quite creepy enough without the pickled animals floating in glass"       
## [2851] "jars all around the walls.　　Snape, like Flitwick, started the class"        
## [2852] "by taking the roll call, and like Flitwick, he paused at Harry's"             
## [2853] "name.　　\"Ah, Yes,\" he said softly, \"Harry Potter. Our new --"             
## [2854] "celebrity.\"　　Draco Malfoy and his friends Crabbe and Goyle sniggered"      
## [2855] "behind their hands. Snape finished calling the names and looked up at"        
## [2856] "the class. His eyes were black like Hagrid's, but they had none of"           
## [2857] "Hagrid's warmth. They were cold and empty and made you think of dark"         
## [2858] "tunnels.　　\"You are here to learn the subtle science and exact art of"      
## [2859] "potionmaking,\" he began. He spoke in barely more than a whisper, but"        
## [2860] "they caught every word -- like Professor McGonagall, Snape had y caught"      
## [2861] "every word -- like Professor McGonagall, Snape had the gift of keeping"       
## [2862] "a class silent without effort. \"As there is little foolish wand-waving"      
## [2863] "here, many of you will hardly believe this is magic. I don't expect you"      
## [2864] "will really understand the beauty of the softly simmering cauldron with"      
## [2865] "its shimmering fumes, the delicate power of liquids that creep through"       
## [2866] "human veins, bewitching the mind, ensnaring the senses.... I can teach"       
## [2867] "you how to bottle fame, brew glory, even stopper death -- if you aren't"      
## [2868] "as big a bunch of dunderheads as I usually have to teach.\"　　More"          
## [2869] "silence followed this little speech. Harry and Ron exchanged looks with"      
## [2870] "raised eyebrows. Hermione Granger was on the edge of her seat and"            
## [2871] "looked desperate to start proving that she wasn't a"                          
## [2872] "dunderhead.　　\"Potter!\" said Snape suddenly. \"What would I get if I"      
## [2873] "added powdered root of asphodel to an infusion of"                            
## [2874] "wormwood?\"　　Powdered root of what to an infusion of what? Harry"           
## [2875] "glanced at Ron, who looked as stumped as he was; Hermione's hand had"         
## [2876] "shot into the air.　　\"I don't know, sit,\" said Harry.　　Snape's lips"     
## [2877] "curled into a sneer.　　\"Tut, tut -- fame clearly isn't"                     
## [2878] "everything.\"　　He ignored Hermione's hand.　　\"Let's try again."           
## [2879] "Potter, where would you look if I told you to find me a"                      
## [2880] "bezoar?\"　　Hermione stretched her hand as high into the air as it"          
## [2881] "would go without her leaving her seat, but Harry didn't have the"             
## [2882] "faintest idea what a bezoar was. He tried not to look at Malfoy,"             
## [2883] "Crabbe, and Goyle, who were shaking with laughter.　　\"I don't know,"        
## [2884] "sit.\" \"Thought you wouldn't open a book before coming, eh, Potter?\""       
## [2885] "Harry forced himself to keep looking straight into those cold eyes. He"       
## [2886] "had looked through his books at the Dursleys', but did Snape expect him"      
## [2887] "to remember everything in One Thousand Magical Herbs and"                     
## [2888] "Fungi?　　Snape was still ignoring Hermione's quivering hand.　　\"What"      
## [2889] "is the difference, Potter, between monkshood and wolfsbane?\"　　At"          
## [2890] "this, Hermione stood up, her hand stretching toward the dungeon"              
## [2891] "ceiling.　　\"I don't know,\" said Harry quietly. \"I think Hermione does,"   
## [2892] "though, why don't you try her?\"　　A few people laughed; Harry caught"       
## [2893] "Seamus's eye, and Seamus winked. Snape, however, was not"                     
## [2894] "pleased.　　\"Sit down,\" he snapped at Hermione. \"For your information,"    
## [2895] "Potter, asphodel and wormwood make a sleeping potion so powerful it is"       
## [2896] "known as the Draught of Living Death. A bezoar is a stone taken from"         
## [2897] "the stomach of a goat and it will save you from most poisons. As for"         
## [2898] "monkshood and wolfsbane, they are the same plant, which also goes by"         
## [2899] "the name of aconite. Well? Why aren't you all copying that"                   
## [2900] "down?\"　　There was a sudden rummaging for quills and parchment. Over"       
## [2901] "the noise, Snape said, \"And a point will be taken from Gryffindor House"     
## [2902] "for your cheek, Potter.\"　　Things didn't improve for the Gryffindors"       
## [2903] "as the Potions lesson continued. Snape put them all into pairs and set"       
## [2904] "them to mixing up a simple potion to cure boils. He swept around in his"      
## [2905] "long black cloak, watching them weigh dried nettles and crush snake"          
## [2906] "fangs, criticizing almost everyone except Malfoy, whom he seemed to"          
## [2907] "like. He was just telling everyone to look at the perfect way Malfoy"         
## [2908] "had stewed his horned slugs when clouds of acid green smoke and a loud"       
## [2909] "hissing filled the dungeon. Neville had somehow managed to melt"              
## [2910] "Seamus's cauldron into a twisted blob, and their potion was seeping"          
## [2911] "across the stone floor, burning holes in people's shoes. Within"              
## [2912] "seconds, the whole class was standing on their stools while Neville,"         
## [2913] "who had been drenched in the potion when the cauldron collapsed, moaned"      
## [2914] "in pain as angry red boils sprang up all over his arms and"                   
## [2915] "legs.　　\"Idiot boy!\" snarled Snape, clearing the spilled potion away"      
## [2916] "with one wave of his wand. \"I suppose you added the porcupine quills"        
## [2917] "before taking the cauldron off the fire?\"　　Neville whimpered as boils"     
## [2918] "started to pop up all over his nose.　　\"Take him up to the hospital"        
## [2919] "wing,\" Snape spat at Seamus. Then he rounded on Harry and Ron, who had"      
## [2920] "been working next to Neville.　　\"You -- Potter -- why didn't you tell"      
## [2921] "him not to add the quills? Thought he'd make you look good if he got it"      
## [2922] "wrong, did you? That's another point you've lost for"                         
## [2923] "Gryffindor.\"　　This was so unfair that Harry opened his mouth to"           
## [2924] "argue, but Ron kicked him behind their cauldron.　　\"Doi* push it,\" he"     
## [2925] "muttered, \"I've heard Snape can turn very nasty.\"　　As they climbed"       
## [2926] "the steps out of the dungeon an hour later, Harry's mind was racing and"      
## [2927] "his spirits were low. He'd lost two points for Gryffindor in his very"        
## [2928] "first week -- why did Snape hate him so much? \"Cheer up,\" said Ron,"        
## [2929] "\"Snape's always taking points off Fred and George. Can I come and meet"      
## [2930] "Hagrid with you?\"　　At five to three they left the castle and made"         
## [2931] "their way across the grounds. Hagrid lived in a small wooden house on"        
## [2932] "the edge of the forbidden forest. A crossbow and a pair of galoshes"          
## [2933] "were outside the front door.　　When Harry knocked they heard a frantic"      
## [2934] "scrabbling from inside and several booming barks. Then Hagrid's voice"        
## [2935] "rang out, saying, \"Back, Fang -- back.\"　　Hagrid's big, hairy face"        
## [2936] "appeared in the crack as he pulled the door open.　　\"Hang on,\" he"         
## [2937] "said. \"Back, Fang.\"　　He let them in, struggling to keep a hold on the"    
## [2938] "collar of an enormous black boarhound.　　There was only one room"            
## [2939] "inside. Hams and pheasants were hanging from the ceiling, a copper"           
## [2940] "kettle was boiling on the open fire, and in the corner stood a massive"       
## [2941] "bed with a patchwork quilt over it.　　\"Make yerselves at home,\" said"      
## [2942] "Hagrid, letting go of Fang, who bounded straight at Ron and started"          
## [2943] "licking his ears. Like Hagrid, Fang was clearly not as fierce as he"          
## [2944] "looked.　　\"This is Ron,\" Harry told Hagrid, who was pouring boiling"       
## [2945] "water into a large teapot and putting rock cakes onto a"                      
## [2946] "plate.　　\"Another Weasley, eh?\" said Hagrid, glancing at Ron's"            
## [2947] "freckles. I spent half me life chasin' yer twin brothers away from the"       
## [2948] "forest.\"　　The rock cakes were shapeless lumps with raisins that"           
## [2949] "almost broke their teeth, but Harry and Ron pretended to be enjoying"         
## [2950] "them as they told Hagrid all about their first -lessons. Fang rested"         
## [2951] "his head on Harry's knee and drooled all over his robes.　　Harry and"        
## [2952] "Ron were delighted to hear Hagrid call Fitch \"that old git.\"　　\"An' as"   
## [2953] "fer that cat, Mrs. Norris, I'd like ter introduce her to Fang sometime."      
## [2954] "D'yeh know, every time I go up ter the school, she follows me"                
## [2955] "everywhere? Can't get rid of her -- Fitch puts her up to it.\"　　Harry"      
## [2956] "told Hagrid about Snape's lesson. Hagrid, like Ron, told Harry not to"        
## [2957] "worry about it, that Snape liked hardly any of the students.　　\"But he"     
## [2958] "seemed to really hate me.\"　　\"Rubbish!\" said Hagrid. \"Why should"        
## [2959] "he?\"　　Yet Harry couldn't help thinking that Hagrid didn't quite meet"      
## [2960] "his eyes when he said that.　　\"How's yer brother Charlie?\" Hagrid"         
## [2961] "asked Ron. \"I liked him a lot -- great with animals.\"　　Harry wondered"    
## [2962] "if Hagrid had changed the subject on purpose. While Ron told Hagrid all"      
## [2963] "about Charlie's work with dragons, Harry picked up a piece of paper"          
## [2964] "that was lying on the table under the tea cozy. It was a cutting from"        
## [2965] "the Daily Prophet:　　GRINGOTTS BREAK-IN LATEST　　Investigations"            
## [2966] "continue into the break-in at Gringotts on 31 July, widely believed to"       
## [2967] "be the work of Dark wizards or witches unknown.　　Gringotts goblins"         
## [2968] "today insisted that nothing had been taken. The vault that was searched"      
## [2969] "had in fact been emptied the same day.　　\"But we're not telling you"        
## [2970] "what was in there, so keep your noses out if you know what's good for"        
## [2971] "you,\" said a Gringotts spokesgoblin this afternoon.　　Harry remembered"     
## [2972] "Ron telling him on the train that someone had tried to rob Gringotts,"        
## [2973] "but Ron hadn't mentioned the date.　　\"Hagrid!\" said Harry, \"that"         
## [2974] "Gringotts break-in happened on my birthday! It might've been happening"       
## [2975] "while we were there!\"　　There was no doubt about it, Hagrid definitely"     
## [2976] "didn't meet Harry's eyes this time. He grunted and offered him another"       
## [2977] "rock cake. Harry read the story again. The vault that was searched had"       
## [2978] "in fact been emptied earlier that same day. Hagrid had emptied vault"         
## [2979] "seven hundred and thirteen, if you could call it emptying, taking out"        
## [2980] "that grubby little package. Had that been what the thieves were looking"      
## [2981] "for?　　As Harry and Ron walked back to the castle for dinner, their"         
## [2982] "pockets weighed down with rock cakes they'd been too polite to refuse,"       
## [2983] "Harry thought that none of the lessons he'd had so far had given him as"      
## [2984] "much to think about as tea with Hagrid. Had Hagrid collected that"            
## [2985] "package just in time? Where was it now? And did Hagrid know something"        
## [2986] "about Snape that he didn't want to tell Harry?　　 THE MIDNIGHT"              
## [2987] "DUEL　　Harry had never believed he would meet a boy he hated more than"      
## [2988] "Dudley, but that was before he met Draco Malfoy.　　 Still, first-year"       
## [2989] "Gryffindors only had Potions with the Slytherins, so they didn't have"        
## [2990] "to put up with Malfoy much. Or at least, they didn't until they spotted"      
## [2991] "a notice pinned up in the Gryffindor common room that made them all"          
## [2992] "groan. Flying lessons would be starting on Thursday -- and Gryffindor"        
## [2993] "and Slytherin would be learning together.　　\"Typical,\" said Harry"         
## [2994] "darkly. \"Just what I always wanted. To make a fool of myself on a"           
## [2995] "broomstick in front of Malfoy.\"　　He had been looking forward to"           
## [2996] "learning to fly more than anything else.　　\"You don't know that you'll"     
## [2997] "make a fool of yourself,\" said Ron reasonably. \"Anyway, I know Malfoy's"    
## [2998] "always going on about how good he is at Quidditch, but I bet that's all"      
## [2999] "talk.\"　　Malfay certainly did talk about flying a lot. He complained"       
## [3000] "loudly about first years never getting on the house Quidditch teams and"      
## [3001] "told long, boastful stories that always seemed to end with him narrowly"      
## [3002] "escaping Muggles in helicopters. He wasn't the only one, though: the"         
## [3003] "way Seamus Finnigan told it, he'd spent most of his childhood zooming"        
## [3004] "around the countryside on his broomstick. Even Ron would tell anyone"         
## [3005] "who'd listen about the time he'd almost hit a hang glider on Charlie's"       
## [3006] "old broom. Everyone from wizarding families talked about Quidditch"           
## [3007] "constantly. Ron had already had a big argument with Dean Thomas, who"         
## [3008] "shared their dormitory, about soccer. Ron couldn't see what was"              
## [3009] "exciting about a game with only one ball where no one was allowed to"         
## [3010] "fly. Harry had caught Ron prodding Dean's poster of West Ham soccer"          
## [3011] "team, trying to make the players move.　　Neville had never been on a"        
## [3012] "broomstick in his life, because his grandmother had never let him near"       
## [3013] "one. Privately, Harry felt she'd had good reason, because Neville"            
## [3014] "managed to have an extraordinary number of accidents even with both"          
## [3015] "feet on the ground.　　Hermione Granger was almost as nervous about"          
## [3016] "flying as Neville was. This was something you couldn't learn by heart"        
## [3017] "out of a book -- not that she hadn't tried. At breakfast on Thursday"         
## [3018] "she bored them all stupid with flying tips she'd gotten out of a"             
## [3019] "library book called Quidditch Through the Ages. Neville was hanging on"       
## [3020] "to her every word, desperate for anything that might help him hang on"        
## [3021] "to his broomstick later, but everybody else was very pleased when"            
## [3022] "Hermione's lecture was interrupted by the arrival of the mail.　　Harry"      
## [3023] "hadn't had a single letter since Hagrid's note, something that Malfoy"        
## [3024] "had been quick to notice, of course. Malfoy's eagle owl was always"           
## [3025] "bringing him packages of sweets from home, which he opened gloatingly"        
## [3026] "at the Slytherin table.　　A barn owl brought Neville a small package"        
## [3027] "from his grandmother. He opened it excitedly and showed them a glass"         
## [3028] "ball the size of a large marble, which seemed to be full of white"            
## [3029] "smoke.　　\"It's a Remembrall!\" he explained. \"Gran knows I forget"         
## [3030] "things -- this tells you if there's something you've forgotten to do."        
## [3031] "Look, you hold it tight like this and if it turns red -- oh...\" His"         
## [3032] "face fell, because the Remembrall had suddenly glowed"                        
## [3033] "scarlet,　　\"You've forgotten something...\"　　Neville was trying to"       
## [3034] "remember what he'd forgotten when Draco Malfoy, who was passing the"          
## [3035] "Gryffindor table, snatched the Remembrall out of his hand.　　Harry and"      
## [3036] "Ron jumped to their feet. They were half hoping for a reason to fight"        
## [3037] "Malfay, but Professor McGonagall, who could spot trouble quicker than"        
## [3038] "any teacher in the school, was there in a flash.　　\"What's going"           
## [3039] "on?\"　　\"Malfoy's got my Remembrall, Professor.\"　　Scowling, Malfoy"      
## [3040] "quickly dropped the Remembrall back on the table.　　\"Just looking,\" he"    
## [3041] "said, and he sloped away with Crabbe and Goyle behind him.　　At"             
## [3042] "three-thirty that afternoon, Harry, Ron, and the other Gryffindors"           
## [3043] "hurried down the front steps onto the grounds for their first flying"         
## [3044] "lesson. It was a clear, breezy day, and the grass rippled under their"        
## [3045] "feet as they marched down the sloping lawns toward a smooth, flat lawn"       
## [3046] "on the opposite side of the grounds to the forbidden forest, whose"           
## [3047] "trees were swaying darkly in the distance.　　The Slytherins were"            
## [3048] "already there, and so were twenty broomsticks lying in neat lines on"         
## [3049] "the ground. Harry had heard Fred and George Weasley complain about the"       
## [3050] "school brooms, saying that some of them started to vibrate if you flew"       
## [3051] "too high, or always flew slightly to the left.　　Their teacher, Madam"       
## [3052] "Hooch, arrived. She had short, gray hair, and yellow eyes like a"             
## [3053] "hawk.　　\"Well, what are you all waiting for?\" she barked. \"Everyone"      
## [3054] "stand by a broomstick. Come on, hurry up.\"　　Harry glanced down at his"     
## [3055] "broom. It was old and some of the twigs stuck out at odd"                     
## [3056] "angles.　　\"Stick out your right hand over your broom,\" called Madam"       
## [3057] "Hooch at the front, \"and say 'Up!\"'　　\"UPF everyone"                      
## [3058] "shouted.　　Harry's broom jumped into his hand at once, but it was one"       
## [3059] "of the few that did. Hermione Granger's had simply rolled over on the"        
## [3060] "ground, and Neville's hadn't moved at all. Perhaps brooms, like horses,"      
## [3061] "could tell when you were afraid, thought Harry; there was a quaver in"        
## [3062] "Neville's voice that said only too clearly that he wanted to keep his"        
## [3063] "feet on the ground.　　Madam Hooch then showed them how to mount their"       
## [3064] "brooms without sliding off the end, and walked up and down the rows"          
## [3065] "correcting their grips. Harry and Ron were delighted when she told"           
## [3066] "Malfoy he'd been doing it wrong for years.　　\"Now, when I blow my"          
## [3067] "whistle, you kick off from the ground, hard,\" said Madam Hooch. \"Keep"      
## [3068] "your brooms steady, rise a few feet, and then come straight back down"        
## [3069] "by leaning forward slightly. On my whistle -- three -- two --\"　　But"       
## [3070] "Neville, nervous and jumpy and frightened of being left on the ground,"       
## [3071] "pushed off hard before the whistle had touched Madam Hooch's"                 
## [3072] "lips.　　\"Come back, boy!\" she shouted, but Neville was rising straight"    
## [3073] "up like a cork shot out of a bottle -- twelve feet -- twenty feet."           
## [3074] "Harry saw his scared white face look down at the ground falling away,"        
## [3075] "saw him gasp, slip sideways off the broom and --　　WHAM -- a thud and"       
## [3076] "a nasty crack and Neville lay facedown on the grass in a heap. His"           
## [3077] "broomstick was still rising higher and higher, and started to drift"          
## [3078] "lazily toward the forbidden forest and out of sight.　　Madam Hooch was"      
## [3079] "bending over Neville, her face as white as his.　　\"Broken wrist,\""         
## [3080] "Harry heard her mutter. \"Come on, boy -- it's all right, up you"             
## [3081] "get.\".　　She turned to the rest of the class.　　\"None of you is to"       
## [3082] "move while I take this boy to the hospital wing! You leave those brooms"      
## [3083] "where they are or you'll be out of Hogwarts before you can say"               
## [3084] "'Quidditch.' Come on, dear.\"　　Neville, his face tear-streaked,"            
## [3085] "clutching his wrist, hobbled off with Madam Hooch, who had her arm"           
## [3086] "around him.　　No sooner were they out of earshot than Malfoy burst"          
## [3087] "into laughter.　　\"Did you see his face, the great lump?\"　　The other"     
## [3088] "Slytherins joined in.　　\"Shut up, Malfoy,\" snapped Parvati"                
## [3089] "Patil.　　\"Ooh, sticking up for Longbottom?\" said Pansy Parkinson, a"       
## [3090] "hard-faced Slytherin girl. \"Never thought you'd like fat little"             
## [3091] "crybabies, Parvati.\"　　\"Look!\" said Malfoy, darting forward and"          
## [3092] "snatching something out of the grass. \"It's that stupid thing"               
## [3093] "Longbottom's gran sent him.\"　　The Remembrall glittered in the sun as"      
## [3094] "he held it up.　　\"Give that here, Malfoy,\" said Harry quietly."            
## [3095] "Everyone stopped talking to watch.　　Malfoy smiled nastily.　　\"I"          
## [3096] "think I'll leave it somewhere for Longbottom to find -- how about -- up"      
## [3097] "a tree?\"　　\"Give it here!\" Harry yelled, but Malfoy had leapt onto his"   
## [3098] "broomstick and taken off. He hadn't been lying, he could fly well."           
## [3099] "Hovering level with the topmost branches of an oak he called, \"Come and"     
## [3100] "get it, Potter!\"　　Harry grabbed his broom.　　\"No!\" shouted Hermione"    
## [3101] "Granger. \"Madam Hooch told us not to move -- you'll get us all into"         
## [3102] "trouble.\"　　Harry ignored her. Blood was pounding in his ears. He"          
## [3103] "mounted the broom and kicked hard against the ground and up, up he"           
## [3104] "soared; air rushed through his hair, and his robes whipped out behind"        
## [3105] "him -and in a rush of fierce joy he realized he'd found something he"         
## [3106] "could do without being taught -- this was easy, this was wonderful. He"       
## [3107] "pulled his broomstick up a little to take it even higher, and heard"          
## [3108] "screams and gasps of girls back on the ground and an admiring whoop"          
## [3109] "from Ron.　　He turned his broomstick sharply to face Malfoy in midair."      
## [3110] "Malfoy looked stunned.　　\"Give it here,\" Harry called, \"or I'll knock"    
## [3111] "you off that broom!\" \"Oh, yeah?\" said Malfoy, trying to sneer, but"        
## [3112] "looking worried.　　Harry knew, somehow, what to do. He leaned forward"       
## [3113] "and grasped the broom tightly in both hands, and it shot toward Malfay"       
## [3114] "like a javelin. Malfoy only just got out of the way in time; Harry made"      
## [3115] "a sharp about-face and held the broom steady. A few people below were"        
## [3116] "clapping.　　\"No Crabbe and Goyle up here to save your neck, Malfoy,\""      
## [3117] "Harry called.　　The same thought seemed to have struck"                      
## [3118] "Malfoy.　　\"Catch it if you can, then!\" he shouted, and he threw the"       
## [3119] "glass ball high into the air and streaked back toward the"                    
## [3120] "ground.　　Harry saw, as though in slow motion, the ball rise up in the"      
## [3121] "air and then start to fall. He leaned forward and pointed his broom"          
## [3122] "handle down -- next second he was gathering speed in a steep dive,"           
## [3123] "racing the ball -- wind whistled in his ears, mingled with the screams"       
## [3124] "of people watching -- he stretched out his hand -- a foot from the"           
## [3125] "ground he caught it, just in time to pull his broom straight, and he"         
## [3126] "toppled gently onto the grass with the Remembrall clutched safely in"         
## [3127] "his fist.　　\"HARRY POTTER!\"　　His heart sank faster than he'd just"       
## [3128] "dived. Professor McGonagall was running toward them. He got to his"           
## [3129] "feet, trembling.　　\"Never -- in all my time at Hogwarts"                    
## [3130] "--\"　　Professor McGonagall was almost speechless with shock, and her"       
## [3131] "glasses flashed furiously, \"-- how dare you -- might have broken your"       
## [3132] "neck --\"　　\"It wasn't his fault, Professor --\"　　\"Be quiet, Miss"       
## [3133] "Patil　　\"But Malfoy --\"　　\"That's enough, Mr. Weasley. Potter, follow"   
## [3134] "me, now.\"　　Harry caught sight of Malfoy, Crabbe, and Goyle's"              
## [3135] "triumphant faces as he left, walking numbly in Professor McGonagall's"        
## [3136] "wake as she strode toward the castle. He was going to be expelled, he"        
## [3137] "just knew it. He wanted to say something to defend himself, but there"        
## [3138] "seemed to be something wrong with his voice. Professor McGonagall was"        
## [3139] "sweeping along without even looking at him; he had to jog to keep up."        
## [3140] "Now he'd done it. He hadn't even lasted two weeks. He'd be packing his"       
## [3141] "bags in ten minutes. What would the Dursleys say when he turned up on"        
## [3142] "the doorstep?　　Up the front steps, up the marble staircase inside,"         
## [3143] "and still Professor McGonagall didn't say a word to him. She wrenched"        
## [3144] "open doors and marched along corridors with Harry trotting miserably"         
## [3145] "behind her. Maybe she was taking him to Dumbledore. He thought of"            
## [3146] "Hagrid, expelled but allowed to stay on as gamekeeper. Perhaps he could"      
## [3147] "be Hagrid's assistant. His stomach twisted as he imagined it, watching"       
## [3148] "Ron and the others becoming wizards, while he stumped around the"             
## [3149] "grounds carrying Hagrid's bag.　　Professor McGonagall stopped outside"       
## [3150] "a classroom. She opened the door and poked her head inside.　　\"Excuse"      
## [3151] "me, Professor Flitwick, could I borrow Wood for a moment?\"　　Wood?"         
## [3152] "thought Harry, bewildered; was Wood a cane she was going to use on"           
## [3153] "him?　　But Wood turned out to be a person, a burly fifth-year boy who"       
## [3154] "came out of Flitwicles class looking confused.　　\"Follow me, you two,\""    
## [3155] "said Professor McGonagall, and they marched on up the corridor, Wood"         
## [3156] "looking curiously at Harry.　　\"In here.\"　　 Professor McGonagall"         
## [3157] "pointed them into a classroom that was empty except for Peeves, who was"      
## [3158] "busy writing rude words on the blackboard.　　\"Out, Peeves!\" she"           
## [3159] "barked. Peeves threw the chalk into a bin, which clanged loudly, and he"      
## [3160] "swooped out cursing. Professor McGonagall slammed the door behind him"        
## [3161] "and turned to face the two boys.　　\"Potter, this is Oliver Wood. Wood"      
## [3162] "-- I've found you a Seeker.\"　　Wood's expression changed from"              
## [3163] "puzzlement to delight.　　\"Are you serious,"                                 
## [3164] "Professor?\"　　\"Absolutely,\" said Professor McGonagall crisply. \"The"     
## [3165] "boy's a natural. I've never seen anything like it. Was that your first"       
## [3166] "time on a broomstick, Potter?\"　　Harry nodded silently. He didn't have"     
## [3167] "a clue what was going on, but he didn't seem to be being expelled, and"       
## [3168] "some of the feeling started coming back to his legs.　　\"He caught that"     
## [3169] "thing in his hand after a fifty-foot dive,\" Professor McGonagall told"       
## [3170] "Wood. \"Didn't even scratch himself. Charlie Weasley couldn't have done"      
## [3171] "it.\"　　 Wood was now looking as though all his dreams had come true at"     
## [3172] "once.　　\"Ever seen a game of Quidditch, Potter?\" he asked"                 
## [3173] "excitedly.　　\"Wood's captain of the Gryffindor team,\" Professor"           
## [3174] "McGonagall explained.　　\"He's just the build for a Seeker, too,\" said"     
## [3175] "Wood, now walking around Harry and staring at him. \"Light -- speedy --"      
## [3176] "we'll have to get him a decent broom, Professor -- a Nimbus Two"              
## [3177] "Thousand or a Cleansweep Seven, I'd say.\"　　I shall speak to Professor"     
## [3178] "Dumbledore and see if we can't bend the first-year rule. Heaven knows,"       
## [3179] "we need a better team than last year. Flattened in that last match by"        
## [3180] "Slytherin, I couldn't look Severus Snape in the face for"                     
## [3181] "weeks....\"　　Professor McGonagall peered sternly over her glasses at"       
## [3182] "Harry.　　\"I want to hear you're training hard, Potter, or I may change"     
## [3183] "my mind about punishing you.\"　　Then she suddenly smiled.　　\"Your"        
## [3184] "father would have been proud,\" she said. \"He was an excellent Quidditch"    
## [3185] "player himself.\"　　\"You're joking.\"　　It was dinnertime. Harry had"      
## [3186] "just finished telling Ron what had happened when he'd left the grounds"       
## [3187] "with Professor McGonagall. Ron had a piece of steak and kidney pie"           
## [3188] "halfway to his mouth, but he'd forgotten all about it.　　\"Seeker?\" he"     
## [3189] "said. \"But first years never -- you must be the youngest house player"       
## [3190] "in about a century, said Harry, shoveling pie into his mouth. He felt"        
## [3191] "particularly hungry after the excitement of the afternoon. \"Wood told"       
## [3192] "me.\"　　Ron was so amazed, so impressed, he just sat and gaped at"           
## [3193] "Harry.　　\"I start training next week,\" said Harry. \"Only don't tell"      
## [3194] "anyone, Wood wants to keep it a secret.\"　　Fred and George Weasley now"     
## [3195] "came into the hall, spotted Harry, and hurried over.　　\"Well done,\""       
## [3196] "said George in a low voice. \"Wood told us. We're on the team too --"         
## [3197] "Beaters.\"　　\"I tell you, we're going to win that Quidditch cup for"        
## [3198] "sure this year,\" said Fred. \"We haven't won since Charlie left, but"        
## [3199] "this year's team is going to be brilliant. You must be good, Harry,"          
## [3200] "Wood was almost skipping when he told us.\"　　\"Anyway, we've got to go,"    
## [3201] "Lee Jordan reckons he's found a new secret passageway out of the"             
## [3202] "school.\"　　\"Bet it's that one behind the statue of Gregory the Smarmy"     
## [3203] "that we found in our first week. See you.\"　　Fred and George had"           
## [3204] "hardly disappeared when someone far less welcome turned up: Malfoy,"          
## [3205] "flanked by Crabbe and Goyle.　　\"Having a last meal, Potter? When are"       
## [3206] "you getting the train back to the Muggles?\"　　\"You're a lot braver now"    
## [3207] "that you're back on the ground and you've got your little friends with"       
## [3208] "you,\" said Harry coolly. There was of course nothing at all little"          
## [3209] "about Crabbe and Goyle, but as the High Table was full of teachers,"          
## [3210] "neither of them could do more than crack their knuckles and"                  
## [3211] "scowl.　　\"I'd take you on anytime on my own,\" said Malfoy. \"Tonight,"     
## [3212] "if you want. Wizard's duel. Wands only -- no contact. What's the"             
## [3213] "matter? Never heard of a wizard's duel before, I suppose?\"　　\"Of"          
## [3214] "course he has,\" said Ron, wheeling around. \"I'm his second, who's"          
## [3215] "yours?\"　　Malfoy looked at Crabbe and Goyle, sizing them"                   
## [3216] "up.　　\"Crabbe,\" he said. \"Midnight all right? We'll meet you in the"      
## [3217] "trophy room; that's always unlocked.\"　　When Malfoy had gone, Ron and"      
## [3218] "Harry looked at each other. \"What is a wizard's duel?\" said Harry. \"And"   
## [3219] "what do you mean, you're my second?\"　　\"Well, a second's there to take"    
## [3220] "over if you die,\" said Ron casually, getting started at last on his"         
## [3221] "cold pie. Catching the look on Harry's face, he added quickly, \"But"         
## [3222] "people only die in proper duels, you know, with real wizards. The most"       
## [3223] "you and Malfoy'll be able to do is send sparks at each other. Neither"        
## [3224] "of you knows enough magic to do any real damage. I bet he expected you"       
## [3225] "to refuse, anyway.\"　　\"And what if I wave my wand and nothing"             
## [3226] "happens?\"　　\"Throw it away and punch him on the nose,\" Ron suggested."    
## [3227] "\"Excuse me.\"　　They both looked up. It was Hermione Granger.　　\"Can't"   
## [3228] "a person eat in peace in this place?\" said Ron.　　Hermione ignored him"     
## [3229] "and spoke to Harry.　　\"I couldn't help overhearing what you and Malfoy"     
## [3230] "were saying --\"　　\"Bet you could,\" Ron muttered.　　\"--and you mustn't"  
## [3231] "go wandering around the school at night, think of the points you'll"          
## [3232] "lose Gryffindor if you're caught, and you're bound to be. It's really"        
## [3233] "very selfish of you.\"　　\"And it's really none of your business,\" said"    
## [3234] "Harry.　　\"Good-bye,\" said Ron.　　All the same, it wasn't what you'd"      
## [3235] "call the perfect end to the day, Harry thought, as he lay awake much"         
## [3236] "later listening to Dean and Seamus falling asleep (Neville wasn't back"       
## [3237] "from the hospital wing). Ron had spent all evening giving him advice"         
## [3238] "such as \"If he tries to curse you, you'd better dodge it, because I"         
## [3239] "can't remember how to block them.\" There was a very good chance they"        
## [3240] "were going to get caught by Filch or Mrs. Norris, and Harry felt he was"      
## [3241] "pushing his luck, breaking another school rule today. On the other"           
## [3242] "hand, Malfoys sneering face kept looming up out of the darkness - this"       
## [3243] "was his big chance to beat Malfoy face-to-face. He couldn't miss"             
## [3244] "it.　　\"Half-past eleven,\" Ron muttered at last, \"we'd better"             
## [3245] "go.\"　　They pulled on their bathrobes, picked up their wands, and"          
## [3246] "crept across the tower room, down the spiral staircase, and into the"         
## [3247] "Gryffindor common room. A few embers were still glowing in the"               
## [3248] "fireplace, turning all the armchairs into hunched black shadows. They"        
## [3249] "had almost reached the portrait hole when a voice spoke from the chair"       
## [3250] "nearest them, \"I can't believe you're going to do this, Harry.\"　　A"       
## [3251] "lamp flickered on. It was Hermione Granger, wearing a pink bathrobe and"      
## [3252] "a frown.　　\"You!\" said Ron furiously. \"Go back to bed!\"　　\"I almost"   
## [3253] "told your brother,\" Hermione snapped, \"Percy -- he's a prefect, he'd"       
## [3254] "put a stop to this.\"　　Harry couldn't believe anyone could be so"           
## [3255] "interfering.　　\"Come on,\" he said to Ron. He pushed open the portrait"     
## [3256] "of the Fat Lady and climbed through the hole.　　Hermione wasn't going"       
## [3257] "to give up that easily. She followed Ron through the portrait hole,"          
## [3258] "hissing at them like an angry goose.　　\"Don't you care about"               
## [3259] "Gryffindor, do you only care about yourselves, I don't want Slytherin"        
## [3260] "to win the house cup, and you'll lose all the points I got from"              
## [3261] "Professor McGonagall for knowing about Switching Spells.\"　　\"Go away.\""   
## [3262] "\"All right, but I warned you, you just remember what I said when you're"     
## [3263] "on the train home tomorrow, you're so --\"　　But what they were, they"       
## [3264] "didn't find out. Hermione had turned to the portrait of the Fat Lady to"      
## [3265] "get back inside and found herself facing an empty painting. The Fat"          
## [3266] "Lady had gone on a nighttime visit and Hermione was locked out of"            
## [3267] "Gryffindor tower.　　\"Now what am I going to do?\" she asked"                
## [3268] "shrilly.　　\"That's your problem,\" said Ron. \"We've got to go, we 3 re"    
## [3269] "going to be late.\"　　They hadn't even reached the end of the corridor"      
## [3270] "when Hermione caught up with them.　　\"I'm coming with you,\" she"           
## [3271] "said.　　\"You are not.\"　　\"D'you think I'm going to stand out here and"   
## [3272] "wait for Filch to catch me? If he finds all three of us I'll tell him"        
## [3273] "the truth, that I was trying to stop you, and you can back me"                
## [3274] "up.\"　　\"You've got some nerve --\" said Ron loudly.　　\"Shut up, both"    
## [3275] "of you!\" said Harry sharply. I heard something.\"　　It was a sort of"       
## [3276] "snuffling.　　\"Mrs. Norris?\" breathed Ron, squinting through the"           
## [3277] "dark.　　It wasn't Mrs. Norris. It was Neville. He was curled up on the"      
## [3278] "floor, fast asleep, but jerked suddenly awake as they crept"                  
## [3279] "nearer.　　\"Thank goodness you found me! I've been out here for hours,"      
## [3280] "I couldn't remember the new password to get in to bed.\"　　\"Keep your"      
## [3281] "voice down, Neville. The password's 'Pig snout' but it won't help you"        
## [3282] "now, the Fat Lady's gone off somewhere.\"　　\"How's your arm?\" said"        
## [3283] "Harry.　　\"Fine,\" said Neville, showing them. \"Madam Pomfrey mended it"    
## [3284] "in about a minute.\"　　\"Good - well, look, Neville, we've got to be"        
## [3285] "somewhere, we'll see you later --\"　　\"Don't leave me!\" said Neville,"     
## [3286] "scrambling to his feet, \"I don't want to stay here alone, the Bloody"        
## [3287] "Baron's been past twice already.\"　　Ron looked at his watch and then"       
## [3288] "glared furiously at Hermione and Neville.　　\"If either of you get us"       
## [3289] "caught, I'll never rest until I've learned that Curse of the Bogies"          
## [3290] "Quirrell told us about, and used it on you.　　Hermione opened her"           
## [3291] "mouth, perhaps to tell Ron exactly how to use the Curse of the Bogies,"       
## [3292] "but Harry hissed at her to be quiet and beckoned them all"                    
## [3293] "forward.　　They flitted along corridors striped with bars of moonlight"      
## [3294] "from the high windows. At every turn Harry expected to run into Filch"        
## [3295] "or Mrs. Norris, but they were lucky. They sped up a staircase to the"         
## [3296] "third floor and tiptoed toward the trophy room.　　Malfoy and Crabbe"         
## [3297] "weren't there yet. The crystal trophy cases glimmered where the"              
## [3298] "moonlight caught them. Cups, shields, plates, and statues winked silver"      
## [3299] "and gold in the darkness. They edged along the walls, keeping their"          
## [3300] "eyes on the doors at either end of the room. Harry took out his wand in"      
## [3301] "case Malfoy leapt in and started at once. The minutes crept"                  
## [3302] "by.　　\"He's late, maybe he's chickened out,\" Ron whispered.　　Then a"     
## [3303] "noise in the next room made them jump. Harry had only just raised his"        
## [3304] "wand when they heard someone speak -and it wasn't Malfoy.　　\"Sniff"         
## [3305] "around, my sweet, they might be lurking in a corner.\"　　It was Filch"       
## [3306] "speaking to Mrs. Norris. Horror-struck, Harry waved madly at the other"       
## [3307] "three to follow him as quickly as possible; they scurried silently"           
## [3308] "toward the door, away from Filch's voice. Neville's robes had barely"         
## [3309] "whipped round the corner when they heard Filch enter the trophy"              
## [3310] "room.　　\"They're in here somewhere,\" they heard him mutter, \"probably"    
## [3311] "hiding.\"　　\"This way!\" Harry mouthed to the others and, petrified,"       
## [3312] "they began to creep down a long gallery full of suits of armor. They"         
## [3313] "could hear Filch getting nearer. Neville suddenly let out a frightened"       
## [3314] "squeak and broke into a run -he tripped, grabbed Ron around the waist,"       
## [3315] "and the pair of them toppled right into a suit of armor.　　The"              
## [3316] "clanging and crashing were enough to wake the whole castle.　　\"RUN!\""      
## [3317] "Harry yelled, and the four of them sprinted down the gallery, not"            
## [3318] "looking back to see whether Filch was following -- they swung around"         
## [3319] "the doorpost and galloped down one corridor then another, Harry in the"       
## [3320] "lead, without any idea where they were or where they were going -- they"      
## [3321] "ripped through a tapestry and found themselves in a hidden passageway,"       
## [3322] "hurtled along it and came out near their Charms classroom, which they"        
## [3323] "knew was miles from the trophy room.　　\"I think we've lost him,\" Harry"    
## [3324] "panted, leaning against the cold wall and wiping his forehead. Neville"       
## [3325] "was bent double, wheezing and spluttering.　　I -- told -you,\" Hermione"     
## [3326] "gasped, clutching at the stitch in her chest, \"I -- told --"                 
## [3327] "you.\"　　\"We've got to get back to Gryffindor tower,\" said Ron,"           
## [3328] "\"quickly as possible.\"　　\"Malfoy tricked you,\" Hermione said to Harry."  
## [3329] "\"You realize that, don't you? He was never going to meet you -- Filch"       
## [3330] "knew someone was going to be in the trophy room, Malfoy must have"            
## [3331] "tipped him off.\"　　Harry thought she was probably right, but he wasn't"     
## [3332] "going to tell her that.　　\"Let's go.\"　　It wasn't going to be that"       
## [3333] "simple. They hadn't gone more than a dozen paces when a doorknob"             
## [3334] "rattled and something came shooting out of a classroom in front of"           
## [3335] "them.　　It was Peeves. He caught sight of them and gave a squeal of"         
## [3336] "delight.　　\"Shut up, Peeves -- please -- you'll get us thrown"              
## [3337] "out.\"　　Peeves cackled.　　\"Wandering around at midnight, Ickle"           
## [3338] "Firsties? Tut, tut, tut. Naughty, naughty, you'll get caughty.\"　　\"Not"    
## [3339] "if you don't give us away, Peeves, please.\"　　\"Should tell Filch, I"       
## [3340] "should,\" said Peeves in a saintly voice, but his eyes glittered"             
## [3341] "wickedly. \"It's for your own good, you know.\"　　\"Get out of the way,\""   
## [3342] "snapped Ron, taking a swipe at Peeves this was a big"                         
## [3343] "mistake.　　\"STUDENTS OUT OF BED!\" Peeves bellowed, \"STUDENTS OUT OF"      
## [3344] "BED DOWN THE CHARMS CORRIDOR\"　　Ducking under Peeves, they ran for"         
## [3345] "their lives, right to the end of the corridor where they slammed into a"      
## [3346] "door -- and it was locked.　　\"This is it!\" Ron moaned, as they pushed"     
## [3347] "helplessly at the door, \"We're done for! This is the end!\" They could"      
## [3348] "hear footsteps, Filch running as fast as he could toward Peeves's"            
## [3349] "shouts.　　\"Oh, move over,\" Hermione snarled. She grabbed Harry's wand,"    
## [3350] "tapped the lock, and whispered, 'Alohomora!\"　　The lock clicked and"        
## [3351] "the door swung open -- they piled through it, shut it quickly, and"           
## [3352] "pressed their ears against it, listening.　　\"Which way did they go,"        
## [3353] "Peeves?\" Filch was saying. \"Quick, tell me.\"　　\"Say"                     
## [3354] "'please.\"'　　\"Don't mess with me, Peeves, now where did they"              
## [3355] "go?\"　　\"Shan't say nothing if you don't say please,\" said Peeves in"      
## [3356] "his annoying singsong voice.　　\"All right -please.\"　　\"NOTHING! Ha"      
## [3357] "haaa! Told you I wouldn't say nothing if you didn't say please! Ha ha!"       
## [3358] "Haaaaaa!\" And they heard the sound of Peeves whooshing away and Filch"       
## [3359] "cursing in rage.　　\"He thinks this door is locked,\" Harry whispered."      
## [3360] "\"I think we'll be okay -- get off, Neville!\" For Neville had been"          
## [3361] "tugging on the sleeve of Harry's bathrobe for the last minute."               
## [3362] "\"What?\"　　Harry turned around -- and saw, quite clearly, what. For a"      
## [3363] "moment, he was sure he'd walked into a nightmare -- this was too much,"       
## [3364] "on top of everything that had happened so far.　　They weren't in a"          
## [3365] "room, as he had supposed. They were in a corridor. The forbidden"             
## [3366] "corridor on the third floor. And now they knew why it was"                    
## [3367] "forbidden.　　They were looking straight into the eyes of a monstrous"        
## [3368] "dog, a dog that filled the whole space between ceiling and floor. It"         
## [3369] "had three heads. Three pairs of rolling, mad eyes; three noses,"              
## [3370] "twitching　　and quivering in their direction; three drooling mouths,"        
## [3371] "saliva hanging in slippery ropes from yellowish fangs.　　It was"             
## [3372] "standing quite still, all six eyes staring at them, and Harry knew that"      
## [3373] "the only reason they weren't already dead was that their sudden"              
## [3374] "appearance had taken it by surprise, but it was quickly getting over"         
## [3375] "that, there was no mistaking what those thunderous growls"                    
## [3376] "meant.　　Harry groped for the doorknob -- between Filch and death,"          
## [3377] "he'd take Filch.　　They fell backward -- Harry slammed the door shut,"       
## [3378] "and they ran, they almost flew, back down the corridor. Filch must have"      
## [3379] "hurried off to look for them somewhere else, because they didn't see"         
## [3380] "him anywhere, but they hardly cared -- all they wanted to do was put as"      
## [3381] "much space as possible between them and that monster. They didn't stop"       
## [3382] "running until they reached the portrait of the Fat Lady on the seventh"       
## [3383] "floor.　　\"Where on earth have you all been?\" she asked, looking at"        
## [3384] "their bathrobes hanging off their shoulders and their flushed, sweaty"        
## [3385] "faces.　　\"Never mind that -- pig snout, pig snout,\" panted Harry, and"     
## [3386] "the portrait swung forward. They scrambled into the common room and"          
## [3387] "collapsed, trembling, into armchairs.　　It was a while before any of"        
## [3388] "them said anything. Neville, indeed, looked as if he'd never speak"           
## [3389] "again.　　\"What do they think they're doing, keeping a thing like that"      
## [3390] "locked up in a school?\" said Ron finally. \"If any dog needs exercise,"      
## [3391] "that one does.\"　　Hermione had got both her breath and her bad temper"      
## [3392] "back again. \"You don't use your eyes, any of you, do you?\" she snapped."    
## [3393] "\"Didn't you see what it was standing on.　　\"The floor?\" Harry"            
## [3394] "suggested. \"I wasn't looking at its feet, I was too busy with its"           
## [3395] "heads.\"　　\"No, not the floor. It was standing on a trapdoor. It's"         
## [3396] "obviously guarding something.\"　　She stood up, glaring at them.　　I"       
## [3397] "hope you're pleased with yourselves. We could all have been killed --"        
## [3398] "or worse, expelled. Now, if you don't mind, I'm going to bed.\"　　Ron"       
## [3399] "stared after her, his mouth open.　　\"No, we don't mind,\" he said."         
## [3400] "\"You'd think we dragged her along, wouldn't you.　　But Hermione had"        
## [3401] "given Harry something else to think about as he climbed back into bed."       
## [3402] "The dog was guarding something.... What had Hagrid said? Gringotts was"       
## [3403] "the safest place in the world for something you wanted to hide --"            
## [3404] "except perhaps Hogwarts.　　It looked as though Harry had found out"          
## [3405] "where the grubby littie package from vault seven hundred and thirteen"        
## [3406] "was.　　 HALLOWEEN　　Malfoy couldn't believe his eyes when he saw that"      
## [3407] "Harry and Ron were still at Hogwarts the next day, looking tired but"         
## [3408] "perfectly cheerful. Indeed, by the next morning Harry and Ron thought"        
## [3409] "that meeting the three-headed dog had been an excellent adventure, and"       
## [3410] "they were quite keen to have another one. In the meantime, Harry filled"      
## [3411] "Ron in about the package that seemed to have been moved from Gringotts"       
## [3412] "to Hogwarts, and they spent a lot of time wondering what could possibly"      
## [3413] "need such heavy protection. \"It's either really valuable or really"          
## [3414] "dangerous,\" said Ron. \"Or both,\" said Harry.　　But as all they knew"      
## [3415] "for sure about the mysterious object was that it was about two inches"        
## [3416] "long, they didn't have much chance of guessing what it was without"           
## [3417] "further clues.　　Neither Neville nor Hermione showed the slightest"          
## [3418] "interest in what lay underneath the dog and the trapdoor. All Neville"        
## [3419] "cared about was never going near the dog again.　　Hermione was now"          
## [3420] "refusing to speak to Harry and Ron, but she was such a bossy"                 
## [3421] "know-it-all that they saw this as an added bonus. All they really"            
## [3422] "wanted now was a way of getting back at Malfoy, and to their great"           
## [3423] "delight, just such a thing arrived in the mail about a week"                  
## [3424] "later.　　As the owls flooded into the Great Hall as usual, everyone's"       
## [3425] "attention was caught at once by a long, thin package carried by six"          
## [3426] "large screech owls. Harry was just as interested as everyone else to"         
## [3427] "see what was in this large parcel, and was amazed when the owls soared"       
## [3428] "down and dropped it right in front of him, knocking his bacon to the"         
## [3429] "floor. They had hardly fluttered out of the way when another owl"             
## [3430] "dropped a letter on top of the parcel.　　Harry ripped open the letter"       
## [3431] "first, which was lucky, because it said:　　DO NOT OPEN THE PARCEL AT"        
## [3432] "THE TABLE.　　It contains your new Nimbus Two Thousand, but I don't"          
## [3433] "want everybody knowing you've got a broomstick or they'll all want one."      
## [3434] "Oliver Wood will meet you tonight on the Quidditch field at seven"            
## [3435] "o'clock for your first training session.　　Professor"                        
## [3436] "McGonagall　　Harry had difficulty hiding his glee as he handed the"          
## [3437] "note to Ron to read.　　\"A Nimbus Two Thousand!\" Ron moaned enviously."     
## [3438] "\"I've never even touched one.\"　　They left the hall quickly, wanting"      
## [3439] "to unwrap the broomstick in private before their first class, but"            
## [3440] "halfway across the entrance hall they found the way upstairs barred by"       
## [3441] "Crabbe and Goyle. Malfoy seized the package from Harry and felt"              
## [3442] "it.　　\"That's a broomstick,\" he said, throwing it back to Harry with a"    
## [3443] "mixture of jealousy and spite on his face. \"You'll be in for it this"        
## [3444] "time, Potter, first years aren't allowed them.\"　　Ron couldn't resist"      
## [3445] "it.　　\"It's not any old broomstick,\" he said, \"it's a Nimbus Two"         
## [3446] "Thousand. What did you say you've got at home, Malfoy, a Comet Two"           
## [3447] "Sixty?\" Ron grinned at Harry. \"Comets look flashy, but they're not in"      
## [3448] "the same league as the Nimbus.\"　　\"What would you know about it,"          
## [3449] "Weasley, you couldn't afford half the handle,\" Malfoy snapped back. \"I"     
## [3450] "suppose you and your brothers have to save up twig by twig.\"　　Before"      
## [3451] "Ron could answer, Professor Flitwick appeared at Malfoy's"                    
## [3452] "elbow.　　\"Not arguing, I hope, boys?\" he squeaked.　　\"Potter's been"     
## [3453] "sent a broomstick, Professor,\" said Malfoy quickly.　　\"Yes, yes,"          
## [3454] "that's right,\" said Professor Flitwick, beaming at Harry. \"Professor"       
## [3455] "McGonagall told me all about the special circumstances, Potter. And"          
## [3456] "what model is it?\"　　\"A Nimbus Two Thousand, sit,\" said Harry,"           
## [3457] "fighting not to laugh at the look of horror on Malfoy's face. \"And it's"     
## [3458] "really thanks to Malfoy here that I've got it,\" he added.　　Harry and"      
## [3459] "Ron headed upstairs, smothering their laughter at Malfoy's obvious rage"      
## [3460] "and confusion. \"Well, it's true,\" Harry chortled as they reached the"       
## [3461] "top of the marble staircase, \"If he hadn't stolen Neville's Remembrall"      
## [3462] "I wouln't be on the team....\"　　\"So I suppose you think that's a"          
## [3463] "reward for breaking rules?\" came an angry voice from just behind them."      
## [3464] "Hermione was stomping up the stairs, looking disapprovingly at the"           
## [3465] "package in Harry's hand.　　\"I thought you weren't speaking to us?\""        
## [3466] "said Harry.　　\"Yes, don't stop now,\" said Ron, \"it's doing us so much"    
## [3467] "good.\"　　Hermione marched away with her nose in the air.　　Harry had"      
## [3468] "a lot of trouble keeping his mind on his lessons that day. It kept"           
## [3469] "wandering up to the dormitory where his new broomstick was lying under"       
## [3470] "his bed, or straying off to the Quidditch field where he'd be learning"       
## [3471] "to play that night. He bolted his dinner that evening without noticing"       
## [3472] "what he was eating, and then rushed upstairs with Ron to unwrap the"          
## [3473] "Nimbus Two Thousand at last.　　\"Wow,\" Ron sighed, as the broomstick"       
## [3474] "rolled onto Harry's bedspread.　　Even Harry, who knew nothing about"         
## [3475] "the different brooms, thought it looked wonderful. Sleek and shiny,"          
## [3476] "with a mahogany handle, it had a long tail of neat, straight twigs and"       
## [3477] "Nimbus Two Thousand written in gold near the top.　　As seven o'clock"        
## [3478] "drew nearer, Harry left the castle and set off in the dusk toward the"        
## [3479] "Quidditch field. Held never been inside the stadium before. Hundreds of"      
## [3480] "seats were raised in stands around the field so that the spectators"          
## [3481] "were high enough to see what was going on. At either end of the field"        
## [3482] "were three golden poles with hoops on the end. They reminded Harry of"        
## [3483] "the little plastic sticks Muggle　　children blew bubbles through,"           
## [3484] "except that they were fifty feet high.　　Too eager to fly again to"          
## [3485] "wait for Wood, Harry mounted his broomstick and kicked off from the"          
## [3486] "ground. What a feeling -- he swooped in and out of the goal posts and"        
## [3487] "then sped up and down the field. The Nimbus Two Thousand turned"              
## [3488] "wherever he wanted at his lightest touch.　　\"Hey, Potter, come"             
## [3489] "down!'　　Oliver Wood had arrived. fie was carrying a large wooden"           
## [3490] "crate under his arm. Harry landed next to him.　　\"Very nice,\" said"        
## [3491] "Wood, his eyes glinting. \"I see what McGonagall meant... you really are"     
## [3492] "a natural. I'm just going to teach you the rules this evening, then"          
## [3493] "you'll be joining team practice three times a week.\"　　He opened the"       
## [3494] "crate. Inside were four different-sized balls.　　\"Right,\" said Wood."      
## [3495] "\"Now, Quidditch is easy enough to understand, even if it's not too easy"     
## [3496] "to play. There are seven players on each side. Three of them are called"      
## [3497] "Chasers.\"　　\"Three Chasers,\" Harry repeated, as Wood took out a bright"   
## [3498] "red ball about the size of a soccer ball.　　\"This ball's called the"        
## [3499] "Quaffle,\" said Wood. \"The Chasers throw the Quaffle to each other and"      
## [3500] "try and get it through one of the hoops to score a goal. Ten points"          
## [3501] "every time the Quaffle goes through one of the hoops. Follow"                 
## [3502] "me?\"　　\"The Chasers throw the Quaffle and put it through the hoops to"     
## [3503] "score,\" Harry recited. \"So -- that's sort of like basketball on"            
## [3504] "broomsticks with six hoops, isn't it?\"　　\"What's basketball?\" said"       
## [3505] "Wood curiously. \"Never mind,\" said Harry quickly.　　\"Now, there's"        
## [3506] "another player on each side who's called the Keeper -I'm Keeper for"          
## [3507] "Gryffindor. I have to fly around our hoops and stop the other team from"      
## [3508] "scoring.\"　　\"Three Chasers, one Keeper,\" said Harry, who was"             
## [3509] "determined to remember it all. \"And they play with the Quaffle. Okay,"       
## [3510] "got that. So what are they for?\" He pointed at the three balls left"         
## [3511] "inside the box.　　\"I'll show you now,\" said Wood. \"Take this.\"　　He"    
## [3512] "handed Harry a small club, a bit like a short baseball bat.　　\"I'm"         
## [3513] "going to show you what the Bludgers do,\" Wood said. \"These two are the"     
## [3514] "Bludgers.\"　　He showed Harry two identical balls, jet black and"            
## [3515] "slightly smaller than the red Quaffle. Harry noticed that they seemed"        
## [3516] "to be straining to escape the straps holding them inside the"                 
## [3517] "box.　　\"Stand back,\" Wood warned Harry. He bent down and freed one of"
