## [3518] "the Bludgers.　　At once, the black ball rose high in the air and then"       
## [3519] "pelted straight at Harry's face. Harry swung at it with the bat to stop"      
## [3520] "it from breaking his nose, and sent it zigzagging away into the air --"       
## [3521] "it zoomed around their heads and then shot at Wood, who dived on top of"      
## [3522] "it and managed to pin it to the ground.　　\"See?\" Wood panted, forcing"     
## [3523] "the struggling Bludger back into the crate and strapping it down"             
## [3524] "safely. \"The Bludgers rocket around, trying to knock players off their"      
## [3525] "brooms. That's why you have two Beaters on each team -- the Weasley"          
## [3526] "twins are ours -- it's their job to protect their side from the"              
## [3527] "Bludgers and try and knock them toward the other team. So -- think"           
## [3528] "you've got all that?\"　　\"Three Chasers try and score with the Quaffle;"    
## [3529] "the Keeper guards the goal posts; the Beaters keep the Bludgers away"         
## [3530] "from their team,\" Harry reeled off.　　\"Very good,\" said Wood.　　\"Er"    
## [3531] "-- have the Bludgers ever killed anyone?\" Harry asked, hoping he"            
## [3532] "sounded offhand.　　\"Never at Hogwarts. We've had a couple of broken"        
## [3533] "jaws but nothing worse than that. Now, the last member of the team is"        
## [3534] "the　　Seeker. That's you. And you don't have to worry about the"             
## [3535] "Quaffle or the Bludgers unless they crack my head open.\"　　\"Don't"         
## [3536] "worry, the Weasleys are more than a match for the Bludgers -- I mean,"        
## [3537] "they're like a pair of human Bludgers themselves.\"　　Wood reached into"     
## [3538] "the crate and took out the fourth and last ball. Compared with the"           
## [3539] "Quaffle and the Bludgers, it was tiny, about the size of a large"             
## [3540] "walnut. It was bright gold and had little fluttering silver"                  
## [3541] "wings.　　\"This,\" said Wood, \"is the Golden Snitch, and it's the most"     
## [3542] "important ball of the lot. It's very hard to catch because it's so fast"      
## [3543] "and difficult to see. It's the Seeker's job to catch it. You've got to"       
## [3544] "weave in and out of the Chasers, Beaters, Bludgers, and Quaffle to get"       
## [3545] "it before the other team's Seeker, because whichever Seeker catches the"      
## [3546] "Snitch wins his team an extra hundred and fifty points, so"                   
## [3547] "they　　nearly always win. That's why Seekers get fouled so much. A"          
## [3548] "game of Quidditch only ends when the Snitch is caught, so it can go on"       
## [3549] "for ages -- I think the record is three months, they had to keep"             
## [3550] "bringing on substitutes so the players could get some sleep. \"Well,"         
## [3551] "that's it -- any questions?\"　　Harry shook his head. He understood"         
## [3552] "what he had to do all right, it was doing it that was going to be the"        
## [3553] "problem.　　\"We won't practice with the Snitch yet,\" said Wood,"            
## [3554] "carefully shutting it back inside the crate, \"it's too dark, we might"       
## [3555] "lose it. Let's try you out with a few of these.\"　　He pulled a bag of"      
## [3556] "ordinary golf balls out of his pocket and a few minutes later, he and"        
## [3557] "Harry were up in the air, Wood throwing the golf balls as hard as he"         
## [3558] "could in every direction for Harry to catch.　　Harry didn't miss a"          
## [3559] "single one, and Wood was delighted. After half an hour, night had"            
## [3560] "really fallen and they couldn't carry on.　　\"That Quidditch cup'll"         
## [3561] "have our name on it this year,\" said Wood happily as they trudged back"      
## [3562] "up to the castle. \"I wouldn't be surprised if you turn out better than"      
## [3563] "Charlie Weasley, and he could have played for England if he hadn't gone"      
## [3564] "off chasing dragons.\"　　Perhaps it was because he was now so busy,"         
## [3565] "what with Quidditch practice three evenings a week on top of all his"         
## [3566] "homework, but Harry could hardly believe it when he realized that he'd"       
## [3567] "already been at Hogwarts two months. The castle felt more like home"          
## [3568] "than Privet Drive ever had. His lessons, too, were becoming more and"         
## [3569] "more interesting now that they had mastered the basics.　　On Halloween"      
## [3570] "morning they woke to the delicious smell of baking pumpkin wafting"           
## [3571] "through the corridors. Even better, Professor Flitwick announced in"          
## [3572] "Charms that he thought they were ready to start making objects fly,"          
## [3573] "something they had all been dying to try since they'd seen him make"          
## [3574] "Neville's toad zoom around the classroom. Professor Flitwick put the"         
## [3575] "class into pairs to practice. Harry's partner was Seamus Finnigan"            
## [3576] "(which was a relief, because Neville had been trying to catch his eye)."      
## [3577] "Ron, however, was to be working with Hermione Granger. It was hard to"        
## [3578] "tell whether Ron or Hermione was angrier about this. She hadn't spoken"       
## [3579] "to either of them since the day Harry's broomstick had"                       
## [3580] "arrived.　　\"Now, don't forget that nice wrist movement we've been"          
## [3581] "practicing!\" squeaked Professor Flitwick, perched on top of his pile of"     
## [3582] "books as usual. \"Swish and flick, remember, swish and flick. And saying"     
## [3583] "the magic words properly is very important, too -- never forget Wizard"       
## [3584] "Baruffio, who said 's' instead of 'f' and found himself on the floor"         
## [3585] "with a buffalo on his chest.\"　　It was very difficult. Harry and"           
## [3586] "Seamus swished and flicked, but the feather they were supposed to be"         
## [3587] "sending skyward just lay on the desktop. Seamus got so impatient that"        
## [3588] "he prodded it with his wand and set fire to it -- Harry had to put it"        
## [3589] "out with his hat.　　Ron, at the next table, wasn't having much more"         
## [3590] "luck.　　\"Wingardium Leviosa!\" he shouted, waving his long arms like a"     
## [3591] "windmill.　　\"You're saying it wrong,\" Harry heard Hermione snap. \"It's"   
## [3592] "Wing-gar-dium Levi-o-sa, make the 'gar' nice and long.\"　　\"You do it,"     
## [3593] "then, if you're so clever,\" Ron snarled.　　Hermione rolled up the"          
## [3594] "sleeves of her gown, flicked her wand, and said, \"Wingardium"                
## [3595] "Leviosa!\"　　Their feather rose off the desk and hovered about four"         
## [3596] "feet above their heads.　　\"Oh, well done!\" cried Professor Flitwick,"      
## [3597] "clapping. \"Everyone see here, Miss Granger's done it!\"　　Ron was in a"     
## [3598] "very bad mood by the end of the class. \"It's no wonder no one can stand"     
## [3599] "her,\" he said to Harry as they pushed their way into the crowded"            
## [3600] "corridor, \"she's a nightmare, honestly. \"　　Someone knocked into Harry"    
## [3601] "as they hurried past him. It was Hermione. Harry caught a glimpse of"         
## [3602] "her face -- and was startled to see that she was in tears.　　\"I think"      
## [3603] "she heard you.\"　　\"So?\" said Ron, but he looked a bit uncomfortable."     
## [3604] "\"She must've noticed she's got no friends.\"　　Hermione didn't turn up"     
## [3605] "for the next class and wasn't seen all afternoon. On their way down to"       
## [3606] "the Great Hall for the Halloween feast, Harry and Ron overheard Parvati"      
## [3607] "Patil telling her friend Lavender that Hermione was crying in the"            
## [3608] "girls' bathroom and wanted to be left alone. Ron looked still more"           
## [3609] "awkward at this, but a moment later they had entered the Great Hall,"         
## [3610] "where the Halloween decorations put Hermione out of their minds.　　A"        
## [3611] "thousand live bats fluttered from the walls and ceiling while a"              
## [3612] "thousand more swooped over the tables in low black clouds, making the"        
## [3613] "candles in the pumpkins stutter. The feast appeared suddenly on the"          
## [3614] "golden plates, as it had at the start-of-term banquet.　　Harry was"          
## [3615] "just helping himself to a baked potato when Professor Quirrell came"          
## [3616] "sprinting into the hall, his turban askew and terror on his face."            
## [3617] "Everyone stared as he reached Professor Dumbledore's chair, slumped"          
## [3618] "against the table, and gasped, \"Troll -- in the dungeons -- thought you"     
## [3619] "ought to know.\"　　He then sank to the floor in a dead faint.　　There"      
## [3620] "was an uproar. It took several purple firecrackers exploding from the"        
## [3621] "end of Professor Dumbledore's wand to bring silence.　　\"Prefects,\" he"     
## [3622] "rumbled, \"lead your Houses back to the dormitories"                          
## [3623] "immediately!\"　　Percy was in his element.　　\"Follow me! Stick"            
## [3624] "together, first years! No need to fear the troll if you follow my"            
## [3625] "orders! Stay close behind me, now. Make way, first years coming"              
## [3626] "through! Excuse me, I'm a prefect!\"　　\"How could a troll get in?\""        
## [3627] "Harry asked as they climbed the stairs.　　\"Don't ask me, they're"           
## [3628] "supposed to be really stupid,\" said Ron. \"Maybe Peeves let it in for a"     
## [3629] "Halloween joke.\"　　They passed different groups of people hurrying in"      
## [3630] "different directions. As they jostled their way through a crowd of"           
## [3631] "confused Hufflepuffs, Harry suddenly grabbed Ron's arm.　　\"I've just"       
## [3632] "thought -- Hermione.\"　　\"What about her?\"　　\"She doesn't know about"    
## [3633] "the troll.\"　　Ron bit his lip.　　\"Oh, all right,\" he snapped. \"But"     
## [3634] "Percy'd better not see us.\"　　Ducking down, they joined the"                
## [3635] "Hufflepuffs going the other way, slipped down a deserted side corridor,"      
## [3636] "and hurried off toward the girls' bathroom. They had just turned the"         
## [3637] "corner when they heard quick footsteps behind them.　　\"Percy!\" hissed"     
## [3638] "Ron, pulling Harry behind a large stone griffin.　　Peering around it,"       
## [3639] "however, they saw not Percy but Snape. He crossed the corridor and"           
## [3640] "disappeared from view.　　\"What's he doing?\" Harry whispered. \"Why"        
## [3641] "isn't he down in the dungeons with the rest of the"                           
## [3642] "teachers?\"　　\"Search me.\"　　Quietly as possible, they crept along the"   
## [3643] "next corridor after Snape's fading footsteps.　　\"He's heading for the"      
## [3644] "third floor,\" Harry said, but Ron held up his hand.　　\"Can you smell"      
## [3645] "something?\"　　Harry sniffed and a foul stench reached his nostrils, a"      
## [3646] "mixture of old socks and the kind of public toilet no one seems to"           
## [3647] "clean.　　And then they heard it -- a low grunting, and the shuffling"        
## [3648] "footfalls of gigantic feet. Ron pointed -- at the end of a passage to"        
## [3649] "the left, something huge was moving toward them. They shrank into the"        
## [3650] "shadows and watched as it emerged into a patch of moonlight.　　It was"       
## [3651] "a horrible sight. Twelve feet tall, its skin was a dull, granite gray,"       
## [3652] "its great lumpy body like a boulder with its small bald head perched on"      
## [3653] "top like a coconut. It had short legs thick as tree trunks with flat,"        
## [3654] "horny feet. The smell coming from it was incredible. It was holding a"        
## [3655] "huge wooden club, which dragged along the floor because its arms were"        
## [3656] "so long.　　The troll stopped next to a doorway and peered inside. It"        
## [3657] "waggled its long ears, making up its tiny mind, then slouched slowly"         
## [3658] "into the room.　　\"The keys in the lock,\" Harry muttered. \"We could"       
## [3659] "lock it in.\"　　\"Good idea,\" said Ron nervously.　　They edged toward"     
## [3660] "the open door, mouths dry, praying the troll wasn't about to come out"        
## [3661] "of it. With one great leap, Harry managed to grab the key, slam the"          
## [3662] "door, and lock it.　　'Yes!\"　　Flushed with their victory, they"            
## [3663] "started to run back up the passage, but as they reached the corner they"      
## [3664] "heard something that made their hearts stop -- a high, petrified scream"      
## [3665] "-- and it was coming from the chamber they'd just chained up.　　\"Oh,"       
## [3666] "no,\" said Ron, pale as the Bloody Baron.　　\"It's the girls' bathroom!\""   
## [3667] "Harry gasped.　　\"Hermione!\" they said together.　　It was the last"        
## [3668] "thing they wanted to do, but what choice did they have? Wheeling"             
## [3669] "around, they sprinted back to the door and turned the key, fumbling in"       
## [3670] "their panic. Harry pulled the door open and they ran"                         
## [3671] "inside.　　Hermione Granger was shrinking against the wall opposite,"         
## [3672] "looking as if she was about to faint. The troll was advancing on her,"        
## [3673] "knocking the sinks off the walls as it went.　　\"Confuse it!\" Harry"        
## [3674] "said desperately to Ron, and, seizing a tap, he threw it as hard as he"       
## [3675] "could against the wall.　　The troll stopped a few feet from Hermione."       
## [3676] "It lumbered around, blinking stupidly, to see what had made the noise."       
## [3677] "Its mean little eyes saw Harry. It hesitated, then made for him"              
## [3678] "instead, lifting its club as it went.　　\"Oy, pea-brain!\" yelled Ron"       
## [3679] "from the other side of the chamber, and he threw a metal pipe at it."         
## [3680] "The troll didn't even seem to notice the pipe hitting its shoulder, but"      
## [3681] "it heard the yell and paused again, turning its ugly snout toward Ron"        
## [3682] "instead, giving Harry time to run around it.　　\"Come on, run, run!\""       
## [3683] "Harry yelled at Hermione, trying to pull her toward the door, but she"        
## [3684] "couldn't move, she was still flat against the wall, her mouth open with"      
## [3685] "terror.　　The shouting and the echoes seemed to be driving the troll"        
## [3686] "berserk. It roared again and started toward Ron, who was nearest and"         
## [3687] "had no way to escape.　　Harry then did something that was both very"         
## [3688] "brave and very stupid: He took a great running jump and managed to"           
## [3689] "fasten his arms around the troll's neck from behind. The troll couldn't"      
## [3690] "feel Harry hanging there, but even a troll will notice if you stick a"        
## [3691] "long bit of wood up its nose, and Harry's wand had still been in his"         
## [3692] "hand when he'd jumped -- it had gone straight up one of the troll's"          
## [3693] "nostrils.　　Howling with pain, the troll twisted and flailed its club,"      
## [3694] "with Harry clinging on for dear life; any second, the troll was going"        
## [3695] "to rip him off or catch him a terrible blow with the club.　　Hermione"       
## [3696] "had sunk to the floor in fright; Ron pulled out his own wand -- not"          
## [3697] "knowing what he was going to do he heard himself cry the first spell"         
## [3698] "that came into his head: \"Wingardium Leviosa!\"　　The club flew"            
## [3699] "suddenly out of the troll's hand, rose high, high up into the air,"           
## [3700] "turned slowly over -- and dropped, with a sickening crack, onto its"          
## [3701] "owner's head. The troll swayed on the spot and then fell flat on its"         
## [3702] "face, with a thud that made the whole room tremble.　　Harry got to his"      
## [3703] "feet. He was shaking and out of breath. Ron was standing there with his"      
## [3704] "wand still raised, staring at what he had done.　　It was Hermione who"       
## [3705] "spoke first.　　\"Is it -- dead?\"　　I don't think so,\" said Harry, I"      
## [3706] "think it's just been knocked out.\"　　He bent down and pulled his wand"      
## [3707] "out of the troll's nose. It was covered in what looked like lumpy gray"       
## [3708] "glue.　　\"Urgh -- troll boogers.\"　　He wiped it on the troll's"            
## [3709] "trousers.　　A sudden slamming and loud footsteps made the three of"          
## [3710] "them look up. They hadn't realized what a racket they had been making,"       
## [3711] "but of course, someone downstairs must have heard the crashes and the"        
## [3712] "troll's roars. A moment later, Professor McGonagall had come bursting"        
## [3713] "into the room, closely followed by Snape, with Quirrell bringing up the"      
## [3714] "rear. Quirrell took one look at the troll, let out a faint whimper, and"      
## [3715] "sat quickly down on a toilet, clutching his heart.　　Snape bent over"        
## [3716] "the troll. Professor McGonagall was looking at Ron and Harry. Harry had"      
## [3717] "never seen her look so angry. Her lips were white. Hopes of winning"          
## [3718] "fifty points for Gryffindor faded quickly from Harry's mind.　　\"What"       
## [3719] "on earth were you thinking of?\" said Professor McGonagall, with cold"        
## [3720] "fury in her voice. Harry looked at Ron, who was still standing with his"      
## [3721] "wand in the air. \"You're lucky you weren't killed. Why aren't you in"        
## [3722] "your dormitory?\"　　Snape gave Harry a swift, piercing look. Harry"          
## [3723] "looked at the floor. He wished Ron would put his wand down.　　Then a"        
## [3724] "small voice came out of the shadows.　　\"Please, Professor McGonagall"       
## [3725] "-- they were looking for me.\"　　\"Miss Granger!\"　　Hermione had"          
## [3726] "managed to get to her feet at last.　　I went looking for the troll"          
## [3727] "because I -- I thought I could deal with it on my own -- you know,"           
## [3728] "because I've read all about them.\"　　Ron dropped his wand. Hermione"        
## [3729] "Granger, telling a downright lie to a teacher? \"If they hadn't found"        
## [3730] "me, I'd be dead now. Harry stuck his wand up its nose and Ron knocked"        
## [3731] "it out with its own club. They didn't have time to come and fetch"            
## [3732] "anyone. It was about to finish me off when they arrived.\"　　Harry and"      
## [3733] "Ron tried to look as though this story wasn't new to them.　　\"Well --"      
## [3734] "in that case...\" said Professor McGonagall, staring at the three of"         
## [3735] "them, \"Miss Granger, you foolish girl, how could you think of tackling"      
## [3736] "a mountain troll on your own?\"　　Hermione hung her head. Harry was"         
## [3737] "speechless. Hermione was the last person to do anything against the"          
## [3738] "rules, and here she was, pretending she had, to get them out of"              
## [3739] "trouble. It was as if Snape had started handing out sweets.　　\"Miss"        
## [3740] "Granger, five points will be taken from Gryffindor for this,\" said"          
## [3741] "Professor McGonagall. \"I'm very disappointed in you. If you're not hurt"     
## [3742] "at all, you'd better get off to Gryffindor tower. Students are"               
## [3743] "finishing the feast in their houses.\"　　Hermione left.　　Professor"        
## [3744] "McGonagall turned to Harry and Ron.　　\"Well, I still say you were"          
## [3745] "lucky, but not many first years could have taken on a full-grown"             
## [3746] "mountain troll. You each win Gryffindor five points. Professor"               
## [3747] "Dumbledore will be informed of this. You may go.\"　　They hurried out"       
## [3748] "of the chamber and didn't speak at all until they had climbed two"            
## [3749] "floors up. It was a relief to be away from the smell of the troll,"           
## [3750] "quite apart from anything else.　　\"We should have gotten more than ten"     
## [3751] "points,\" Ron grumbled.　　\"Five, you mean, once she's taken off"            
## [3752] "Hermione's.\"　　\"Good of her to get us out of trouble like that,\" Ron"     
## [3753] "admitted. \"Mind you, we did save her.\"　　\"She might not have needed"      
## [3754] "saving if we hadn't locked the thing in with her,\" Harry reminded"           
## [3755] "him.　　They had reached the portrait of the Fat Lady.　　\"Pig snout,\""     
## [3756] "they said and entered.　　The common room was packed and noisy."              
## [3757] "Everyone was eating the food that had been sent up. Hermione, however,"       
## [3758] "stood alone by the door, waiting for them. There was a very embarrassed"      
## [3759] "pause. Then, none of them looking at each other, they all said"               
## [3760] "\"Thanks,\" and hurried off to get plates.　　But from that moment on,"       
## [3761] "Hermione Granger became their friend. There are some things you can't"        
## [3762] "share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a"                
## [3763] "twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.　　 QUIDDITCH　　As they"          
## [3764] "entered November, the weather turned very cold. The mountains around"         
## [3765] "the school became icy gray and the lake like chilled steel. Every"            
## [3766] "morning the ground was covered in frost. Hagrid could be seen from the"       
## [3767] "upstairs windows defrosting broomsticks on the Quidditch field, bundled"      
## [3768] "up in a long moleskin overcoat, rabbit fur gloves, and enormous"              
## [3769] "beaverskin boots.　　The Quidditch season had begun. On Saturday, Harry"      
## [3770] "would be playing in his first match after weeks of training: Gryffindor"      
## [3771] "versus Slytherin. If Gryffindor won, they would move up into second"          
## [3772] "place in the house championship.　　Hardly anyone had seen Harry play"        
## [3773] "because Wood had decided that, as their secret weapon, Harry should be"       
## [3774] "kept, well, secret. But the news that he was playing Seeker had leaked"       
## [3775] "out somehow, and Harry didn't know which was worse -- people telling"         
## [3776] "him he'd be brilliant or people telling him they'd be running around"         
## [3777] "underneath him holding a mattress.　　It was really lucky that Harry"         
## [3778] "now had Hermlone as a friend. He didn't know how he'd have gotten"            
## [3779] "through all his homework without her, what with all the last-minute"          
## [3780] "Quidditch practice Wood was making them do. She had also tent him"            
## [3781] "Quidditch Through the Ages, which turned out to be a very interesting"        
## [3782] "read.　　Harry learned that there were seven hundred ways of committing"      
## [3783] "a Quidditch foul and that all of them had happened during a World Cup"        
## [3784] "match in 1473; that Seekers were usually the smallest and fastest"            
## [3785] "players, and that most serious Quidditch accidents seemed to happen to"       
## [3786] "them; that although people rarely died playing Quidditch, referees had"       
## [3787] "been known to vanish and turn up months later in the Sahara"                  
## [3788] "Desert.　　Hermione had become a bit more relaxed about breaking rules"       
## [3789] "since Harry and Ron had saved her from the mountain troll, and she was"       
## [3790] "much nicer for it. The day before Harry's first Quidditch match the"          
## [3791] "three of them were out in the freezing courtyard during break, and she"       
## [3792] "had conjured them up a bright blue fire that could be carried around in"      
## [3793] "a jam jar. They were standing with their backs to it, getting warm,"          
## [3794] "when Snape crossed the yard. Harry noticed at once that Snape was"            
## [3795] "limping. Harry, Ron, and Hermione moved closer together to block the"         
## [3796] "fire from view; they were sure it wouldn't be allowed. Unfortunately,"        
## [3797] "something about their guilty faces caught Snape's eye. He limped over."       
## [3798] "He hadn't seen the fire, but he seemed to be looking for a reason to"         
## [3799] "tell them off anyway.　　\"What's that you've got there, Potter?\"　　It"     
## [3800] "was Quidditch Through the Ages. Harry showed him.　　\"Library books are"     
## [3801] "not to be taken outside the school,\" said Snape. \"Give it to me. Five"      
## [3802] "points from Gryffindor.\"　　\"He's just made that rule up,\" Harry"          
## [3803] "muttered angrily as Snape limped away. \"Wonder what's wrong with his"        
## [3804] "leg?\"　　\"Dunno, but I hope it's really hurting him,\" said Ron"            
## [3805] "bitterly.　　The Gryffindor common room was very noisy that evening."         
## [3806] "Harry, Ron, and Hermione sat together next to a window. Hermione was"         
## [3807] "checking Harry and Ron's Charms homework for them. She would never let"       
## [3808] "them copy (\"How will you learn?\"), but by asking her to read it"            
## [3809] "through, they got the right answers anyway.　　Harry felt restless. He"       
## [3810] "wanted Quidditch Through the Ages back, to take his mind off his nerves"      
## [3811] "about tomorrow. Why should he be afraid of Snape? Getting up, he told"        
## [3812] "Ron and Hermione he was going to ask Snape if he could have"                  
## [3813] "it.　　\"Better you than me,\" they said together, but Harry had an idea"     
## [3814] "that Snape wouldn't refuse if there were other teachers"                      
## [3815] "listening.　　He made his way down to the staffroom and knocked. There"       
## [3816] "was no answer. He knocked again. Nothing.　　Perhaps Snape had left the"      
## [3817] "book in there? It was worth a try. He pushed the door ajar and peered"        
## [3818] "inside -- and a horrible scene met his eyes.　　Snape and Filch were"         
## [3819] "inside, alone. Snape was holding his robes above his knees. One of his"       
## [3820] "legs was bloody and mangled. Filch was handing Snape"                         
## [3821] "bandages.　　\"Blasted thing*,\" Snape was saying. \"How are you supposed"    
## [3822] "to keep your eyes on all three heads at once?\"　　Harry tried to shut"       
## [3823] "the door quietly, but --　　\"POTTER!\"　　Snape's face was twisted with"     
## [3824] "fury as he dropped his robes quickly to hide his leg. Harry"                  
## [3825] "gulped.　　\"I just wondered if I could have my book back.\"　　\"GET OUT!"   
## [3826] "OUT!\"　　Harry left, before Snape could take any more points from"           
## [3827] "Gryffindor. He sprinted back upstairs.　　\"Did you get it?\" Ron asked"      
## [3828] "as Harry joined them. \"What's the matter?\"　　In a low whisper, Harry"      
## [3829] "told them what he'd seen.　　\"You know what this means?\" he finished"       
## [3830] "breathlessly. \"He tried to get past that three-headed dog at Halloween!"     
## [3831] "That's where he was going when we saw him -- he's after whatever it's"        
## [3832] "guarding! And Id bet my broomstick he let that troll in, to make a"           
## [3833] "diversion!\"　　Hermione's eyes were wide.　　\"No -- he wouldn't, she"       
## [3834] "said. \"I know he's not very nice, but he wouldn't try and steal"             
## [3835] "something Dumbledore was keeping safe.\"　　\"Honestly, Hermione, you"        
## [3836] "think all teachers are saints or something,\" snapped Ron. \"I'm with"        
## [3837] "Harry. I wouldn't put anything past Snape. But what's he after? What's"       
## [3838] "that dog guarding?\"　　Harry went to bed with his head buzzing with the"     
## [3839] "same question. Neville was snoring loudly, but Harry couldn't sleep. He"      
## [3840] "tried to empty his mind -- he needed to sleep, he had to, he had his"         
## [3841] "first Quidditch match in a few hours -- but the expression on Snape's"        
## [3842] "face when Harry had seen his leg wasn't easy to forget.　　The next"          
## [3843] "morning dawned very bright and cold. The Great Hall was full of the"          
## [3844] "delicious smell of fried sausages and the cheer ful chatter of everyone"      
## [3845] "looking forward to a good Quidditch match.　　\"You've got to eat some"       
## [3846] "breakfast.\"　　\"I don't want anything.\"　　\"Just a bit of toast,\""       
## [3847] "wheedled Hermione.　　\"I'm not hungry.\"　　Harry felt terrible. In an"      
## [3848] "hour's time he'd be walking onto the field.　　\"Harry, you need your"        
## [3849] "strength,\" said Seamus Finnigan. \"Seekers are always the ones who get"      
## [3850] "clobbered by the other team.\"　　\"Thanks, Seamus,\" said Harry, watching"   
## [3851] "Seamus pile ketchup on his sausages.　　By eleven o'clock the whole"          
## [3852] "school seemed to be out in the stands around the Quidditch pitch. Many"       
## [3853] "students had binoculars. The seats might be raised high in the air, but"      
## [3854] "it was still difficult to see what was going on sometimes.　　Ron and"        
## [3855] "Hermione joined Neville, Seamus, and Dean the West Ham fan up in the"         
## [3856] "top row. As a surprise for Harry, they had painted a large banner on"         
## [3857] "one of the sheets Scabbers had ruined. It said Potter for President,"         
## [3858] "and Dean, who was good at drawing, had done a large Gryffindor lion"          
## [3859] "underneath. Then Hermione had performed a tricky little charm so that"        
## [3860] "the paint flashed different colors.　　Meanwhile, in the locker room,"        
## [3861] "Harry and the rest of the team were changing into their scarlet"              
## [3862] "Quidditch robes (Slytherin would be playing in green).　　Wood cleared"       
## [3863] "his throat for silence.　　\"Okay, men,\" he said.　　\"And women,\" said"    
## [3864] "Chaser Angelina Johnson.　　\"And women,\" Wood agreed. \"This is"            
## [3865] "it.\"　　\"The big one,\" said Fred Weasley.　　\"The one we've all been"     
## [3866] "waiting for,\" said George.　　\"We know Oliver's speech by heart,\" Fred"    
## [3867] "told Harry, \"we were on the team last year.\"　　\"Shut up, you two,\""      
## [3868] "said Wood. \"This is the best team Gryffindor's had in years. We're"          
## [3869] "going to win. I know it.\"　　He glared at them all as if to say, \"Or"       
## [3870] "else.\"　　\"Right. It's time. Good luck, all of you.\"　　Harry followed"    
## [3871] "Fred and George out of the locker room and, hoping his knees weren't"         
## [3872] "going to give way, walked onto the field to loud cheers.　　Madam Hooch"      
## [3873] "was refereeing. She stood in the middle of the field waiting for the"         
## [3874] "two teams, her broom in her hand.　　\"Now, I want a nice fair game, all"     
## [3875] "of you,\" she said, once they were all gathered around her. Harry"            
## [3876] "noticed that she seemed to be speaking particularly to the Slytherin"         
## [3877] "Captain, Marcus Flint, a sixth year. Harry thought Flint looked as if"        
## [3878] "he had some troll blood in him. Out of the corner of his eye he saw the"      
## [3879] "fluttering banner high above, flashing Potter for President over the"         
## [3880] "crowd. His heart skipped. He felt braver.　　\"Mount your brooms,"            
## [3881] "please.\"　　Harry clambered onto his Nimbus Two Thousand.　　Madam"          
## [3882] "Hooch gave a loud blast on her silver whistle.　　Fifteen brooms rose"        
## [3883] "up, high, high into the air. They were off. \"And the Quaffle is taken"       
## [3884] "immediately by Angelina Johnson of Gryffindor -- what an excellent"           
## [3885] "Chaser that girl is, and rather attractive, too"                              
## [3886] "--\"　　\"JORDAN!\"　　\"Sorry, Professor.\"　　The Weasley twins' friend,"   
## [3887] "Lee Jordan, was doing the commentary for the match, closely watched by"       
## [3888] "Professor McGonagall.　　\"And she's really belting along up there, a"        
## [3889] "neat pass to Alicia Spinnet, a good find of Oliver Wood's, last year"         
## [3890] "only a reserve -- back to Johnson and -- no, the Slytherins have taken"       
## [3891] "the Quaffle, Slytherin Captain Marcus Flint gains the Quaffle and off"        
## [3892] "he goes -- Flint flying like an eagle up there -- he's going to sc- no,"      
## [3893] "stopped by an excellent move by Gryffindor Keeper Wood and the"               
## [3894] "Gryffindors take the Quaffle -- that's Chaser Katie Bell of Gryffindor"       
## [3895] "there, nice dive around Flint, off up the field and -- OUCH -- that"          
## [3896] "must have hurt, hit in the back of the head by a Bludger -- Quaffle"          
## [3897] "taken by the Slytherins -- that's Adrian Pucey speeding off toward the"       
## [3898] "goal posts, but he's blocked by a second Bludger -- sent his way by"          
## [3899] "Fred or George Weasley, can't tell which -- nice play by the Gryffindor"      
## [3900] "Beater, anyway, and Johnson back in possession of the Quaffle, a clear"       
## [3901] "field ahead and off she goes -- she's really flying -- dodges a"              
## [3902] "speeding Bludger -- the goal posts are ahead -- come on, now, Angelina"       
## [3903] "-- Keeper Bletchley dives -- misses -- GRYFFINDORS"                           
## [3904] "SCORE!\"　　Gryffindor cheers filled the cold air, with howls and moans"      
## [3905] "from the Slytherins.　　\"Budge up there, move"                               
## [3906] "along.\"　　\"Hagrid!\"　　Ron and Hermione squeezed together to give"        
## [3907] "Hagrid enough space to join them.　　\"Bin watchin' from me hut,\" said"      
## [3908] "Hagrid, patting a large pair of binoculars around his neck, \"But it"         
## [3909] "isn't the same as bein' in the crowd. No sign of the Snitch yet,"             
## [3910] "eh?\"　　\"Nope,\" said Ron. \"Harry hasn't had much to do yet.\"　　\"Kept"  
## [3911] "outta trouble, though, that's somethin',\" said Hagrid, raising his"          
## [3912] "binoculars and peering skyward at the speck that was Harry.　　Way up"        
## [3913] "above them, Harry was gliding over the game, squinting about for some"        
## [3914] "sign of the Snitch. This was part of his and Wood's game plan.　　\"Keep"     
## [3915] "out of the way until you catch sight of the Snitch,\" Wood had said. \"We"    
## [3916] "don't want you attacked before you have to be.\"　　When Angelina had"        
## [3917] "scored, Harry had done a couple of loop-the-loops to let off his"             
## [3918] "feelings. Now he was back to staring around for the Snitch. Once he"          
## [3919] "caught sight of a flash of gold, but it was just a reflection from one"       
## [3920] "of the Weasleys' wristwatches, and once a Bludger decided to come"            
## [3921] "pelting his way, more like a cannonball than anything, but Harry dodged"      
## [3922] "it and Fred Weasley came chasing after it.　　\"All right there, Harry?\""    
## [3923] "he had time to yell, as he beat the Bludger furiously toward Marcus"          
## [3924] "Flint.　　\"Slytherin in possession,\" Lee Jordan was saying, \"Chaser"       
## [3925] "Pucey ducks two Bludgers, two Weasleys, and Chaser Bell, and speeds"          
## [3926] "toward the -- wait a moment -- was that the Snitch?\"　　A murmur ran"        
## [3927] "through the crowd as Adrian Pucey dropped the Quaffle, too busy looking"      
## [3928] "over his shoulder at the flash of gold that had passed his left"              
## [3929] "ear.　　Harry saw it. In a great rush of excitement he dived downward"        
## [3930] "after the streak of gold. Slytherin Seeker Terence Higgs had seen it,"        
## [3931] "too. Neck and neck they hurtled toward the Snitch -all the Chasers"           
## [3932] "seemed to have forgotten what they were supposed to be doing as they"         
## [3933] "hung in midair to watch.　　Harry was faster than Higgs -- he could see"      
## [3934] "the little round ball, wings fluttering, darting up ahead - - he put on"      
## [3935] "an extra spurt of speed --　　WHAM! A roar of rage echoed from the"           
## [3936] "Gryffindors below -- Marcus Flint had blocked Harry on purpose, and"          
## [3937] "Harry's broom spun off course, Harry holding on for dear"                     
## [3938] "life.　　\"Foul!\" screamed the Gryffindors.　　Madam Hooch spoke angrily"    
## [3939] "to Flint and then ordered a free shot at the goal posts for Gryffindor."      
## [3940] "But in all the confusion, of course, the Golden Snitch had disappeared"       
## [3941] "from sight again.　　Down in the stands, Dean Thomas was yelling, \"Send"     
## [3942] "him off, ref! Red card!\"　　\"What are you talking about, Dean?\" said"      
## [3943] "Ron.　　\"Red card!\" said Dean furiously. \"In soccer you get shown the"     
## [3944] "red card and you're out of the game!\"　　\"But this isn't soccer, Dean,\""   
## [3945] "Ron reminded him.　　Hagrid, however, was on Dean's side.　　\"They"          
## [3946] "oughta change the rules. Flint coulda knocked Harry outta the"                
## [3947] "air.\"　　Lee Jordan was finding it difficult not to take sides.　　\"So"     
## [3948] "-- after that obvious and disgusting bit of cheating　　\"Jordan!\""          
## [3949] "growled Professor McGonagall.　　\"I mean, after that open and revolting"     
## [3950] "foul　　'Jordan, I'm warning you --\"　　\"All right, all right. Flint"       
## [3951] "nearly kills the Gryffindor Seeker, which could happen to anyone, I'm"        
## [3952] "sure, so a penalty to Gryffindor, taken by Spinner, who puts it away,"        
## [3953] "no trouble, and we continue play, Gryffindor still in"                        
## [3954] "possession.\"　　It was as Harry dodged another Bludger, which went"          
## [3955] "spinning dangerously past his head, that it happened. His broom gave a"       
## [3956] "sudden, frightening lurch. For a split second, he thought he was going"       
## [3957] "to fall. He gripped the broom tightly with both his hands and knees."         
## [3958] "He'd never felt anything like that.　　It happened again. It was as"          
## [3959] "though the broom was trying to buck him off. But Nimbus Two Thousands"        
## [3960] "did not suddenly decide to buck their riders off. Harry tried to turn"        
## [3961] "back toward the Gryffindor goal- posts -- he had half a mind to ask"          
## [3962] "Wood to call time-out -- and then he realized that his broom was"             
## [3963] "completely out of his control. He couldn't turn it. He couldn't direct"       
## [3964] "it at all. It was zigzagging through the air, and every now and then"         
## [3965] "making violent swishing movements that almost unseated him.　　Lee was"       
## [3966] "still commentating.　　\"Slytherin in possession -- Flint with the"           
## [3967] "Quaffle -- passes Spinnet -- passes Bell -- hit hard in the face by a"        
## [3968] "Bludger, hope it broke his nose -- only joking, Professor -- Slytherins"      
## [3969] "score -- A no...　　The Slytherins were cheering. No one seemed to have"      
## [3970] "noticed that Harry's broom was behaving strangely. It was carrying- him"      
## [3971] "slowly higher, away from the game, jerking and twitching as it"               
## [3972] "went.　　 \"Dunno what Harry thinks he's doing,\" Hagrid mumbled. He"         
## [3973] "stared through his binoculars. \"If I didn' know better, I'd say he'd"        
## [3974] "lost control of his broom... but he can't have....\"　　Suddenly, people"     
## [3975] "were pointing up at Harry all over the stands. His broom had started to"      
## [3976] "roll over and over, with him only just managing to hold on. Then the"         
## [3977] "whole crowd gasped. Harry's broom had given a wild jerk and Harry swung"      
## [3978] "off it. He was now dangling from it, holding on with only one"                
## [3979] "hand.　　\"Did something happen to it when Flint blocked him?\" Seamus"       
## [3980] "whispered.　　\"Can't have,\" Hagrid said, his voice shaking. \"Can't"        
## [3981] "nothing interfere with a broomstick except powerful Dark magic -- no"         
## [3982] "kid could do that to a Nimbus Two Thousand.\"　　At these words,"             
## [3983] "Hermione seized Hagrid's binoculars, but instead of looking up at"            
## [3984] "Harry, she started looking frantically at the crowd.　　\"What are you"       
## [3985] "doing?\" moaned Ron, gray-faced.　　\"I knew it,\" Hermione gasped, \"Snape"  
## [3986] "-- look.\"　　Ron grabbed the binoculars. Snape was in the middle of the"     
## [3987] "stands opposite them. He had his eyes fixed on Harry and was muttering"       
## [3988] "nonstop under his breath.　　\"He's doing something -- jinxing the"           
## [3989] "broom,\" said Hermione.　　\"What should we do?\"　　\"Leave it to"           
## [3990] "me.\"　　Before Ron could say another word, Hermione had disappeared."        
## [3991] "Ron turned the binoculars back on Harry. His broom was vibrating so"          
## [3992] "hard, it was almost impossible for him to hang on much longer. The"           
## [3993] "whole crowd was on its feet, watching, terrified, as the Weasleys flew"       
## [3994] "up to try and pull Harry safely onto one of their brooms, but it was no"      
## [3995] "good -- every time they got near him, the broom would jump higher"            
## [3996] "still. They dropped lower and circled beneath him, obviously hoping to"       
## [3997] "catch him if he fell. Marcus　　Flint seized the Quaffle and scored"          
## [3998] "five times without anyone noticing.　　\"Come on, Hermione,\" Ron"            
## [3999] "muttered desperately.　　Hermione had fought her way across to the"           
## [4000] "stand where Snape stood, and was now racing along the row behind him;"        
## [4001] "she didn't even stop to say sorry as she knocked Professor Quirrell"          
## [4002] "headfirst into the row in front. Reaching Snape, she crouched down,"          
## [4003] "pulled out her wand, and whispered a few, well- chosen words. Bright"         
## [4004] "blue flames shot from her wand onto the hem of Snape's robes.　　It"          
## [4005] "took perhaps thirty seconds for Snape to realize that he was on fire. A"      
## [4006] "sudden yelp told her she had done her job. Scooping the fire off him"         
## [4007] "into a little jar in her pocket, she scrambled back along the row --"         
## [4008] "Snape would never know what had happened.　　It was enough. Up in the"        
## [4009] "air, Harry was suddenly able to clamber back on to his"                       
## [4010] "broom.　　\"Neville, you can look!\" Ron said. Neville had been sobbing"      
## [4011] "into Hagrid's jacket for the last five minutes.　　Harry was speeding"        
## [4012] "toward the ground when the crowd saw him clap his hand to his mouth as"       
## [4013] "though he was about to be sick -- he hit the field on all fours --"           
## [4014] "coughed -- and something gold fell into his hand.　　\"I've got the"          
## [4015] "Snitch!\" he shouted, waving it above his head, and the game ended in"        
## [4016] "complete confusion.　　\"He didn't catch it, he nearly swallowed it,\""       
## [4017] "Flint was still howling twenty minutes later, but it made no difference"      
## [4018] "-- Harry hadn't broken any rules and Lee Jordan was still happily"            
## [4019] "shouting the results -- Gryffindor had won by one hundred and seventy"        
## [4020] "points to sixty. Harry heard none of this, though. He was being made a"       
## [4021] "cup of strong tea back in Hagrid's hut, with Ron and Hermione.　　\"It"       
## [4022] "was Snape,\" Ron was explaining, \"Hermione and I saw him. He was cursing"    
## [4023] "your broomstick, muttering, he wouldn't take his eyes off"                    
## [4024] "you.\"　　\"Rubbish,\" said Hagrid, who hadn't heard a word of what had"      
## [4025] "gone on next to him in the stands. \"Why would Snape do somethin' like"       
## [4026] "that?\"　　Harry, Ron, and Hermione looked at one another, wondering"         
## [4027] "what to tell him. Harry decided on the truth.　　\"I found out something"     
## [4028] "about him,\" he told Hagrid. \"He tried to get past that three-headed dog"    
## [4029] "on Halloween. It bit him. We think he was trying to steal whatever it's"      
## [4030] "guarding.\"　　Hagrid dropped the teapot.　　\"How do you know about"         
## [4031] "Fluffy?\" he said.　　\"Fluffy?\"　　\"Yeah -- he's mine -- bought him off"   
## [4032] "a Greek chappie I met in the pub las' year -- I lent him to Dumbledore"       
## [4033] "to guard the　　\"Yes?\" said Harry eagerly.　　\"Now, don't ask me"          
## [4034] "anymore,\" said Hagrid gruffly. \"That's top secret, that is.\"　　\"But"     
## [4035] "Snape's trying to steal it.\"　　\"Rubbish,\" said Hagrid again. \"Snape's"   
## [4036] "a Hogwarts teacher, he'd do nothin' of the sort.\"　　\"So why did he"        
## [4037] "just try and kill Harry?\" cried Hermione.　　The afternoon's events"         
## [4038] "certainly seemed to have changed her mind about Snape.　　I know a jinx"      
## [4039] "when I see one, Hagrid, I've read all about them!　　You've got to keep"      
## [4040] "eye contact, and Snape wasn't blinking at all, I saw him!\"　　\"I'm"         
## [4041] "tellin' yeh, yer wrong!\" said Hagrid hotly. \"I don' know why Harry's"       
## [4042] "broom acted like that, but Snape wouldn' try an' kill a student! Now,"        
## [4043] "listen to me, all three of yeh -- yer meddlin' in things that don'"           
## [4044] "concern yeh. It's dangerous. You forget that dog, an' you forget what"        
## [4045] "it's guardin', that's between Professor Dumbledore an' Nicolas Flamel"        
## [4046] "--\"　　\"Aha!\" said Harry, \"so there's someone called Nicolas Flamel"      
## [4047] "involved, is there?\"　　Hagrid looked furious with himself.　　 THE"         
## [4048] "MIRROR OF ERISED　　Christmas was coming. One morning in mid-December,"       
## [4049] "Hogwarts woke to find itself covered in several feet of snow. The lake"       
## [4050] "froze solid and the Weasley twins were punished for bewitching several"       
## [4051] "snowballs so that they followed Quirrell around, bouncing off the back"       
## [4052] "of his turban. The few owls that managed to battle their way through"         
## [4053] "the stormy sky to deliver mail had to be nursed back to health by"            
## [4054] "Hagrid before they could fly off again.　　No one could wait for the"         
## [4055] "holidays to start. While the Gryffindor common room and the Great Hall"       
## [4056] "had roaring fires, the drafty corridors had become icy and a bitter"          
## [4057] "wind rattled the windows in the classrooms. Worst of all were Professor"      
## [4058] "Snape's classes down in the dungeons, where their breath rose in a mist"      
## [4059] "before them and they kept as close as possible to their hot"                  
## [4060] "cauldrons.　　\"I do feel so sorry,\" said Draco Malfoy, one Potions"         
## [4061] "class, \"for all those people who have to stay at Hogwarts for Christmas"     
## [4062] "because they're not wanted at home.\"　　He was looking over at Harry as"     
## [4063] "he spoke. Crabbe and Goyle chuckled. Harry, who was measuring out"            
## [4064] "powdered spine of lionfish, ignored them. Malfoy had been even more"          
## [4065] "unpleasant than usual since the Quidditch match. Disgusted that the"          
## [4066] "Slytherins had lost, he had tried to get everyone laughing at how a"          
## [4067] "wide-mouthed tree frog would be replacing Harry as Seeker next. Then"         
## [4068] "he'd realized that nobody found this funny, because they were all so"         
## [4069] "impressed at the way Harry had managed to stay on his bucking"                
## [4070] "broomstick. So Malfoy, jealous and angry, had gone back to taunting"          
## [4071] "Harry about having no proper family.　　It was true that Harry wasn't"        
## [4072] "going back to Privet Drive for Christmas. Professor McGonagall had come"      
## [4073] "around the week before, making a list of students who would be staying"       
## [4074] "for the holidays, and Harry had signed up at once. He didn't feel sorry"      
## [4075] "for himself at all; this would probably be the best Christmas he'd ever"      
## [4076] "had. Ron and his brothers were staying, too, because Mr. and Mrs."            
## [4077] "Weasley were going to Romania to visit Charlie.　　When they left the"        
## [4078] "dungeons at the end of Potions, they found a large fir tree blocking"         
## [4079] "the corridor ahead. Two enormous feet sticking out at the bottom and a"       
## [4080] "loud puffing sound told them that Hagrid was behind it.　　\"Hi, Hagrid,"     
## [4081] "want any help?\" Ron asked, sticking his head through the"                    
## [4082] "branches.　　\"Nah, I'm all right, thanks, Ron.\"　　\"Would you mind"        
## [4083] "moving out of the way?\" came Malfoys cold drawl from behind them. \"Are"     
## [4084] "you trying to earn some extra money, Weasley? Hoping to be gamekeeper"        
## [4085] "yourself when you leave Hogwarts, I suppose -- that hut of Hagrid's"          
## [4086] "must seem like a palace compared to what your family's used to.\"　　Ron"     
## [4087] "dived at Malfoy just as Snape came up the stairs.　　\"WEASLEY!\"　　Ron"     
## [4088] "let go of the front of Malfoy's robes.　　\"He was provoked, Professor"       
## [4089] "Snape,\" said Hagrid, sticking his huge hairy face out from behind the"       
## [4090] "tree. \"Malfoy was insultin' his family.\"　　\"Be that as it may,"           
## [4091] "fighting is against Hogwarts rules, Hagrid,\" said Snape silkily. \"Five"     
## [4092] "points from Gryffindor, Weasley, and be grateful it isn't more. Move"         
## [4093] "along, all of you.\"　　Malfoy, Crabbe, and Goyle pushed roughly past"        
## [4094] "the tree, scattering needles everywhere and smirking.　　\"I'll get"          
## [4095] "him,\" said Ron, grinding his teeth at Malfoy's back, \"one of these"         
## [4096] "days, I'll get him --\"　　\"I hate them both,\" said Harry, \"Malfoy and"    
## [4097] "Snape.\"　　\"Come on, cheer up, it's nearly Christmas,\" said Hagrid."       
## [4098] "\"Tell yeh what, come with me an' see the Great Hall, looks a"                
## [4099] "treat.\"　　So the three of them followed Hagrid and his tree off to"         
## [4100] "-the Great Hall, where Professor McGonagall and Professor Flitwick were"      
## [4101] "busy with the Christmas decorations.　　\"Ah, Hagrid, the last tree --"       
## [4102] "put it in the far corner, would you?\"　　The hall looked spectacular."       
## [4103] "Festoons of holly and mistletoe hung all around the walls, and no less"       
## [4104] "than twelve towering Christmas trees stood around the room, some"             
## [4105] "sparkling with tiny icicles, some glittering with hundreds of"                
## [4106] "candles.　　\"How many days you got left until yer holidays?\" Hagrid"        
## [4107] "asked.　　\"Just one,\" said Hermione. \"And that reminds me -Harry, Ron,"    
## [4108] "we've got half an hour before lunch, we should be in the"                     
## [4109] "library.\"　　\"Oh yeah, you're right,\" said Ron, tearing his eyes away"     
## [4110] "from Professor Flitwick, who had golden bubbles blossoming out of his"        
## [4111] "wand and was trailing them over the branches of the new tree.　　\"The"       
## [4112] "library?\" said Hagrid, following them out of the hall. \"Just before the"    
## [4113] "holidays? Bit keen, aren't yeh?\"　　\"Oh, we're not working,\" Harry told"   
## [4114] "him brightly. \"Ever since you mentioned Nicolas Flamel we've been"           
## [4115] "trying to find out who he is.\"　　\"You what?\" Hagrid looked shocked."      
## [4116] "\"Listen here -- I've told yeh -- drop it. It's nothin' to you what that"     
## [4117] "dog's guardin'.\"　　\"We just want to know who Nicolas Flamel is, that's"    
## [4118] "all,\" said Hermione.　　\"Unless you'd like to tell us and save us the"      
## [4119] "trouble?\" Harry added. \"We must've been through hundreds of books"          
## [4120] "already and we can't find him anywhere -- just give us a hint -- I know"      
## [4121] "I've read his name somewhere.\"　　\"I'm sayin' nothin, said Hagrid"          
## [4122] "flatly.　　\"Just have to find out for ourselves, then,\" said Ron, and"      
## [4123] "they left Hagrid looking disgruntled and hurried off to the"                  
## [4124] "library.　　They had indeed been searching books for Flamel's name ever"      
## [4125] "since Hagrid had let it slip, because how else were they going to find"       
## [4126] "out what Snape was trying to steal? The trouble was, it was very hard"        
## [4127] "to know where to begin, not knowing what Flamel might have done to get"       
## [4128] "himself into a book. He wasn't in Great Wizards of the Twentieth"             
## [4129] "Century, or Notable Magical Names of Our Time; he was missing, too,"          
## [4130] "from Important Modern Magical Discoveries, and A Study of Recent"             
## [4131] "Developments in Wizardry. And then, of course, there was the sheer size"      
## [4132] "of the library; tens of thousands of books; thousands of shelves;"            
## [4133] "hundreds of narrow rows.　　Hermione took out a list of subjects and"         
## [4134] "titles she had decided to search while Ron strode off down a row of"          
## [4135] "books and started pulling them off the shelves at random. Harry"              
## [4136] "wandered over to the Restricted Section. He had been wondering for a"         
## [4137] "while if Flamel wasn't somewhere in there. Unfortunately, you needed a"       
## [4138] "specially signed note from one of the teachers to look in any of the"         
## [4139] "restricted books, and he knew he'd never get one. These were the books"       
## [4140] "containing powerful Dark Magic never taught at Hogwarts, and only read"       
## [4141] "by older students studying advanced Defense Against the Dark"                 
## [4142] "Arts.　　\"What are you looking for, boy?\"　　\"Nothing,\" said"             
## [4143] "Harry.　　Madam Pince the librarian brandished a feather duster at"           
## [4144] "him.　　\"You'd better get out, then. Go on -- out!\"　　Wishing he'd"        
## [4145] "been a bit quicker at thinking up some story, Harry left the library."        
## [4146] "He, Ron, and Hermione had already agreed they'd better not ask Madam"         
## [4147] "Pince where they could find Flamel. They were sure she'd be able to"          
## [4148] "tell them, but they couldn't risk Snape hearing what they were up"            
## [4149] "to.　　Harry waited outside in the corridor to see if the other two had"      
## [4150] "found anything, but he wasn't very hopeful. They had been looking for"        
## [4151] "two weeks, after A, but as they only had odd moments between lessons it"      
## [4152] "wasn't surprising they'd found nothing. What they really needed was a"        
## [4153] "nice long search without Madam Pince breathing down their"                    
## [4154] "necks.　　Five minutes later, Ron and Hermione joined him, shaking"           
## [4155] "their heads. They went off to lunch.　　\"You will keep looking while"        
## [4156] "I'm away, won't you?\" said Hermione. \"And send me an owl if you find"       
## [4157] "anything.\"　　\"And you could ask your parents if they know who Flamel"      
## [4158] "is,\" said Ron. \"It'd be safe to ask them.\"　　\"Very safe, as they're"     
## [4159] "both dentists,\" said Hermione.　　Once the holidays had started, Ron"        
## [4160] "and Harry were having too good a time to think much about Flamel. They"       
## [4161] "had the dormitory to themselves and the common room was far emptier"          
## [4162] "than usual, so they were able to get the good armchairs by the fire."         
## [4163] "They sat by the hour eating anything they could spear on a toasting"          
## [4164] "fork -- bread, English muffins, marshmallows -- and plotting ways of"         
## [4165] "getting Malfoy expelled, which were fun to talk about even if they"           
## [4166] "wouldn't work.　　Ron also started teaching Harry wizard chess. This"         
## [4167] "was exactly like Muggle chess except that the figures were alive, which"      
## [4168] "made it a lot like directing troops in battle. Ron's set was very old"        
## [4169] "and battered. Like everything else he owned, it had once belonged to"         
## [4170] "someone else in his family -- in this case, his grandfather. However,"        
## [4171] "old chessmen weren't a drawback at all. Ron knew them so well he never"       
## [4172] "had trouble getting them to do what he wanted.　　Harry played with"          
## [4173] "chessmen Seamus Finnigan had lent him, and they didn't trust him at"          
## [4174] "all. He wasn't a very good player yet and they kept shouting different"       
## [4175] "bits of advice at him, which was confusing. \"Don't send me there, can't"     
## [4176] "you see his knight? Send him, we can afford to lose him.\" On Christmas"      
## [4177] "Eve, Harry went to bed looking forward to the next day for the food and"      
## [4178] "the fun, but not expecting any presents at all. When he woke early in"        
## [4179] "the morning, however, the first thing he saw was a small pile of"             
## [4180] "packages at the foot of his bed.　　 \"Merry Christmas,\" said Ron"           
## [4181] "sleepily as Harry scrambled out of bed and pulled on his"                     
## [4182] "bathrobe.　　\"You, too,\" said Harry. \"Will you look at this? I've got"     
## [4183] "some presents!\"　　\"What did you expect, turnips?\" said Ron, turning to"   
## [4184] "his own pile, which was a lot bigger than Harry's.　　Harry picked up"        
## [4185] "the top parcel. It was wrapped in thick brown paper and scrawled across"      
## [4186] "it was To Harry, from Hagrid. Inside was a roughly cut wooden flute."         
## [4187] "Hagrid had obviously whittled it himself. Harry blew it -- it sounded a"      
## [4188] "bit like an owl.　　A second, very small parcel contained a note.　　We"      
## [4189] "received your message and enclose your Christmas present. From Uncle"         
## [4190] "Vernon and Aunt Petunia. Taped to the note was a fifty-pence"                 
## [4191] "piece.　　\"That's friendly,\" said Harry.　　Ron was fascinated by the"      
## [4192] "fifty pence.　　\"Weird!\" he said, 'NMat a shape! This is"                   
## [4193] "money?\"　　\"You can keep it,\" said Harry, laughing at how pleased Ron"     
## [4194] "was. \"Hagrid and my aunt and uncle -- so who sent these?\"　　\"I think I"   
## [4195] "know who that one's from,\" said Ron, turning a bit pink and pointing to"     
## [4196] "a very lumpy parcel. \"My mom. I told her you didn't expect any presents"     
## [4197] "and -- oh, no,\" he groaned, \"she's made you a Weasley"                      
## [4198] "sweater.\"　　Harry had torn open the parcel to find a thick,"                
## [4199] "hand-knitted sweater in emerald green and a large box of homemade"            
## [4200] "fudge.　　\"Every year she makes us a sweater,\" said Ron, unwrapping his"    
## [4201] "own, \"and mine's always maroon.\"　　\"That's really nice of her,\" said"    
## [4202] "Harry, trying the fudge, which was very tasty.　　His next present also"      
## [4203] "contained candy -- a large box of Chocolate Frogs from"                       
## [4204] "Hermione.　　This only left one parcel. Harry picked it up and felt it."      
## [4205] "It was very light. He unwrapped it.　　Something fluid and silvery gray"      
## [4206] "went slithering to the floor where it lay in gleaming folds. Ron"             
## [4207] "gasped.　　\"I've heard of those,\" he said in a hushed voice, dropping"      
## [4208] "the box of Every Flavor Beans he'd gotten from Hermione. \"If that's"         
## [4209] "what I think it is -- they're really rare, and really"                        
## [4210] "valuable.\"　　\"What is it?\"　　Harry picked the shining, silvery cloth"    
## [4211] "off the floor. It was strange to the touch, like water woven into"            
## [4212] "material.　　\"It's an invisibility cloak,\" said Ron, a look of awe on"      
## [4213] "his face. \"I'm sure it is -- try it on.\"　　Harry threw the cloak"          
## [4214] "around his shoulders and Ron gave a yell.　　\"It is! Look"                   
## [4215] "down!\"　　Harry looked down at his feet, but they were gone. He dashed"      
## [4216] "to the mirror. Sure enough, his reflection looked back at him, just his"      
## [4217] "head suspended in midair, his body completely invisible. He pulled the"       
## [4218] "cloak over his head and his reflection vanished completely.　　\"There's"     
## [4219] "a note!\" said Ron suddenly. \"A note fell out of it!\"　　Harry pulled"      
## [4220] "off the cloak and seized the letter. Written in narrow, loopy writing"        
## [4221] "he had never seen before were the following words: Your father left"          
## [4222] "this in my possession before he died. It is time it was returned to"          
## [4223] "you. Use it well.　　A Very Merry Christmas to you.　　There was no"          
## [4224] "signature. Harry stared at the note. Ron was admiring the"                    
## [4225] "cloak.　　\"I'd give anything for one of these,\" he said. \"Anything."       
## [4226] "What's the matter?\"　　\"Nothing,\" said Harry. He felt very strange. Who"   
## [4227] "had sent the cloak? Had it really once belonged to his"                       
## [4228] "father?　　Before he could say or think anything else, the dormitory"         
## [4229] "door was flung open and Fred and George Weasley bounded in. Harry"            
## [4230] "stuffed the cloak quickly out of sight. He didn't feel like sharing it"       
## [4231] "with anyone else yet.　　\"Merry Christmas!\"　　\"Hey, look -- Harry's"      
## [4232] "got a Weasley sweater, too!\"　　Fred and George were wearing blue"           
## [4233] "sweaters, one with a large yellow F on it, the other a G.　　\"Harry's"       
## [4234] "is better than ours, though,\" said Fred, holding up Harry's sweater."        
## [4235] "\"She obviously makes more of an effort if you're not family.\"　　\"Why"     
## [4236] "aren't you wearing yours, Ron?\" George demanded. \"Come on, get it on,"      
## [4237] "they're lovely and warm.\"　　\"I hate maroon,\" Ron moaned halfheartedly"    
## [4238] "as he pulled it over his head.　　\"You haven't got a letter on yours,\""     
## [4239] "George observed. \"I suppose she thinks you don't forget your name. But"      
## [4240] "we're not stupid -- we know we're called Gred and Forge.\"　　\"What's"       
## [4241] "all th is noise.　　Percy Weasley stuck his head through the door,"           
## [4242] "looking disapproving. He had clearly gotten halfway through unwrapping"       
## [4243] "his presents as he, too, carried a lumpy sweater over his arm,"               
## [4244] "which　　Fred seized.　　\"P for prefect! Get it on, Percy, come on,"         
## [4245] "we're all wearing ours, even Harry got one.\"　　\"I -- don't -- want"        
## [4246] "said Percy thickly, as the twins forced the sweater over his head,"           
## [4247] "knocking his glasses askew.　　\"And you're not sitting with the"             
## [4248] "prefects today, either,\" said　　George. \"Christmas is a time for"          
## [4249] "family.\"　　They frog-marched Percy from the room, his arms pinned to"       
## [4250] "his side by his sweater.　　Harry had never in all his life had such a"       
## [4251] "Christmas dinner. A hundred fat, roast turkeys; mountains of roast and"       
## [4252] "boiled potatoes; platters of chipolatas; tureens of buttered peas,"           
## [4253] "silver boats of thick, rich gravy and cranberry sauce -- and stacks of"       
## [4254] "wizard crackers every few feet along the table. These fantastic party"        
## [4255] "favors were nothing like the feeble Muggle ones the Dursleys usually"         
## [4256] "bought, with their little plastic toys and their flimsy paper hats"           
## [4257] "inside. Harry pulled a wizard cracker with Fred and it didn't just"           
## [4258] "bang, it went off with a blast like a cannon and engulfed them all in a"      
## [4259] "cloud of blue smoke, while from the inside exploded a rear admiral's"         
## [4260] "hat and several live, white mice. Up at the High Table, Dumbledore had"       
## [4261] "swapped his pointed wizard's hat for a flowered bonnet, and was"              
## [4262] "chuckling merrily at a joke Professor Flitwick had just read"                 
## [4263] "him.　　Flaming Christmas puddings followed the turkey. Percy nearly"         
## [4264] "broke his teeth on a silver sickle embedded in his slice. Harry watched"      
## [4265] "Hagrid getting redder and redder in the face as he called for more"           
## [4266] "wine, finally kissing Professor McGonagall on the cheek, who, to"             
## [4267] "Harry's amazement, giggled and blushed, her top hat lopsided.　　When"        
## [4268] "Harry finally left the table, he was laden down with a stack of things"       
## [4269] "out of the crackers, including a pack of nonexplodable, luminous"             
## [4270] "balloons, a Grow-Your-Own-Warts kit, and his own new wizard chess set."       
## [4271] "The white mice had disappeared and Harry had a nasty feeling they were"       
## [4272] "going to end up as Mrs. Norris's Christmas dinner.　　Harry and the"          
## [4273] "Weasleys spent a happy afternoon having a furious snowball fight on the"      
## [4274] "grounds. Then, cold, wet, and gasping for breath, they returned to the"       
## [4275] "fire in the Gryffindor common room, where Harry broke in his new chess"       
## [4276] "set by losing spectacularly to Ron. He suspected he wouldn't have lost"       
## [4277] "so badly if Percy hadn't tried to help him so much.　　After a meal of"       
## [4278] "turkey sandwiches, crumpets, trifle, and Christmas cake, everyone felt"       
## [4279] "too full and sleepy to do much before bed except sit and watch Percy"         
## [4280] "chase Fred and George all over Gryffindor tower because they'd stolen"        
## [4281] "his prefect badge.　　It had been Harry's best Christmas day ever. Yet"       
## [4282] "something had been nagging at the back of his mind all day. Not until"        
## [4283] "he climbed into bed was he free to think about it: the invisibility"          
## [4284] "cloak and whoever had sent it.　　Ron, full of turkey and cake and with"      
## [4285] "nothing mysterious to bother him, fell asleep almost as soon as he'd"         
## [4286] "drawn the curtains of his four-poster. Harry leaned over the side of"         
## [4287] "his own bed and pulled the cloak out from under it.　　His father's..."       
## [4288] "this had been his father's. He let the material flow over his hands,"         
## [4289] "smoother than silk, light as air. Use it well, the note had said.　　He"      
## [4290] "had to try it, now. He slipped out of bed and wrapped the cloak around"       
## [4291] "himself. Looking down at his legs, he saw only moonlight and shadows."        
## [4292] "It was a very funny feeling.　　Use it well.　　Suddenly, Harry felt"         
## [4293] "wide-awake. The whole of Hogwarts was open to him in this cloak."             
## [4294] "Excitement flooded through him as he stood there in the dark and"             
## [4295] "silence. He could go anywhere in this, anywhere, and Filch would never"       
## [4296] "know.　　Ron grunted in his sleep. Should Harry wake him? Something"          
## [4297] "held him back -- his father's cloak -- he felt that this time -- the"         
## [4298] "first time -- he wanted to use it alone.　　He crept out of the"              
## [4299] "dormitory, down the stairs, across the common room, and climbed through"      
## [4300] "the portrait hole.　　\"Who's there?\" squawked the Fat Lady. Harry said"     
## [4301] "nothing. He walked quickly down the corridor.　　Where should he go? He"      
## [4302] "stopped, his heart racing, and thought. And then it came to him. The"         
## [4303] "Restricted Section in the library. He'd be able to read as long as he"        
## [4304] "liked, as long as it took to find out who Flamel was. He set off,"            
## [4305] "drawing the invisibility cloak tight around him as he walked.　　The"         
## [4306] "library was pitch-black and very eerie. Harry lit a lamp to see his way"      
## [4307] "along the rows of books. The lamp looked as if it was floating along in"      
## [4308] "midair, and even though Harry could feel his arm supporting it, the"          
## [4309] "sight gave him the creeps.　　The Restricted Section was right at the"        
## [4310] "back of the library. Step ping carefully over the rope that separated"        
## [4311] "these books from the rest of the library, he held up his lamp to read"        
## [4312] "the titles.　　They didn't tell him much. Their peeling, faded gold"          
## [4313] "letters spelled words in languages Harry couldn't understand. Some had"       
## [4314] "no title at all. One book had a dark stain on it that looked horribly"        
## [4315] "like blood. The hairs on the back of Harry's neck prickled. Maybe he"         
## [4316] "was imagining it, maybe not, but he thought a faint whispering was"           
## [4317] "coming from the books, as though they knew someone was there who"             
## [4318] "shouldn't be.　　He had to start somewhere. Setting the lamp down"            
## [4319] "carefully on the floor, he looked along the bottom shelf for an"              
## [4320] "interestinglooking book. A large black and silver volume caught his"          
## [4321] "eye. He pulled it out with difficulty, because it was very heavy, and,"       
## [4322] "balancing it on his knee, let it fall open.　　A piercing,"                   
## [4323] "bloodcurdling shriek split the silence -- the book was screaming! Harry"      
## [4324] "snapped it shut, but the shriek went on and on, one high, unbroken,"          
## [4325] "earsplitting note. He stumbled backward and knocked over his lamp,"           
## [4326] "which went out at once. Panicking, he heard footsteps coming down the"        
## [4327] "corridor outside -- stuffing the shrieking book back on the shelf, he"        
## [4328] "ran for it. He passed Filch in the doorway; Filch's pale, wild eyes"          
## [4329] "looked straight through him, and Harry slipped under Filch's"                 
## [4330] "outstretched arm and streaked off up the corridor, the book's shrieks"        
## [4331] "still ringing in his ears.　　He came to a sudden halt in front of a"         
## [4332] "tall suit of armor. He had been so busy getting away from the library,"       
## [4333] "he hadn't paid attention to where he was going. Perhaps because it was"       
## [4334] "dark, he didn't recognize where he was at all. There was a suit of"           
## [4335] "armor near the kitchens, he knew, but he must be five floors above"           
## [4336] "there.　　\"You asked me to come directly to you, Professor, if anyone"       
## [4337] "was wandering around at night, and somebody's been in the library"            
## [4338] "Restricted Section.\"　　Harry felt the blood drain out of his face."         
## [4339] "Wherever he was, Filch must know a shortcut, because his soft, greasy"        
## [4340] "voice was getting nearer, and to his horror, it was Snape who replied,"       
## [4341] "\"The Restricted Section? Well, they can't be far, we'll catch"               
## [4342] "them.\"　　Harry stood rooted to the spot as Filch and Snape came around"     
## [4343] "the corner ahead. They couldn't see him, of course, but it was a narrow"      
## [4344] "corridor and if they came much nearer they'd knock right into him --"         
## [4345] "the cloak didn't stop him from being solid.　　He backed away as"             
## [4346] "quietly as he could. A door stood ajar to his left. It was his only"          
## [4347] "hope. He squeezed through it, holding his breath, trying not to move"         
## [4348] "it, and to his relief he managed to get inside the room without their"        
## [4349] "noticing anything. They walked straight past, and Harry leaned against"       
## [4350] "the wall, breathing deeply, listening to their footsteps dying away."         
## [4351] "That had been close, very close. It was a few seconds before he noticed"      
## [4352] "anything about the room he had hidden in.　　It looked like an unused"        
## [4353] "classroom. The dark shapes of desks and chairs were piled against the"        
## [4354] "walls, and there was an upturned wastepaper basket -- but propped"            
## [4355] "against the wall facing him was something that didn't look as if it"          
## [4356] "belonged there, something that looked as if someone had just put it"          
## [4357] "there to keep it out of the way.　　It was a magnificent mirror, as"          
## [4358] "high as the ceiling, with an ornate gold frame, standing on two clawed"       
## [4359] "feet. There was an inscription carved around the top: Erised stra ehru"       
## [4360] "oyt ube cafru oyt on wohsi. His panic fading now that there was no"           
## [4361] "sound of Filch and Snape, Harry moved nearer to the mirror, wanting to"       
## [4362] "look at himself but see no reflection again. He stepped in front of"          
## [4363] "it.　　He had to clap his hands to his mouth to stop himself from"            
## [4364] "screaming. He whirled around. His heart was pounding far more furiously"      
## [4365] "than when the book had screamed -- for he had seen not only himself in"       
## [4366] "the mirror, but a whole crowd of people standing right behind"                
## [4367] "him.　　But the room was empty. Breathing very fast, he turned slowly"        
## [4368] "back to the mirror.　　There he was, reflected in it, white and"              
## [4369] "scared-looking, and there, reflected behind him, were at least ten"           
## [4370] "others. Harry looked over his shoulder -- but still, no one was there."       
## [4371] "Or were they all invisible, too? Was he in fact in a room full of"            
## [4372] "invisible people and this mirror's trick was that it reflected them,"         
## [4373] "invisible or not?　　He looked in the mirror again. A woman standing"         
## [4374] "right behind his reflection was smiling at him and waving. He reached"        
## [4375] "out a hand and felt the air behind him. If she was really there, he'd"        
## [4376] "touch her, their reflections were so close together, but he felt only"        
## [4377] "air -- she and the others existed only in the mirror.　　She was a very"      
## [4378] "pretty woman. She had dark red hair and her eyes -- her eyes are just"        
## [4379] "like mine, Harry thought, edging a little closer to the glass. Bright"        
## [4380] "green -- exactly the same shape, but then he noticed that she was"            
## [4381] "crying; smiling, but crying at the same time. The tall, thin,"                
## [4382] "black-haired man standing next to her put his arm around her. He wore"        
## [4383] "glasses, and his hair was very untidy. It stuck up at the back, just as"      
## [4384] "Harry's did.　　Harry was so close to the mirror now that his nose was"       
## [4385] "nearly touching that of his reflection.　　\"Mom?\" he whispered."            
## [4386] "\"Dad?\"　　They just looked at him, smiling. And slowly, Harry looked"       
## [4387] "into the faces of the other people in the mirror, and saw other pairs"        
## [4388] "of green eyes like his, other noses like his, even a little old man who"      
## [4389] "looked as though he had Harry's knobbly knees -- Harry was looking at"        
## [4390] "his family, for the first time in his life.　　The Potters smiled and"        
## [4391] "waved at Harry and he stared hungrily back at them, his hands pressed"        
## [4392] "flat against the glass as though he was hoping to fall right through it"      
## [4393] "and reach them. He had a powerful kind of ache inside him, half joy,"         
## [4394] "half terrible sadness.　　How long he stood there, he didn't know. The"       
## [4395] "reflections did not fade and he looked and looked until a distant noise"      
## [4396] "brought him back to his senses. He couldn't stay here, he had to find"        
## [4397] "his way back to bed. He tore his eyes away from his mother's face,"           
## [4398] "whispered, \"I'll come back,\" and hurried from the room.　　\"You could"     
## [4399] "have woken me up,\" said Ron, crossly.　　\"You can come tonight, I'm"        
## [4400] "going back, I want to show you the mirror.　　\"I'd like to see your mom"     
## [4401] "and dad,\" Ron said eagerly.　　\"And I want to see all your family, all"     
## [4402] "the Weasleys, you'll be able to show me your other brothers and"              
## [4403] "everyone.\"　　\"You can see them any old time,\" said Ron. \"Just come"      
## [4404] "round my house this summer. Anyway, maybe it only shows dead people."         
## [4405] "Shame about not finding Flamel, though. Have some bacon or something,"        
## [4406] "why aren't you eating anything?\"　　Harry couldn't eat. He had seen his"     
## [4407] "parents and would be seeing them again tonight. He had almost forgotten"      
## [4408] "about Flamel. It didn't seem very important anymore. Who cared what the"      
## [4409] "three headed dog was guarding? What did it matter if Snape stole it,"         
## [4410] "really?　　\"Are you all right?\" said Ron. \"You look odd.\"　　What Harry"  
## [4411] "feared most was that he might not be able to find the mirror room"            
## [4412] "again. With Ron covered in the cloak, too, they had to walk much more"        
## [4413] "slowly the next night. They tried retracing Harry's route from the"           
## [4414] "library, wandering around the dark passageways for nearly an"
