## [4415] "hour.　　\"I'm freezing,\" said Ron. \"Let's forget it and go"                
## [4416] "back.\"　　\"No!\" Harry hissed. I know it's here somewhere.\"　　They"       
## [4417] "passed the ghost of a tall witch gliding in the opposite direction, but"      
## [4418] "saw no one else. just as Ron started moaning that his feet were dead"         
## [4419] "with cold, Harry spotted the suit of armor.　　\"It's here -- just here"      
## [4420] "-- yes!\"　　They pushed the door open. Harry dropped the cloak from"         
## [4421] "around his shoulders and ran to the mirror.　　There they were. His"          
## [4422] "mother and father beamed at the sight of him.　　\"See?\" Harry"              
## [4423] "whispered.　　\"I can't see anything.\"　　\"Look! Look at them all..."       
## [4424] "there are loads of them....\"　　\"I can only see you.\"　　\"Look in it"     
## [4425] "properly, go on, stand where I am.\"　　Harry stepped aside, but with"        
## [4426] "Ron in front of the mirror, he couldn't see his family anymore, just"         
## [4427] "Ron in his paisley pajamas.　　Ron, though, was staring transfixed at"        
## [4428] "his image.　　\"Look at me!\" he said.　　\"Can you see all your family"      
## [4429] "standing around you?\"　　\"No -- I'm alone -- but I'm different -- I"        
## [4430] "look older -- and I'm head boy!\"　　\"What?\"　　\"I am -- I'm wearing the"  
## [4431] "badge like Bill used to -- and I'm holding the house cup and the"             
## [4432] "Quidditch cup -- I'm Quidditch captain, too.　　Ron tore his eyes away"       
## [4433] "from this splendid sight to look excitedly at Harry.　　\"Do you think"       
## [4434] "this mirror shows the future?\"　　\"How can it? All my family are dead"      
## [4435] "-- let me have another look --\"　　\"You had it to yourself all last"        
## [4436] "night, give me a bit more time.\"　　\"You're only holding the Quidditch"     
## [4437] "cup, what's interesting about that? I want to see my"                         
## [4438] "parents.\"　　\"Don't push me --\"　　A sudden noise outside in the"          
## [4439] "corridor put an end to their discussion. They hadn't realized how"            
## [4440] "loudly they had been talking.　　\"Quick!\"　　Ron threw the cloak back"      
## [4441] "over them as the luminous eyes of Mrs. Norris came round the door. Ron"       
## [4442] "and Harry stood quite still, both thinking the same thing -- did the"         
## [4443] "cloak work on cats? After what seemed an age, she turned and"                 
## [4444] "left.　　\"This isn't safe -- she might have gone for Filch, I bet she"       
## [4445] "heard us. Come on.\"　　And Ron pulled Harry out of the room.　　The"         
## [4446] "snow still hadn't melted the next morning.　　\"Want to play chess,"          
## [4447] "Harry?\" said Ron.　　\"No.\"　　\"Why don't we go down and visit"            
## [4448] "Hagrid?\"　　\"No... you go...\"　　\"I know what you're thinking about,"     
## [4449] "Harry, that mirror. Don't go back tonight.\"　　\"Why not?\"　　\"I dunno,"   
## [4450] "I've just got a bad feeling about it -- and anyway, you've had too many"      
## [4451] "close shaves already. Filch, Snape, and Mrs. Norris are wandering"            
## [4452] "around. So what if they can't see you? What if they walk into you? What"      
## [4453] "if you knock something over?\"　　\"You sound like Hermione.\"　　\"I'm"      
## [4454] "serious, Harry, don't go.\"　　But Harry only had one thought in his"         
## [4455] "head, which was to get back in front of the mirror, and Ron wasn't"           
## [4456] "going to stop him.　　That third night he found his way more quickly"         
## [4457] "than before. He was walking so fast he knew he was making more noise"         
## [4458] "than was wise, but he didn't meet anyone.　　And there were his mother"       
## [4459] "and father smiling at him again, and one of his grandfathers nodding"         
## [4460] "happily. Harry sank down to sit on the floor in front of the mirror."         
## [4461] "There was nothing to stop him from staying here all night with his"           
## [4462] "family. Nothing at all.　　Except --　　\"So -- back again,"                  
## [4463] "Harry?\"　　Harry felt as though his insides had turned to ice. He"           
## [4464] "looked behind him. Sitting on one of the desks by the wall was none"          
## [4465] "other than Albus Dumbledore. Harry must have walked straight past him,"       
## [4466] "so desperate to get to the mirror he hadn't noticed him.　　\" -- I"          
## [4467] "didn't see you, sir.\"　　\"Strange how nearsighted being invisible can"      
## [4468] "make you,\" said Dumbledore, and Harry was relieved to see that he was"       
## [4469] "smiling.　　\"So,\" said Dumbledore, slipping off the desk to sit on the"     
## [4470] "floor with Harry, \"you, like hundreds before you, have discovered the"       
## [4471] "delights of the Mirror of Erised.\"　　\"I didn't know it was called"         
## [4472] "that, Sir.\"　　\"But I expect you've realized by now what it"                
## [4473] "does?\"　　\"It -- well -- it shows me my family --\"　　\"And it showed"     
## [4474] "your friend Ron himself as head boy.\"　　\"How did you know --?\"　　\"I"    
## [4475] "don't need a cloak to become invisible,\" said Dumbledore gently. \"Now,"     
## [4476] "can you think what the Mirror of Erised shows us all?\"　　Harry shook"       
## [4477] "his head.　　\"Let me explain. The happiest man on earth would be able"       
## [4478] "to use the Mirror of Erised like a normal mirror, that is, he would"          
## [4479] "look into it and see himself exactly as he is. Does that"                     
## [4480] "help?\"　　Harry thought. Then he said slowly, \"It shows us what we"         
## [4481] "want... whatever we want...\"　　\"Yes and no,\" said Dumbledore quietly."    
## [4482] "\"It shows us nothing more or less than the deepest, most desperate"          
## [4483] "desire of our hearts. You, who have never known your family, see them"        
## [4484] "standing around you. Ronald Weasley, who has always been overshadowed"        
## [4485] "by his brothers, sees himself standing alone, the best of all of them."       
## [4486] "However, this mirror will give us neither knowledge or truth. Men have"       
## [4487] "wasted away before it, entranced by what they have seen, or been driven"      
## [4488] "mad, not knowing if what it shows is real or even possible.　　\"The"         
## [4489] "Mirror will be moved to a new home tomorrow, Harry, and I ask you not"        
## [4490] "to go looking for it again. If you ever do run across it, you will now"       
## [4491] "be prepared. It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live,"           
## [4492] "remember that. Now, why don't you put that admirable cloak back on and"       
## [4493] "get off to bed?\"　　Harry stood up.　　\"Sir -- Professor Dumbledore?"       
## [4494] "Can I ask you something?\"　　\"Obviously, you've just done so,\""            
## [4495] "Dumbledore smiled. \"You may ask me one more thing, however.\"　　\"What"     
## [4496] "do you see when you look in the mirror?\"　　\"I? I see myself holding a"     
## [4497] "pair of thick, woolen socks.\"　　Harry stared.　　\"One can never have"      
## [4498] "enough socks,\" said Dumbledore. \"Another Christmas has come and gone"       
## [4499] "and I didn't get a single pair. People will insist on giving me"              
## [4500] "books.\"　　It was only when he was back in bed that it struck Harry"         
## [4501] "that Dumbledore might not have been quite truthful. But then, he"             
## [4502] "thought, as he shoved Scabbers off his pillow, it had been quite a"           
## [4503] "personal question.　　 NICOLAS FLAMEL　　Dumbledore had convinced Harry"      
## [4504] "not to go looking for the Mirror of Erised again, and for the rest of"        
## [4505] "the Christmas holidays the invisibility cloak stayed folded at the"           
## [4506] "bottom of his trunk. Harry wished he could forget what he'd seen in the"      
## [4507] "mirror as easily, but he couldn't. He started having nightmares. Over"        
## [4508] "and over again he dreamed about his parents disappearing in a flash of"       
## [4509] "green light, while a high voice cackled with laughter.　　\"You see,"         
## [4510] "Dumbledore was right, that mirror could drive you mad,\" said Ron, when"      
## [4511] "Harry told him about these drearns.　　Hermione, who came back the day"       
## [4512] "before term started, took a different view of things. She was torn"           
## [4513] "between horror at the idea of Harry being out of bed, roaming the"            
## [4514] "school three nights in a row (\"If Filch had caught you!\"), and"             
## [4515] "disappointment that he hadn't at least found out who Nicolas Flamel"          
## [4516] "was.　　They had almost given up hope of ever finding Flamel in a li-"        
## [4517] "brary book, even though Harry was still sure he'd read the name"              
## [4518] "somewhere. Once term had started, they were back to skimming through"         
## [4519] "books for ten minutes during their breaks. Harry had even less time"          
## [4520] "than the other two, because Quidditch practice had started"                   
## [4521] "again.　　Wood was working the team harder than ever. Even the endless"       
## [4522] "rain that had replaced the snow couldn't dampen his spirits. The"             
## [4523] "Weasleys complained that Wood was becoming a fanatic, but Harry was on"       
## [4524] "Wood's side. If they won their next match, against Hufflepuff, they"          
## [4525] "would overtake Slytherin in the house championship for the first time"        
## [4526] "in seven years. Quite apart from wanting to win, Harry found that he"         
## [4527] "had fewer nightmares when he was tired out after training.　　Then,"          
## [4528] "during one particularly wet and muddy practice session, Wood gave the"        
## [4529] "team a bit of bad news. He'd just gotten very angry with the Weasleys,"       
## [4530] "who kept dive-bombing each other and pretending to fall off their"            
## [4531] "brooms.　　\"Will you stop messing around!\" he yelled. \"That's exactly"     
## [4532] "the sort of thing that'll lose us the match! Snape's refereeing this"         
## [4533] "time, and he'll be looking for any excuse to knock points off"                
## [4534] "Gryffindor!\"　　George Weasley really did fall off his broom at these"       
## [4535] "words.　　\"Snape's refereeing?\" he spluttered through a mouthful of"        
## [4536] "mud. \"When's he ever refereed a Quidditch match? He's not going to be"       
## [4537] "fair if we might overtake Slytherin.\"　　The rest of the team landed"        
## [4538] "next to George to complain, too.　　\"It's not my fault,\" said Wood."        
## [4539] "\"We've just got to make sure we play a clean game, so Snape hasn't got"      
## [4540] "an excuse to pick on us.\"　　Which was all very well, thought Harry,"        
## [4541] "but he had another reason for not wanting Snape near him while he was"        
## [4542] "playing Quidditch....　　The rest of the team hung back to talk to one"       
## [4543] "another as usual at the end of practice, but Harry headed straight back"      
## [4544] "to the Gryffindor common room, where he found Ron and Hermione playing"       
## [4545] "chess. Chess was the only thing Hermione ever lost at, something Harry"       
## [4546] "and Ron thought was very good for her.　　\"Don't talk to me for a"           
## [4547] "moment,\" said Ron when Harry sat down next to him, \"I need to concen"       
## [4548] "--\" He caught sight of Harry's face. \"What's the matter with you? You"      
## [4549] "look terrible.\"　　Speaking quietly so that no one else would hear,"         
## [4550] "Harry told the other two about Snape's sudden, sinister desire to be a"       
## [4551] "Quidditch referee.　　\"Don't play,\" said Hermione at once.　　\"Say"        
## [4552] "you're ill,\" said Ron.　　\"Pretend to break your leg,\" Hermione"           
## [4553] "suggested.　　\"Really break your leg,\" said Ron.　　\"I can't,\" said"      
## [4554] "Harry. \"There isn't a reserve Seeker. If I back out, Gryffindor can't"       
## [4555] "play at all.\"　　At that moment Neville toppled into the common room."       
## [4556] "How he had managed to climb through the portrait hole was anyone's"           
## [4557] "guess, because his legs had been stuck together with what they"               
## [4558] "recognized at once as the Leg-Locker Curse. He must have had to bunny"        
## [4559] "hop all the way up to Gryffindor tower.　　Everyone fell over laughing"       
## [4560] "except Hermione, who leapt up and performed the countercurse. Neville's"      
## [4561] "legs sprang apart and he got to his feet, trembling. \"What happened?\""      
## [4562] "Hermione asked him, leading him over to sit with Harry and"                   
## [4563] "Ron.　　\"Malfoy,\" said Neville shakily. \"I met him outside the library."   
## [4564] "He said he'd been looking for someone to practice that on.\"　　\"Go to"      
## [4565] "Professor McGonagall!\" Hermione urged Neville. \"Report him!\"　　Neville"   
## [4566] "shook his head.　　\"I don't want more trouble,\" he mumbled.　　\"You've"    
## [4567] "got to stand up to him, Neville!\" said Ron. \"He's used to walking all"      
## [4568] "over people, but that's no reason to lie down in front of him and make"       
## [4569] "it easier.\"　　\"There's no need to tell me I'm not brave enough to be"      
## [4570] "in Gryffindor, Malfoy's already done that,\" Neville choked"                  
## [4571] "out.　　Harry felt in the pocket of his robes and pulled out a"               
## [4572] "Chocolate Frog, the very last one from the box Hermione had given him"        
## [4573] "for Christmas. He gave it to Neville, who looked as though he might"          
## [4574] "cry.　　\"You're worth twelve of Malfoy,\" Harry said. \"The Sorting Hat"     
## [4575] "chose you for Gryffindor, didn't it? And where's Malfoy? In stinking"         
## [4576] "Slytherin.\"　　Neville's lips twitched in a weak smile as he unwrapped"      
## [4577] "the frog.　　\"Thanks, Harry... I think I'll go to bed.... D'you want"        
## [4578] "the card, you collect them, don't you?\"　　As Neville walked away,"          
## [4579] "Harry looked at the Famous Wizard card.　　\"Dumbledore again,\" he said,"    
## [4580] "\"He was the first one I ever-\"　　He gasped. He stared at the back of"      
## [4581] "the card. Then he looked up at Ron and Hermione.　　\"I've found him!\""      
## [4582] "he whispered. \"I've found Flamel! I told you I'd read the name"              
## [4583] "somewhere before, I read it on the train coming here -- listen to this:"      
## [4584] "'Dumbledore is particularly famous for his defeat of the dark wizard"         
## [4585] "Grindelwald in 1945, for the discovery of the twelve uses of dragon's"        
## [4586] "blood, and his work on alchemy with his partner, Nicolas"                     
## [4587] "Flamel'!\"　　Hermione jumped to her feet. She hadn't looked so excited"      
## [4588] "since they'd gotten back the marks for their very first piece of"             
## [4589] "homework.　　\"Stay there!\" she said, and she sprinted up the stairs to"     
## [4590] "the girls' dormitories. Harry and Ron barely had time to exchange"            
## [4591] "mystified looks before she was dashing back, an enormous old book in"         
## [4592] "her arms.　　\"I never thought to look in here!\" she whispered"              
## [4593] "excitedly. \"I got this out of the library weeks ago for a bit of light"      
## [4594] "reading.\"　　\"Light?\" said Ron, but Hermione told him to be quiet until"   
## [4595] "she'd looked something up, and started flicking frantically through the"      
## [4596] "pages, muttering to herself.　　At last she found what she was looking"       
## [4597] "for.　　\"I knew it! I knew it!\"　　\"Are we allowed to speak yet?\" said"   
## [4598] "Ron grumpily. Hermione ignored him.　　\"Nicolas Flamel,\" she whispered"     
## [4599] "dramatically, \"is the only known maker of the Sorcerer's"                    
## [4600] "Stone!\"　　This didn't have quite the effect she'd expected.　　\"The"       
## [4601] "what?\" said Harry and Ron.　　\"Oh, honestly, don't you two read? Look"      
## [4602] "-- read that, there.\"　　She pushed the book toward them, and Harry and"     
## [4603] "Ron read: The ancient study of alchemy is concerned with making the"          
## [4604] "Sorcerer's Stone, a legendary substance with astonishing powers. The"         
## [4605] "stone will transform any metal into pure gold. It also produces the"          
## [4606] "Elixir of Life, which will make the drinker immortal.　　There have"          
## [4607] "been many reports of the Sorcerer's Stone over the centuries, but the"        
## [4608] "only Stone currently in existence belongs to Mr. Nicolas Flamel, the"         
## [4609] "noted alchemist and opera lover. Mr. Flamel, who celebrated his six"          
## [4610] "hundred and sixty-fifth birthday last year, enjoys a quiet life in"           
## [4611] "Devon with his wife, Perenelle (six hundred and fifty-eight).　　\"See?\""    
## [4612] "said Hermione, when Harry and Ron had finished. \"The dog must be"            
## [4613] "guarding Flamel's Sorcerer's Stone! I bet he asked Dumbledore to keep"        
## [4614] "it safe for him, because they're friends and he knew someone was after"       
## [4615] "it, that's why he wanted the Stone moved out of Gringotts!\"　　\"A stone"    
## [4616] "that makes gold and stops you from ever dying!\" said Harry. \"No wonder"     
## [4617] "Snape's after it! Anyone would want it.\"　　\"And no wonder we couldn't"     
## [4618] "find Flamel in that Study of Recent Developments in Wizardry,\" said"         
## [4619] "Ron. \"He's not exactly recent if he's six hundred and sixty-five, is"        
## [4620] "he?\"　　The next morning in Defense Against the Dark Arts, while"            
## [4621] "copying down different ways of treating werewolf bites, Harry and Ron"        
## [4622] "were still discussing what they'd do with a Sorcerer's Stone if they"         
## [4623] "had one. It wasn't until Ron said he'd buy his own Quidditch team that"       
## [4624] "Harry remembered about Snape and the coming match.　　\"I'm going to"         
## [4625] "play,\" he told Ron and Hermione. \"If I don't, all the Slytherins will"      
## [4626] "think I'm just too scared to face Snape. I'll show them... it'll really"      
## [4627] "wipe the smiles off their faces if we win.\"　　\"Just as long as we're"      
## [4628] "not wiping you off the field,\" said Hermione.　　As the match drew"          
## [4629] "nearer, however, Harry became more and more nervous, whatever he told"        
## [4630] "Ron and Hermione. The rest of the team wasn't too calm, either. The"          
## [4631] "idea of overtaking Slytherin in the house championship was wonderful,"        
## [4632] "no one had done it for seven years, but would they be allowed to, with"       
## [4633] "such a biased referee?　　Harry didn't know whether he was imagining it"      
## [4634] "or not, but he seemed to keep running into Snape wherever he went. At"        
## [4635] "times, he even wondered whether Snape was following him, trying to"           
## [4636] "catch him on his own. Potions lessons were turning into a sort of"            
## [4637] "weekly torture, Snape was so horrible to Harry. Could Snape possibly"         
## [4638] "know they'd found out about the Sorcerer's Stone? Harry didn't see how"       
## [4639] "he could -- yet he sometimes had the horrible feeling that Snape could"       
## [4640] "read minds.　　Harry knew, when they wished him good luck outside the"        
## [4641] "locker rooms the next afternoon, that Ron and Hermione were wondering"        
## [4642] "whether they'd ever see him alive again. This wasn't what you'd call"         
## [4643] "comforting. Harry hardly heard a word of Wood's pep talk as he pulled"        
## [4644] "on his Quidditch robes and picked up his Nimbus Two Thousand.　　Ron"         
## [4645] "and Hermione, meanwhile, had found a place in the stands next to"             
## [4646] "Neville, who couldn't understand why they looked so grim and worried,"        
## [4647] "or why they had both brought their wands to the match. Little did Harry"      
## [4648] "know that Ron and Hermione had been secretly practicing the Leg-Locker"       
## [4649] "Curse. They'd gotten the idea from Malfoy using it on Neville, and were"      
## [4650] "ready to use it on Snape if he showed any sign of wanting to hurt"            
## [4651] "Harry.　　\"Now, don't forget, it's Locomotor Mortis,\" Hermione muttered"    
## [4652] "as Ron slipped his wand up his sleeve.　　\"I know,\" Ron snapped. \"Don't"   
## [4653] "nag.\"　　Back in the locker room, Wood had taken Harry aside.　　\"Don't"    
## [4654] "want to pressure you, Potter, but if we ever need an early capture of"        
## [4655] "the Snitch it's now. Finish the game before Snape can favor Hufflepuff"       
## [4656] "too much.\"　　\"The whole school's out there!\" said Fred Weasley,"          
## [4657] "peering out of the door. \"Even -- blimey -- Dumbledore's come to"            
## [4658] "watch!\"　　Harry's heart did a somersault.　　\"Dumbledore?\" he said,"      
## [4659] "dashing to the door to make sure. Fred was right. There was no"               
## [4660] "mistaking that silver beard.　　Harry could have laughed out loud with"       
## [4661] "relief He was safe. There was simply no way that Snape would dare to"         
## [4662] "try to hurt him if Dumbledore was watching.　　Perhaps that was why"          
## [4663] "Snape was looking so angry as the teams marched onto the field,"              
## [4664] "something that Ron noticed, too.　　\"I've never seen Snape look so"          
## [4665] "mean,\" he told Hermione. \"Look -they're off Ouch!\"　　Someone had poked"   
## [4666] "Ron in the back of the head. It was Malfoy.　　\"Oh, sorry, Weasley,"         
## [4667] "didn't see you there.\"　　Malfoy grinned broadly at Crabbe and"              
## [4668] "Goyle.　　\"Wonder how long Potter's going to stay on his broom this"         
## [4669] "time? Anyone want a bet? What about you, Weasley?\"　　Ron didn't"            
## [4670] "answer; Snape had just awarded Hufflepuff a penalty because George"           
## [4671] "Weasley had hit a Bludger at him. Hermione, who had all her fingers"          
## [4672] "crossed in her lap, was squinting fixedly at Harry, who was circling"         
## [4673] "the game like a hawk, looking for the Snitch.　　\"You know how I think"      
## [4674] "they choose people for the Gryffindor team?\" said Malfoy loudly a few"       
## [4675] "minutes later, as Snape awarded Hufflepuff another penalty for no"            
## [4676] "reason at all. \"It's people they feel sorry for. See, there's Potter,"       
## [4677] "who's got no parents, then there's the Weasleys, who've got no money --"      
## [4678] "you should be on the team, Longbottom, you've got no"                         
## [4679] "brains.\"　　Neville went bright red but turned in his seat to face"          
## [4680] "Malfoy.　　\"I'm worth twelve of you, Malfoy,\" he stammered.　　Malfoy,"     
## [4681] "Crabbe, and Goyle howled with laughter, but Ron, still not daring to"         
## [4682] "take his eyes from the game, said, \"You tell him,"                           
## [4683] "Neville.\"　　\"Longbottom, if brains were gold you'd be poorer than"         
## [4684] "Weasley, and that's saying something.\"　　Ron's nerves were already"         
## [4685] "stretched to the breaking point with anxiety about Harry.　　\"I'm"           
## [4686] "warning you, Malfoy -- one more word　　\"Ron!\" said Hermione suddenly,"     
## [4687] "\"Harry --\"　　\"What? Where?\"　　Harry had suddenly gone into a"           
## [4688] "spectacular dive, which drew gasps and cheers from the crowd. Hermione"       
## [4689] "stood up, her crossed fingers in her mouth, as Harry streaked toward"         
## [4690] "the ground like a bullet.　　\"You're in luck, Weasley, Potter's"             
## [4691] "obviously spotted some money on the ground!\" said Malfoy.　　Ron"            
## [4692] "snapped. Before Malfoy knew what was happening, Ron was on top of him,"       
## [4693] "wrestling him to the ground. Neville hesitated, then clambered over the"      
## [4694] "back of his seat to help.　　\"Come on, Harry!\" Hermione screamed,"          
## [4695] "leaping onto her seat to watch as Harry sped straight at Snape -- she"        
## [4696] "didn't even notice Malfoy and Ron rolling around under her seat, or the"      
## [4697] "scuffles and yelps coming from the whirl of fists that was Neville,"          
## [4698] "Crabbe, and Goyle.　　Up in the air, Snape turned on his broomstick"          
## [4699] "just in time to see something scarlet shoot past him, missing him by"         
## [4700] "inches -- the next second, Harry had pulled out of the dive, his arm"         
## [4701] "raised in triumph, the Snitch clasped in his hand.　　The stands"             
## [4702] "erupted; it had to be a record, no one could ever remember the Snitch"        
## [4703] "being caught so quickly.　　\"Ron! Ron! Where are you? The game's over!"      
## [4704] "Harry's won! We've won! Gryffindor is in the lead!\" shrieked Hermione,"      
## [4705] "dancing up and down on her seat and hugging Parvati Patil in the row in"      
## [4706] "front.　　Harry jumped off his broom, a foot from the ground. He"             
## [4707] "couldn't believe it. He'd done it -- the game was over; it had barely"        
## [4708] "lasted five minutes. As Gryffindors came spilling onto the field, he"         
## [4709] "saw Snape land nearby, white-faced and tight-lipped -- then Harry felt"       
## [4710] "a hand on his shoulder and looked up into Dumbledore's smiling"               
## [4711] "face.　　\"Well done,\" said Dumbledore quietly, so that only Harry could"    
## [4712] "hear. \"Nice to see you haven't been brooding about that mirror... been"      
## [4713] "keeping busy... excellent...\"　　Snape spat bitterly on the"                 
## [4714] "ground.　　Harry left the locker room alone some time later, to take"         
## [4715] "his Nimbus Two Thousand back to the broomshed. He couldn't ever"              
## [4716] "remember feeling happier. He'd really done something to be proud of now"      
## [4717] "-- no one could say he was just a famous name any more. The evening air"      
## [4718] "had never smelled so sweet. He walked over the damp grass, reliving the"      
## [4719] "last hour in his head, which was a happy blur: Gryffindors running to"        
## [4720] "lift him onto their shoulders; Ron and Hermione in the distance,"             
## [4721] "jumping up and down, Ron cheering through a heavy nosebleed.　　Harry"        
## [4722] "had reached the shed. He leaned against the wooden door and looked up"        
## [4723] "at Hogwarts, with its windows glowing red in the setting sun."                
## [4724] "Gryffindor in the lead. He'd done it, he'd shown Snape....　　And"            
## [4725] "speaking of Snape...　　A hooded figure came swiftly down the front"          
## [4726] "steps of the castle. Clearly not wanting to be seen, it walked as fast"       
## [4727] "as possible toward the forbidden forest. Harry's victory faded from his"      
## [4728] "mind as he watched. He recognized the figure's prowling walk. Snape,"         
## [4729] "sneaking into the forest while everyone else was at dinner -- what was"       
## [4730] "going on?　　Harry jumped back on his Nimbus Two Thousand and took off."      
## [4731] "Gliding silently over the castle he saw Snape enter the forest at a"          
## [4732] "run. He followed.　　The trees were so thick he couldn't see where"           
## [4733] "Snape had gone. He flew in circles, lower and lower, brushing the top"        
## [4734] "branches of trees until he heard voices. He glided toward them and"           
## [4735] "landed noiselessly in a towering beech tree.　　He climbed carefully"         
## [4736] "along one of the branches, holding tight to his broomstick, trying to"        
## [4737] "see through the leaves. Below, in a shadowy clearing, stood Snape, but"       
## [4738] "he wasn't alone. Quirrell was there, too. Harry couldn't make out the"        
## [4739] "look on his face, but he was stuttering worse than ever. Harry strained"      
## [4740] "to catch what they were saying.　　\"... d-don't know why you wanted"         
## [4741] "t-t-to meet here of all p-places, Severus...\"　　\"Oh, I thought we'd"       
## [4742] "keep this private,\" said Snape, his voice icy. \"Students aren't"            
## [4743] "supposed to know about the Sorcerer's Stone, after all.\"　　Harry"           
## [4744] "leaned forward. Quirrell was mumbling something. Snape interrupted"           
## [4745] "him.　　\"Have you found out how to get past that beast of Hagrid's"          
## [4746] "yet?\"　　\"B-b-but Severus, I --\"　　\"You don't want me as your enemy,"    
## [4747] "Quirrell,\" said Snape, taking a step toward him.　　\"I-I don't know"        
## [4748] "what you　　\"You know perfectly well what I mean.\"　　An owl hooted"        
## [4749] "loudly, and Harry nearly fell out of the tree. He steadied himself in"        
## [4750] "time to hear Snape say, \"-- your little bit of hocus-pocus. I'm"             
## [4751] "waiting.\"　　\"B-but I d-d-don't --\"　　\"Very well,\" Snape cut in."       
## [4752] "\"We'll have another little chat soon, when you've had time to think"         
## [4753] "things over and decided where your loyalties lie.\"　　He threw his"          
## [4754] "cloak over his head and strode out of the clearing. It was almost dark"       
## [4755] "now, but Harry could see Quirrell, standing quite still as though he"         
## [4756] "was petrified.　　\"Harry, where have you been?\" Hermione"                   
## [4757] "squeaked.　　\"We won! You won! We won!\" shouted Ron, thumping Harry on"     
## [4758] "the back. \"And I gave Malfoy a black eye, and Neville tried to take on"      
## [4759] "Crabbe and Goyle single-handed! He's still out cold but Madam Pomftey"        
## [4760] "says he'll be all right - talk about showing Slytherin! Everyone's"           
## [4761] "waiting for you in the common room, we're having a party, Fred and"           
## [4762] "George stole some cakes and stuff from the kitchens.\"　　\"Never mind"       
## [4763] "that now,\" said Harry breathlessly. \"Let's find an empty room, you wait"    
## [4764] "'til you hear this....\"　　He made sure Peeves wasn't inside before"         
## [4765] "shutting the door behind them, then he told them what he'd seen and"          
## [4766] "heard.　　\"So we were right, it is the Sorcerer's Stone, and Snape's"        
## [4767] "trying to force Quirrell to help him get it. He asked if he knew how to"      
## [4768] "get past Fluffy - and he said something about Quirrell's 'hocus"              
## [4769] "pocuss-- I reckon there are other things guarding the stone apart from"       
## [4770] "Fluffy, loads of enchantments, probably, and Quirrell would have done"        
## [4771] "some anti-Dark Arts spell that Snape needs to break through --\"　　\"So"     
## [4772] "you mean the Stone's only safe as long as Quirrell stands up to Snape?\""     
## [4773] "said Hermione in alarm.　　\"It'll be gone by next Tuesday,\" said"           
## [4774] "Ron.　　 NORBERT THE NORWEGIAN RIDGEBACK　　Quirrell, however, must"          
## [4775] "have been braver than they'd thought. In the weeks that followed he did"      
## [4776] "seem to be getting paler and thinner, but it didn't look as though he'd"      
## [4777] "cracked yet.　　Every time they passed the third-floor corridor, Harry,"      
## [4778] "Ron, and Hermione would press their ears to the door to check that"           
## [4779] "Fluffy was still growling inside. Snape was sweeping about in his usual"      
## [4780] "bad temper, which surely meant that the Stone was still safe. Whenever"       
## [4781] "Harry passed Quirrell these days he gave him an encouraging sort of"          
## [4782] "smile, and Ron had started telling people off for laughing at"                
## [4783] "Quirrell's stutter.　　Hermione, however, had more on her mind than the"      
## [4784] "Sorcerer's Stone. She had started drawing up study schedules and"             
## [4785] "colorcoding all her notes. Harry and Ron wouldn't have minded, but she"       
## [4786] "kept nagging them to do the same.　　\"Hermione, the exams are ages"          
## [4787] "away.\"　　\"Ten weeks,\" Hermione snapped. \"That's not ages, that's like"   
## [4788] "a second to Nicolas Flamel.\"　　\"But we're not six hundred years old,\""    
## [4789] "Ron reminded her. \"Anyway, what are you studying for, you already know"      
## [4790] "it A.\"　　\"What am I studying for? Are you crazy? You realize we need"      
## [4791] "to pass these exams to get into the second year? They're very"                
## [4792] "important, I should have started studying a month ago, I don't know"          
## [4793] "what's gotten into me....\"　　Unfortunately, the teachers seemed to be"      
## [4794] "thinking along the same lines as Hermione. They piled so much homework"       
## [4795] "on them that the Easter holidays weren't nearly as much fun as the"           
## [4796] "Christmas ones. It was hard to relax with Hermione next to you reciting"      
## [4797] "the twelve uses of dragon's blood or practicing wand movements. Moaning"      
## [4798] "and yawning, Harry and Ron spent most of their free time in the library"      
## [4799] "with her, trying to get through all their extra work.　　\"I'll never"        
## [4800] "remember this,\" Ron burst out one afternoon, throwing down his quill"        
## [4801] "and looking longingly out of the library window. It was the first"            
## [4802] "really fine day they'd had in months. The sky was a clear,"                   
## [4803] "forget-me-not blue, and there was a feeling in the air of summer"             
## [4804] "coming.　　Harry, who was looking up \"Dittany\" in One Thousand Magical"     
## [4805] "Herbs and Fungi, didn't look up until he heard Ron say, \"Hagrid! What"       
## [4806] "are you doing in the library?\"　　Hagrid shuffled into view, hiding"         
## [4807] "something behind his back. He looked very out of place in his moleskin"       
## [4808] "overcoat.　　\"Jus' lookin',\" he said, in a shifty voice that got their"     
## [4809] "interest at once. \"An' what're you lot up ter?\" He looked suddenly"         
## [4810] "suspicious. \"Yer not still lookin' fer Nicolas Flamel, are yeh?\" \"Oh,"     
## [4811] "we found out who he is ages ago,\" said Ron impressively. \"And we know"      
## [4812] "what that dog's guarding, it's a Sorcerer's St --\"　　\"Shhhh!\" Hagrid"     
## [4813] "looked around quickly to see if anyone was listening. \"Don' go shoutin'"     
## [4814] "about it, what's the matter with yeh?\"　　\"There are a few things we"       
## [4815] "wanted to ask you, as a matter of fact,\" said Harry, \"about what's"         
## [4816] "guarding the Stone apart from Fluffy --\"　　\"SHHHH!\" said Hagrid again."   
## [4817] "\"Listen - come an' see me later, I'm not promisin' I'll tell yeh"            
## [4818] "anythin', mind, but don' go rabbitin' about it in here, students aren'"       
## [4819] "s'pposed ter know. They'll think I've told yeh --\"　　\"See you later,"      
## [4820] "then,\" said Harry.　　Hagrid shuffled off.　　\"What was he hiding"          
## [4821] "behind his back?\" said Hermione thoughtfully.　　\"Do you think it had"      
## [4822] "anything to do with the Stone?\"　　\"I'm going to see what section he"       
## [4823] "was in,\" said Ron, who'd had enough of working. He came back a minute"       
## [4824] "later with a pile of books in his arms and slammed them down on the"          
## [4825] "table.　　\"Dragons!\" he whispered. \"Hagrid was looking up stuff about"     
## [4826] "dragons! Look at these: Dragon Species of Great Britain and Ireland;"         
## [4827] "From Egg to Inferno, A Dragon Keeper's Guide.\"　　\"Hagrid's always"         
## [4828] "wanted a dragon, he told me so the first time I ever met him, \" said"        
## [4829] "Harry.　　\"But it's against our laws,\" said Ron. \"Dragon breeding was"     
## [4830] "outlawed by the Warlocks' Convention of 1709, everyone knows that. It's"      
## [4831] "hard to stop Muggles from noticing us if we're keeping dragons in the"        
## [4832] "back garden - anyway, you can't tame dragons, it's dangerous. You"            
## [4833] "should see the burns Charlie's got off wild ones in Romania.\"　　\"But"      
## [4834] "there aren't wild dragons in Britain?\" said Harry.　　\"Of course there"     
## [4835] "are,\" said Ron. \"Common Welsh Green and Hebridean Blacks. The Ministry"     
## [4836] "of Magic has a job hushing them up, I can tell you. Our kind have to"         
## [4837] "keep putting spells on Muggles who've spotted them, to make them"             
## [4838] "forget.\"　　\"So what on earths Hagrid up to?\" said Hermione.　　When"      
## [4839] "they knocked on the door of the gamekeeper's hut an hour later, they"         
## [4840] "were surprised to see that all the curtains were closed. Hagrid called"       
## [4841] "\"Who is it?\" before he let them in, and then shut the door quickly"         
## [4842] "behind them.　　It was stifling hot inside. Even though it was such a"        
## [4843] "warm day, there was a blazing fire in the grate. Hagrid made them tea"        
## [4844] "and offered them stoat sandwiches, which they refused.　　\"So -- yeh"        
## [4845] "wanted to ask me somethin'?\"　　\"Yes,\" said Harry. There was no point"     
## [4846] "beating around the bush. \"We were wondering if you could tell us what's"     
## [4847] "guarding the Sorcerer's Stone apart from Fluffy.\"　　Hagrid frowned at"      
## [4848] "him.　　\"0' course I cant, he said. \"Number one, I don' know meself."       
## [4849] "Number two, yeh know too much already, so I wouldn' tell yeh if I"            
## [4850] "could. That Stone's here fer a good reason. It Was almost stolen outta"       
## [4851] "Gringotts - I s'ppose yeh've worked that out an' all? Beats me how yeh"       
## [4852] "even know abou' Fluffy.\"　　\"Oh, come on, Hagrid, you might not want to"    
## [4853] "tell us, but you do know, you know everything that goes on round here,\""     
## [4854] "said Hermione in a warm, flattering voice. Hagrid's beard twitched and"       
## [4855] "they could tell he was smiling. \"We only wondered who had done the"          
## [4856] "guarding, really.\" Hermione went on. \"We wondered who Dumbledore had"       
## [4857] "trusted enough to help him, apart from you.\"　　Hagrid's chest swelled"      
## [4858] "at these last words. Harry and Ron beamed at Hermione.　　\"Well, I don'"     
## [4859] "s'pose it could hurt ter tell yeh that... let's see... he borrowed"           
## [4860] "Fluffy from me... then some o' the teachers did enchantments..."              
## [4861] "Professor Sprout -- Professor Flitwick -- Professor McGonagall --\" he"       
## [4862] "ticked them off on his fingers, \"Professor Quirrell -- an' Dumbledore"       
## [4863] "himself did somethin', o' course. Hang on, I've forgotten someone. Oh"        
## [4864] "yeah, Professor Snape.\"　　\"Snape?\"　　\"Yeah -- yer not still on abou'"   
## [4865] "that, are yeh? Look, Snape helped protect the Stone, he's not about ter"      
## [4866] "steal it.\"　　Harry knew Ron and Hermione were thinking the same as he"      
## [4867] "was. If Snape had been in on protecting the Stone, it must have been"         
## [4868] "easy to find out how the other teachers had guarded it. He probably"          
## [4869] "knew everything -- except, it seemed, Quirrell's spell and how to get"        
## [4870] "past Fluffy.　　\"You're the only one who knows how to get past Fluffy."      
## [4871] "aren't you, Hagrid?\" said Harry anxiously. \"And you wouldn't tell"          
## [4872] "anyone, would you? Not even one of the teachers?\"　　\"Not a soul knows"     
## [4873] "except me an' Dumbledore,\" said Hagrid proudly.　　\"Well, that's"           
## [4874] "something,\" Harry muttered to the others. \"Hagrid, can we have a window"    
## [4875] "open? I'm boiling.\"　　\"Can't, Harry, sorry,\" said Hagrid. Harry"          
## [4876] "noticed him glance at the fire. Harry looked at it, too.　　\"Hagrid --"      
## [4877] "what's that?\"　　But he already knew what it was. In the very heart of"      
## [4878] "the fire, underneath the kettle, was a huge, black egg.　　\"Ah,\" said"      
## [4879] "Hagrid, fiddling nervously with his beard, \"That's er...\"　　\"Where did"   
## [4880] "you get it, Hagrid?\" said Ron, crouching over the fire to get a closer"      
## [4881] "look at the egg. \"It must've cost you a fortune.\"　　\"Won it,\" said"      
## [4882] "Hagrid. \"Las' night. I was down in the village havin' a few drinks an'"      
## [4883] "got into a game o' cards with a stranger. Think he was quite glad ter"        
## [4884] "get rid of it, ter be honest.\"　　\"But what are you going to do with it"    
## [4885] "when it's hatched?\" said Hermione.　　\"Well, I've bin doin' some"           
## [4886] "readin' , said Hagrid, pulling a large book from under his pillow. \"Got"     
## [4887] "this outta the library -- Dragon Breeding for Pleasure and Profit --"         
## [4888] "it's a bit outta date, o' course, but it's all in here. Keep the egg in"      
## [4889] "the fire, 'cause their mothers breathe on I em, see, an' when it"             
## [4890] "hatches, feed it on a bucket o' brandy mixed with chicken blood every"        
## [4891] "half hour. An' see here -- how ter recognize diff'rent eggs -- what I"        
## [4892] "got there's a Norwegian Ridgeback. They're rare, them.\"　　He looked"        
## [4893] "very pleased with himself, but Hermione didn't.　　\"Hagrid, you live in"     
## [4894] "a wooden house,\" she said.　　But Hagrid wasn't listening. He was"           
## [4895] "humming merrily as he stoked the fire.　　So now they had something"          
## [4896] "else to worry about: what might happen to Hagrid if anyone found out he"      
## [4897] "was hiding an illegal dragon in his hut. \"Wonder what it's like to have"     
## [4898] "a peaceful life,\" Ron sighed, as evening after evening they struggled"       
## [4899] "through all the extra homework they were getting. Hermione had now"           
## [4900] "started making study schedules for Harry and Ron, too. It was driving"        
## [4901] "them nuts.　　Then, one breakfast time, Hedwig brought Harry another"         
## [4902] "note from Hagrid. He had written only two words: It's hatching.　　Ron"       
## [4903] "wanted to skip Herbology and go straight down to the hut. Hermione"           
## [4904] "wouldn't hear of it.　　\"Hermione, how many times in our lives are we"       
## [4905] "going to see a dragon hatching?\"　　\"We've got lessons, we'll get into"     
## [4906] "trouble, and that's nothing to what Hagrid's going to be in when"             
## [4907] "someone finds out what he's doing --\"　　\"Shut up!\" Harry"                 
## [4908] "whispered.　　Malfoy was only a few feet away and he had stopped dead"        
## [4909] "to listen. How much had he heard? Harry didn't like the look on"              
## [4910] "Malfoy's face at all.　　Ron and Hermione argued all the way to"              
## [4911] "Herbology and in the end, Hermione agreed to run down to Hagrid's with"       
## [4912] "the other two during morning break. When the bell sounded from the"           
## [4913] "castle at the end of their lesson, the three of them dropped their"           
## [4914] "trowels at once and hurried through the grounds to the edge of the"           
## [4915] "forest. Hagrid greeted them, looking flushed and excited.　　\"It's"          
## [4916] "nearly out.\" He ushered them inside.　　The egg was lying on the table."     
## [4917] "There were deep cracks in it. Something was moving inside; a funny"           
## [4918] "clicking noise was coming from it.　　They all drew their chairs up to"       
## [4919] "the table and watched with bated breath.　　All at once there was a"          
## [4920] "scraping noise and the egg split open. The baby dragon flopped onto the"      
## [4921] "table. It wasn't exactly pretty; Harry thought it looked like a"              
## [4922] "crumpled, black umbrella. Its spiny wings were huge compared to its"          
## [4923] "skinny jet body, it had a long snout with wide nostrils, the stubs of"        
## [4924] "horns and bulging, orange eyes.　　It sneezed. A couple of sparks flew"       
## [4925] "out of its snout.　　\"Isn't he beautiful?\" Hagrid murmured. He reached"     
## [4926] "out a hand to stroke the dragon's head. It snapped at his fingers,"           
## [4927] "showing pointed fangs.　　\"Bless him, look, he knows his mommy!\" said"      
## [4928] "Hagrid.　　\"Hagrid,\" said Hermione, \"how fast do Norwegian Ridgebacks"     
## [4929] "grow, exactly?\"　　Hagrid was about to answer when the color suddenly"       
## [4930] "drained from his face -- he leapt to his feet and ran to the"                 
## [4931] "window.　　\"What's the matter?\"　　\"Someone was lookin' through the gap"   
## [4932] "in the curtains -- it's a kid -- he's runnin' back up ter the"                
## [4933] "school.\"　　Harry bolted to the door and looked out. Even at a distance"     
## [4934] "there was no mistaking him.　　Malfoy had seen the dragon.　　Something"      
## [4935] "about the smile lurking on Malfoy's face during the next week made"           
## [4936] "Harry, Ron, and Hermione very nervous. They spent most of their free"         
## [4937] "time in Hagrid's darkened hut, trying to reason with him.　　\"Just let"      
## [4938] "him go,\" Harry urged. \"Set him free.\"　　\"I can't,\" said Hagrid. \"He's" 
## [4939] "too little. He'd die.\"　　They looked at the dragon. It had grown three"     
## [4940] "times in length in just a week. Smoke kept furling out of its nostrils."      
## [4941] "Hagrid hadn't been doing his gamekeeping duties because the dragon was"       
## [4942] "keeping him so busy. There were empty brandy bottles and chicken"             
## [4943] "feathers all over the floor.　　\"I've decided to call him Norbert,\""        
## [4944] "said Hagrid, looking at the dragon with misty eyes. \"He really knows me"     
## [4945] "now, watch. Norbert! Norbert! Where's Mommy?\"　　\"He's lost his"            
## [4946] "marbles,\" Ron muttered in Harry's ear.　　\"Hagrid,\" said Harry loudly,"    
## [4947] "\"give it two weeks and Norbert's going to be as long as your house."         
## [4948] "Malfoy could go to Dumbledore at any moment.\"　　 Hagrid bit his"            
## [4949] "lip.　　\"I -- I know I can't keep him forever, but I can't jus' dump"        
## [4950] "him, I can't.\"　　Harry suddenly turned to Ron. Charlie, he"                 
## [4951] "said.　　\"You're losing it, too,\" said Ron. \"I'm Ron, remember?\"　　\"No" 
## [4952] "-- Charlie -- your brother, Charlie. In Romania. Studying dragons. We"        
## [4953] "could send Norbert to him. Charlie can take care of him and then put"         
## [4954] "him back in the wild!\"　　\"Brilliant!\" said Ron. \"How about it,"          
## [4955] "Hagrid?\"　　And in the end, Hagrid agreed that they could send -an owl"      
## [4956] "to Charlie to ask him.　　The following week dragged by. Wednesday"           
## [4957] "night found Hermione and Harry sitting alone in the common room, long"        
## [4958] "after everyone else had gone to bed. The clock on the wall had"               
## [4959] "just　　chimed midnight when the portrait hole burst open. Ron appeared"      
## [4960] "out of nowhere as he pulled off Harry's invisibility cloak. He had been"      
## [4961] "down at Hagrid's hut, helping him feed Norbert, who was now eating dead"      
## [4962] "rats by the crate.　　\"It bit me!\" he said, showing them his hand,"         
## [4963] "which was wrapped in a bloody handkerchief. \"I'm not going to be able"       
## [4964] "to hold a quill for a week. I tell you, that dragon's the most horrible"      
## [4965] "animal I've ever met, but the way Hagrid goes on about it, you'd think"       
## [4966] "it was a fluffy little bunny rabbit. When it bit me he told me off for"       
## [4967] "frightening it. And when I left, he was singing it a lullaby.\"　　There"     
## [4968] "was a tap on the dark window.　　\"It's Hedwig!\" said Harry, hurrying to"    
## [4969] "let her in. \"She'll have Charlie's answer!\"　　The three of them put"       
## [4970] "their heads together to read the note.　　Dear Ron,　　How are you?"          
## [4971] "Thanks for the letter -- I'd be glad to take the Norwegian Ridgeback,"        
## [4972] "but it won't be easy getting him here. I think the best thing will be"        
## [4973] "to send him over with some friends of mine who are coming to visit me"        
## [4974] "next week. Trouble is, they mustn't be seen carrying an illegal"              
## [4975] "dragon.　　Could you get the Ridgeback up the tallest tower at midnight"      
## [4976] "on Saturday? They can meet you there and take him away while it's still"      
## [4977] "dark.　　Send me an answer as soon as"                                        
## [4978] "possible.　　Love,　　Charlie　　They looked at one another.　　\"We've"      
## [4979] "got the invisibility cloak,\" said Harry. \"It shouldn't be too difficult"    
## [4980] "-- I think the cloaks big enough to cover two of us and Norbert.\"　　It"     
## [4981] "was a mark of how bad the last week had been that the other two agreed"       
## [4982] "with him. Anything to get rid of Norbert -- and Malfoy.　　There was a"       
## [4983] "hitch. By the next morning, Ron's bitten hand had swollen to twice its"       
## [4984] "usual size. He didn't know whether it was safe to go to Madam Pomfrey"        
## [4985] "-- would she recognize a dragon bite? By the afternoon, though, he had"       
## [4986] "no choice. The cut had turned a nasty shade of green. It looked as if"        
## [4987] "Norbert's fangs were poisonous.　　Harry and Hermione rushed up to the"       
## [4988] "hospital wing at the end of the day to find Ron in a terrible state in"       
## [4989] "bed.　　\"It's not just my hand,\" he whispered, \"although that feels"       
## [4990] "like it's about to fall off. Malfoy told Madam Pomfrey he wanted to"          
## [4991] "borrow one of my books so he could come and have a good laugh at me. He"      
## [4992] "kept threatening to tell her what really bit me -- I've told her it was"      
## [4993] "a dog, but I don't think she believes me -I shouldn't have hit him at"        
## [4994] "the Quidditch match, that's why he's doing this.\"　　Harry and Hermione"     
## [4995] "tried to calm Ron down.　　\"It'll all be over at midnight on Saturday,\""    
## [4996] "said Hermione, but this didn't soothe Ron at all. On the contrary, he"        
## [4997] "sat bolt upright and broke into a sweat.　　\"Midnight on Saturday!\" he"     
## [4998] "said in a hoarse voice. \"Oh no oh no -- I've just remembered --"             
## [4999] "Charlie's letter was in that book Malfoy took, he's going to know we're"      
## [5000] "getting rid of Norbert.\"　　Harry and Hermione didn't get a chance to"       
## [5001] "answer. Madam Pomfrey came over at that moment and made them leave,"          
## [5002] "saying Ron needed sleep.　　\"It's too late to change the plan now,\""        
## [5003] "Harry told Hermione. \"We haven't got time to send Charlie another owl,"      
## [5004] "and this could be our only chance to get rid of Norbert. We'll have to"       
## [5005] "risk it. And we have got the invisibility cloak, Malfoy doesn't know"         
## [5006] "about that.\"　　They found Fang, the boarhound, sitting outside with a"      
## [5007] "bandaged tail when they went to tell Hagrid, who opened a window to"          
## [5008] "talk to them.　　\"I won't let you in,\" he puffed. \"Norbert's at a"         
## [5009] "tricky stage -- nothin' I can't handle.\"　　When they told him about"        
## [5010] "Charlie's letter, his eyes filled with tears, although that might have"       
## [5011] "been because Norbert had just bitten him on the leg.　　\"Aargh! It's"        
## [5012] "all right, he only got my boot -- jus' playin' -- he's only a baby,"          
## [5013] "after all.\"　　The baby banged its tail on the wall, making the windows"     
## [5014] "rattle. Harry and Hermione walked back to the castle feeling Saturday"        
## [5015] "couldn't come quickly enough.　　They would have felt sorry for Hagrid"       
## [5016] "when the time came for him to say good-bye to Norbert if they hadn't"         
## [5017] "been so worried about what they had to do. It was a very dark, cloudy"        
## [5018] "night, and they were a bit late arriving at Hagrid's hut because they'd"      
## [5019] "had to wait for Peeves to get out of their way in the entrance hall,"         
## [5020] "where he'd been playing tennis against the wall. Hagrid had Norbert"          
## [5021] "packed and ready in a large crate.　　\"He's got lots o' rats an' some"       
## [5022] "brandy fer the journey,\" said Hagrid in a muffled voice. \"An' I've"         
## [5023] "packed his teddy bear in case he gets lonely.\"　　From inside the crate"     
## [5024] "came ripping noises that sounded to Harry as though the teddy was"            
## [5025] "having his head torn off.　　\"Bye-bye, Norbert!\" Hagrid sobbed, as"         
## [5026] "Harry and Hermione covered the crate with the invisibility cloak and"         
## [5027] "stepped underneath it themselves. \"Mommy will never forget you!\"　　How"    
## [5028] "they managed to get the crate back up to the castle, they never knew."        
## [5029] "Midnight ticked nearer as they heaved Norbert up the marble staircase"        
## [5030] "in the entrance hall and along the dark corridors. UP another"                
## [5031] "staircase, then another -- even one of Harry's shortcuts didn't make"         
## [5032] "the work much easier.　　\"Nearly there!\" Harry panted as they reached"      
## [5033] "the corridor beneath the tallest tower.　　Then a sudden movement ahead"      
## [5034] "of them made them almost drop the crate. Forgetting that they were"           
## [5035] "already invisible, they shrank into the shadows, staring at the dark"         
## [5036] "outlines of two people grappling with each other ten feet away. A lamp"       
## [5037] "flared.　　Professor McGonagall, in a tartan bathrobe and a hair net,"        
## [5038] "had Malfoy by the ear.　　\"Detention!\" she shouted. \"And twenty points"    
## [5039] "from Slytherin! Wandering around in the middle of the night, how dare"        
## [5040] "you --\"　　\"You don't understand, Professor. Harry Potter's coming --"      
## [5041] "he's got a dragon!\"　　\"What utter rubbish! How dare you tell such"         
## [5042] "lies! Come on -- I shall see Professor Snape about you, Malfoy!\"　　The"     
## [5043] "steep spiral staircase up to the top of the tower seemed the easiest"         
## [5044] "thing in the world after that. Not until they'd stepped out into the"         
## [5045] "cold night air did they throw off the cloak, glad to be able to breathe"      
## [5046] "properly again. Hermione did a sort of jig.　　\"Malfoy's got detention!"     
## [5047] "I could sing!\"　　\"Don't,\" Harry advised her.　　Chuckling about"          
## [5048] "Malfoy, they waited, Norbert thrashing about in his crate. About ten"         
## [5049] "minutes later, four broomsticks came swooping down out of the"                
## [5050] "darkness.　　Charlie's friends were a cheery lot. They showed Harry and"      
## [5051] "Hermione the harness they'd rigged up, so they could suspend Norbert"         
## [5052] "between them. They all helped buckle Norbert safely into it and then"         
## [5053] "Harry and Hermione shook hands with the others and thanked them very"         
## [5054] "much.　　At last, Norbert was going... going... gone.　　They slipped"        
## [5055] "back down the spiral staircase, their hearts as light as their hands,"        
## [5056] "now that Norbert was off them. No more dragon -- Malfoy in detention --"      
## [5057] "what could spoil their happiness?　　The answer to that was waiting at"       
## [5058] "the foot of the stairs. As they stepped into the corridor, Filch's face"      
## [5059] "loomed suddenly out of the darkness.　　\"Well, well, well,\" he"             
## [5060] "whispered, \"we are in trouble.\"　　They'd left the invisibility cloak"      
## [5061] "on top of the tower.　　 THE FORIBIDDEN FOREST　　Things couldn't have"       
## [5062] "been worse.　　Filch took them down to Professor McGonagall's study on"       
## [5063] "the first floor, where they sat and waited without saying a word to"          
## [5064] "each other. Hermione was trembling. Excuses, alibis, and wild cover- up"      
## [5065] "stories chased each other around Harry's brain, each more feeble than"        
## [5066] "the last. He couldn't see how they were going to get out of trouble"          
## [5067] "this time. They were cornered. How could they have been so stupid as to"      
## [5068] "forget the cloak? There was no reason on earth that Professor"                
## [5069] "McGonagall would accept for their being out of bed and creeping around"       
## [5070] "the school in the dead of night, let alone being up the tallest"              
## [5071] "astronomy tower, which was out-of-bounds except for classes. Add"             
## [5072] "Norbert and the invisibility cloak, and they might as well be packing"        
## [5073] "their bags already.　　Had Harry thought that things couldn't have been"      
## [5074] "worse? He was wrong. When Professor McGonagall appeared, she was"             
## [5075] "leading Neville.　　\"Harry!\" Neville burst Out, the moment he saw the"      
## [5076] "other two. \"I was trying to find you to warn you, I heard Malfoy saying"     
## [5077] "he was going to catch you, he said you had a drag --\"　　Harry shook"        
## [5078] "his head violently to shut Neville up, but Professor McGonagall had"          
## [5079] "seen. She looked more likely to breathe fire than Norbert as she"             
## [5080] "towered over the three of them.　　\"I would never have believed it of"       
## [5081] "any of you. Mr. Filch says you were up in the astronomy tower. It's one"      
## [5082] "o'clock in the morning. Explain yourselves.\"　　It was the first time"       
## [5083] "Hermione had ever failed to answer a teacher's question. She was"             
## [5084] "staring at her slippers, as still as a statue.　　\"I think I've got a"       
## [5085] "good idea of what's been going on,\" said Professor McGonagall. \"It"         
## [5086] "doesn't take a genius to work it out. You fed Draco Malfoy some"              
## [5087] "cock-and-bull story about a dragon, trying to get him out of bed and"         
## [5088] "into trouble. I've already caught him. I suppose you think it's funny"        
## [5089] "that Longbottom here heard the story and believed it, too?\"　　Harry"        
## [5090] "caught Neville's eye and tried to tell him without words that this"           
## [5091] "wasn't true, because Neville was looking stunned and hurt. Poor,"             
## [5092] "blundering Neville -- Harry knew what it must have cost him to try and"       
## [5093] "find them in the dark, to warn them.　　\"I'm disgusted,\" said Professor"    
## [5094] "McGonagall. \"Four students out of bed in one night! I've never heard of"     
## [5095] "such a thing before! You, Miss Granger, I thought you had more sense."        
## [5096] "As for you, Mr. Potter, I thought Gryffindor meant more to you than"          
## [5097] "this. All three of you will receive detentions -- yes, you too, Mr."          
## [5098] "Longbottom, nothing gives you the right to walk around school at night,"      
## [5099] "especially these days, it's very dangerous -- and fifty points will be"       
## [5100] "taken from Gryffindor.\"　　\"Fifty?\" Harry gasped -- they would lose the"   
## [5101] "lead, the lead he'd won in the last Quidditch match.　　\"Fifty points"       
## [5102] "each,\" said Professor McGonagall, breathing heavily through her long,"       
## [5103] "pointed nose.　　\"Professor -- please　　\"You can't --\"　　\"Don't tell"   
## [5104] "me what I can and can't do, Potter. Now get back to bed, all of you."         
## [5105] "I've never been more ashamed of Gryffindor students.\"　　A hundred and"      
## [5106] "fifty points lost. That put Gryffindor in last place. In one night,"          
## [5107] "they'd ruined any chance Gryffindor had had for the house cup. Harry"         
## [5108] "felt as though the bottom had dropped out of his stomach. How could"          
## [5109] "they ever make up for this?　　Harry didn't sleep all night. He could"        
## [5110] "hear Neville sobbing into his pillow for what seemed like hours. Harry"       
## [5111] "couldn't think of anything to say to comfort him. He knew Neville, like"      
## [5112] "himself, was dreading the dawn. What would happen when the rest of"           
## [5113] "Gryffindor found out what they'd done?　　At first, Gryffindors passing"      
## [5114] "the giant hourglasses that recorded the house points the next day"            
## [5115] "thought there'd been a mistake. How could they suddenly have a hundred"       
## [5116] "and fifty points fewer than yesterday? And then the story started to"         
## [5117] "spread: Harry Potter, the famous Harry Potter, their hero of two"             
## [5118] "Quidditch matches, had lo st them all those points, him and a couple of"      
## [5119] "other stupid first years.　　From being one of the most popular and"          
## [5120] "admired people at the school, Harry was suddenly the most hated. Even"        
## [5121] "Ravenclaws and Hufflepuffs turned on him, because everyone had been"          
## [5122] "longing to see Slytherin lose the house cup. Everywhere Harry went,"          
## [5123] "people pointed and didn't trouble to lower their voices as they"              
## [5124] "insulted him. Slytherins, on the other hand, clapped as he walked past"       
## [5125] "them, whistling and cheering, \"Thanks Potter, we owe you one!\"　　Only"     
## [5126] "Ron stood by him.　　\"They'll all forget this in a few weeks. Fred and"      
## [5127] "George have lost loads of points in all the time they've been here, and"      
## [5128] "people still like them.\"　　\"They've never lost a hundred and fifty"        
## [5129] "points in one go, though, have they?\" said Harry miserably.　　\"Well --"    
## [5130] "no,\" Ron admitted.　　It was a bit late to repair the damage, but Harry"     
## [5131] "swore to himself not to meddle in things that weren't his business from"      
## [5132] "now on. He'd had it with sneaking around and spying. He felt so ashamed"      
## [5133] "of himself that he went to Wood and offered to resign from the"               
## [5134] "Quidditch team.　　\"Resign?\" Wood thundered. \"What good'll that do? How"   
## [5135] "are we going to get any points back if we can't win at"                       
## [5136] "Quidditch?\"　　But even Quidditch had lost its fun. The rest of the"         
## [5137] "team wouldn't speak to Harry during practice, and if they had to speak"       
## [5138] "about him, they called him \"the Seeker.\"　　Hermione and Neville were"      
## [5139] "suffering, too. They didn't have as bad a time as Harry, because they"        
## [5140] "weren't as well-known, but nobody would speak to them, either. Hermione"      
## [5141] "had stopped drawing attention to herself in class, keeping her head"          
## [5142] "down and working in silence.　　Harry was almost glad that the exams"         
## [5143] "weren't far away. All the studying he had to do kept his mind off his"        
## [5144] "misery. He, Ron, and Hermione kept to themselves, working late into the"      
## [5145] "night, trying to remember the ingredients in complicated potions, learn"      
## [5146] "charms and spells by heart, memorize the dates of magical discoveries"        
## [5147] "and goblin rebellions....　　Then, about a week before the exams were"        
## [5148] "due to start, Harry's new resolution not to interfere in anything that"       
## [5149] "didn't concern him was put to an unexpected test. Walking back from the"      
## [5150] "library on his own one afternoon, he heard somebody whimpering from a"        
## [5151] "classroom up ahead. As he drew closer, he heard Quirrell's"                   
## [5152] "voice.　　\"No -- no -- not again, please --\"　　It sounded as though"       
## [5153] "someone was threatening him. Harry moved closer.　　\"All right -- all"       
## [5154] "right --\" he heard Quirrell sob.　　Next second, Quirrell came hurrying"     
## [5155] "out of the classroom straightening his turban. He was pale and looked"        
## [5156] "as though he was about to cry. He strode out of sight; Harry didn't"          
## [5157] "think Quirrell had even noticed him. He waited until Quirrell's"              
## [5158] "footsteps had disappeared, then peered into the classroom. It was"            
## [5159] "empty, but a door stood ajar at the other end. Harry was halfway toward"      
## [5160] "it before he remembered what he'd promised himself about not"                 
## [5161] "meddling.　　All the same, he'd have gambled twelve Sorcerer's Stones"        
## [5162] "that Snape had just left the room, and from what Harry had just heard,"       
## [5163] "Snape would be walking with a new spring in his step -- Quirrell seemed"      
## [5164] "to have given in at last.　　Harry went back to the library, where"           
## [5165] "Hermione was testing Ron on Astronomy. Harry told them what he'd"             
## [5166] "heard.　　\"Snape's done it, then!\" said Ron. \"If Quirrell's told him"      
## [5167] "how to break his Anti-Dark Force spell --\"　　\"There's still Fluffy,"       
## [5168] "though,\" said Hermione.　　\"Maybe Snape's found out how to get past him"    
## [5169] "without asking Hagrid,\" said Ron, looking up at the thousands of books"      
## [5170] "surrounding them. \"I bet there's a book somewhere in here telling you"       
## [5171] "how to get past a giant three-headed dog. So what do we do,"                  
## [5172] "Harry?\"　　The light of adventure was kindling again in Ron's eyes, but"     
## [5173] "Hermione answered before Harry could.　　\"Go to Dumbledore. That's what"     
## [5174] "we should have done ages ago. If we try anything ourselves we'll be"          
## [5175] "thrown out for sure.\"　　\"But we've got no proof!\" said Harry."            
## [5176] "\"Quirrell's too scared to back us up. Snape's only got to say he"            
## [5177] "doesn't know how the troll got in at Halloween and that he was nowhere"       
## [5178] "near the third floor -- who do you think they'll believe, him or us?"         
## [5179] "It's not exactly a secret we hate him, Dumbledore'll think we made it"        
## [5180] "up to get him sacked. Filch wouldn't help us if his life depended on"         
## [5181] "it, he's too friendly with Snape, and the more students get thrown out,"      
## [5182] "the better, he'll think. And don't forget, we're not supposed to know"        
## [5183] "about the Stone or Fluffy. That'll take a lot of"                             
## [5184] "explaining.\"　　Hermione looked convinced, but Ron didn't.　　\"If we"       
## [5185] "just do a bit of poking around --\"　　\"No,\" said Harry flatly, \"we've"    
## [5186] "done enough poking around.\"　　He pulled a map of Jupiter toward him"        
## [5187] "and started to learn the names of its moons.　　The following morning,"       
## [5188] "notes were delivered to Harry, Hermione, and Neville at the breakfast"        
## [5189] "table. They were all the same:　　Your detention will take place at"          
## [5190] "eleven o'clock tonight. Meet Mr. Filch in the entrance"                       
## [5191] "hall.　　Professor McGonagall Harry had forgotten they still had"             
## [5192] "detentions to do in the furor over the points they'd lost. He half"           
## [5193] "expected Hermione to complain that this was a whole night of studying"        
## [5194] "lost, but she didn't say a word. Like Harry, she felt they deserved"          
## [5195] "what they'd got.　　At eleven o'clock that night, they said good-bye to"      
## [5196] "Ron in the common room and went down to the entrance hall with Neville."      
## [5197] "Filch was already there -- and so was Malfoy. Harry had also forgotten"       
## [5198] "that Malfoy had gotten a detention, too.　　\"Follow me,\" said Filch,"       
## [5199] "lighting a lamp and leading them outside.　　I bet you'll think twice"        
## [5200] "about breaking a school rule again, won't you, eh?\" he said, leering at"     
## [5201] "them. \"Oh yes... hard work and pain are the best teachers if you ask"        
## [5202] "me.... It's just a pity they let the old punishments die out... hang"         
## [5203] "you by your wrists from the ceiling for a few days, I've got the chains"      
## [5204] "still in my office, keep 'em well oiled in case they're ever needed...."      
## [5205] "Right, off we go, and don't think of running off, now, it'll be worse"        
## [5206] "for you if you do.\"　　They marched off across the dark grounds."            
## [5207] "Neville kept sniffing. Harry wondered what their punishment was going"        
## [5208] "to be. It must be something really horrible, or Filch wouldn't be"            
## [5209] "sounding so delighted.　　The moon was bright, but clouds scudding"           
## [5210] "across it kept throwing them into darkness. Ahead, Harry could see the"       
## [5211] "lighted windows of Hagrid's hut. Then they heard a distant"                   
## [5212] "shout.　　\"Is that you, Filch? Hurry up, I want ter get"                     
## [5213] "started.\"　　Harry's heart rose; if they were going to be working with"      
## [5214] "Hagrid it wouldn't be so bad. His relief must have showed in his -face,"      
## [5215] "because Filch said, \"I suppose you think you'll be enjoying yourself"        
## [5216] "with that oaf? Well, think again, boy -- it's into the forest you're"         
## [5217] "going and I'm much mistaken if you'll all come out in one piece.\"　　At"     
## [5218] "this, Neville let out a little moan, and Malfoy stopped dead in his"          
## [5219] "tracks.　　\"The forest?\" he repeated, and he didn't sound quite as cool"    
## [5220] "as usual. \"We can't go in there at night -- there's all sorts of things"     
## [5221] "in there -- werewolves, I heard.\"　　Neville clutched the sleeve of"         
## [5222] "Harry's robe and made a choking noise.　　\"That's your problem, isn't"       
## [5223] "it?\" said Filch, his voice cracking with glee. \"Should've thought of"       
## [5224] "them werewolves before you got in trouble, shouldn't you?\"　　Hagrid"        
## [5225] "came striding toward them out of the dark, Fang at his heel. He was"          
## [5226] "carrying his large crossbow, and a quiver of arrows hung over his"            
## [5227] "shoulder.　　\"Abou' time,\" he said. \"I bin waitin' fer half an hour"       
## [5228] "already. All right, Harry, Hermione?\"　　\"I shouldn't be too friendly"      
## [5229] "to them, Hagrid,\" said Filch coldly, they're here to be punished, after"     
## [5230] "all.\"　　\"That's why yer late, is it?\" said Hagrid, frowning at Filch."    
## [5231] "\"Bin lecturin' them, eh? 'Snot your place ter do that. Yeh've done yer"      
## [5232] "bit, I'll take over from here.\"　　\"I'll be back at dawn,\" said Filch,"    
## [5233] "\"for what's left of them,\" he added nastily, and he turned and started"     
## [5234] "back toward the castle, his lamp bobbing away in the"                         
## [5235] "darkness.　　Malfoy now turned to Hagrid.　　\"I'm not going in that"         
## [5236] "forest, he said, and Harry was pleased to hear the note of panic in his"      
## [5237] "voice.　　\"Yeh are if yeh want ter stay at Hogwarts,\" said Hagrid"          
## [5238] "fiercely. \"Yeh've done wrong an' now yehve got ter pay fer it.\"　　\"But"   
## [5239] "this is servant stuff, it's not for students to do. I thought we'd be"        
## [5240] "copying lines or something, if my father knew I was doing this,"              
## [5241] "he'd　　tell yer that's how it is at Hogwarts,\" Hagrid growled."             
## [5242] "\"Copyin' lines! What good's that ter anyone? Yeh'll do summat useful or"     
## [5243] "Yeh'll get out. If yeh think yer father'd rather you were expelled,"          
## [5244] "then get back off ter the castle an' pack. Go on\"'　　Malfoy didn't"         
## [5245] "move. He looked at Hagrid furiously, but then dropped his"                    
## [5246] "gaze.　　\"Right then,\" said Hagrid, \"now, listen carefully, 'cause it's"   
## [5247] "dangerous what we're gonna do tonight, an' I don' want no one takin'"         
## [5248] "risks. Follow me over here a moment.\"　　He led them to the very edge"       
## [5249] "of the forest. Holding his lamp up high, he pointed down a narrow,"           
## [5250] "winding earth track that disappeared into the thick black trees. A"           
## [5251] "light breeze lifted their hair as they looked into the forest.　　\"Look"     
## [5252] "there,\" said Hagrid, \"see that stuff shinin' on the ground? Silvery"        
## [5253] "stuff? That's unicorn blood. There's a unicorn in there bin hurt badly"       
## [5254] "by summat. This is the second time in a week. I found one dead last"          
## [5255] "Wednesday. We're gonna try an' find the poor thing. We might have ter"        
## [5256] "put it out of its misery.\"　　\"And what if whatever hurt the unicorn"       
## [5257] "finds us first?\" said Malfoy, unable to keep the fear out of his"            
## [5258] "voice.　　\"There's nothin' that lives in the forest that'll hurt yeh if"     
## [5259] "yer with me or Fang,\" said Hagrid. \"An' keep ter the path. Right, now,"     
## [5260] "we're gonna split inter two parties an' follow the trail in diff'rent"        
## [5261] "directions. There's blood all over the place, it must've bin staggerin'"      
## [5262] "around since last night at least.\"　　\"I want Fang,\" said Malfoy"          
## [5263] "quickly, looking at Fang's long teeth.　　\"All right, but I warn yeh,"       
## [5264] "he's a coward,\" said Hagrid. \" So me, Harry, an' Hermione'll go one way"    
## [5265] "an' Draco, Neville, an' Fang'll go the other. Now, if any of us finds"        
## [5266] "the unicorn, we'll send up green sparks, right? Get yer wands out an'"        
## [5267] "practice now -- that's it -- an' if anyone gets in trouble, send up red"      
## [5268] "sparks, an' we'll all come an' find yeh -- so, be careful -- let's"           
## [5269] "go.\"　　The forest was black and silent. A little way into it they"          
## [5270] "reached a fork in the earth path, and Harry, Hermione, and Hagrid took"       
## [5271] "the left path while Malfoy, Neville, and Fang took the right.　　They"        
## [5272] "walked in silence, their eyes on the ground. Every now and then a ray"        
## [5273] "of moonlight through the branches above lit a spot of silver-blue blood"      
## [5274] "on the fallen leaves.　　Harry saw that Hagrid looked very"                   
## [5275] "worried.　　\"Could a werewolf be killing the unicorns?\" Harry"              
## [5276] "asked.　　\"Not fast enough,\" said Hagrid. \"It's not easy ter catch a"      
## [5277] "unicorn, they're powerful magic creatures. I never knew one ter be hurt"      
## [5278] "before.\"　　They walked past a mossy tree stump. Harry could hear"           
## [5279] "running water; there must be a stream somewhere close by. There were"         
## [5280] "still spots of unicorn blood here and there along the winding"                
## [5281] "path.　　\"You all right, Hermione?\" Hagrid whispered. \"Don' worry, it"     
## [5282] "can't've gone far if it's this badly hurt, an' then we'll be able ter"        
## [5283] "-- GET BEHIND THAT TREE!\"　　Hagrid seized Harry and Hermione and"           
## [5284] "hoisted them off the path behind a towering oak. He pulled out an arrow"      
## [5285] "and fitted it into his crossbow, raising it, ready to fire. The three"        
## [5286] "of them listened. Something was slithering over dead leaves nearby: it"       
## [5287] "sounded like a cloak trailing along the ground. Hagrid was squinting up"      
## [5288] "the dark path, but after a few seconds, the sound faded away.　　\"I"         
## [5289] "knew it, \" he murmured. \"There's summat in here that shouldn'"              
## [5290] "be.\"　　\"A werewolf?\" Harry suggested.　　\"That wasn' no werewolf an'"    
## [5291] "it wasn' no unicorn, neither,\" said Hagrid grimly. \"Right, follow me,"      
## [5292] "but careful, now.\"　　They walked more slowly, ears straining for the"       
## [5293] "faintest sound. Suddenly, in a clearing ahead, something definitely"          
## [5294] "moved.　　\"Who's there?\" Hagrid called. \"Show yerself -- I'm"              
## [5295] "armed!\"　　And into the clearing came -- was it a man, or a horse? To"       
## [5296] "the waist, a man, with red hair and beard, but below that was a horse's"      
## [5297] "gleaming chestnut body with a long, reddish tail. Harry and Hermione's"       
## [5298] "jaws dropped.　　\"Oh, it's you, Ronan,\" said Hagrid in relief. \"How are"   
## [5299] "yeh?\"　　He walked forward and shook the centaur's hand.　　\"Good"          
## [5300] "evening to you, Hagrid,\" said Ronan. He had a deep, sorrowful voice."        
## [5301] "\"Were you going to shoot me?\"　　\"Can't be too careful, Ronan,\" said"     
## [5302] "Hagrid, patting his crossbow. \"There's summat bad loose in this forest."     
## [5303] "This is Harry Potter an' Hermione Granger, by the way. Students up at"        
## [5304] "the school. An' this is Ronan, you two. He's a centaur.))　　\"We'd"          
## [5305] "noticed,\" said Hermione faintly.　　\"Good evening,\" said Ronan."           
## [5306] "\"Students, are you? And do you learn much, up at the school?\"　　\"Erm"     
## [5307] "--\"　　\"A bit,\" said Hermione timidly.　　\"A bit. Well, that's"           
## [5308] "something.\" Ronan sighed. He flung back his head and stared at the sky."     
## [5309] "\"Mars is bright tonight.\"　　\"Yeah,\" said Hagrid, glancing up, too."      
## [5310] "\"Listen, I'm glad we've run inter yeh, Ronan, 'cause there's a unicorn"      
## [5311] "bin hurt -- you seen anythin'?\"　　Ronan didn't answer immediately. He"      
## [5312] "stared unblinkingly upward, then sighed again.　　\"Always the innocent"
