## [5313] "are the first victims,\" he said. \"So it has been for ages past, so it"      
## [5314] "is now.\"　　\"Yeah,\" said Hagrid, \"but have yeh seen anythin', Ronan?"     
## [5315] "Anythin' unusual?\"　　\"Mars is bright tonight,\" Ronan repeated, while"     
## [5316] "Hagrid watched him impatiently. \"Unusually bright.\"　　\"Yeah, but I was"   
## [5317] "meanin' anythin' unusual a bit nearer home, said Hagrid. \"So yeh"            
## [5318] "haven't noticed anythin' strange?\"　　Yet again, Ronan took a while to"      
## [5319] "answer. At last, he said, \"The forest hides many secrets.\"　　A"            
## [5320] "movement in the trees behind Ronan made Hagrid raise his bow again, but"      
## [5321] "it was only a second centaur, black-haired and -bodied and"                   
## [5322] "wilder-looking than Ronan.　　\"Hullo, Bane,\" said Hagrid. \"All"            
## [5323] "right?\"　　\"Good evening, Hagrid, I hope you are well?\"　　\"Well"         
## [5324] "enough. Look, I've jus' bin askin' Ronan, you seen anythin' odd in here"      
## [5325] "lately? There's a unicorn bin injured -- would yeh know anythin' about"       
## [5326] "it?\"　　Bane walked over to stand next to Ronan. He looked skyward."         
## [5327] "\"Mars is bright tonight,\" he said simply.　　\"We've heard,\" said Hagrid"  
## [5328] "grumpily. \"Well, if either of you do see anythin', let me know, won't"       
## [5329] "yeh? We'll be off, then.\"　　Harry and Hermione followed him out of the"     
## [5330] "clearing, staring over their shoulders at Ronan and Bane until the"           
## [5331] "trees blocked their view.　　\"Never,\" said Hagrid irritably, \"try an'"     
## [5332] "get a straight answer out of a centaur. Ruddy stargazers. Not"                
## [5333] "interested in anythin' closer'n the moon.\"　　\"Are there many of them"      
## [5334] "in here?\" asked Hermione.　　\"Oh, a fair few... Keep themselves to"         
## [5335] "themselves mostly, but they're good enough about turnin' up if ever I"        
## [5336] "want a word. They're deep, mind, centaurs... they know things... jus'"        
## [5337] "don' let on much.\"　　\"D'you think that was a centaur we heard"             
## [5338] "earlier?\" said Harry.　　\"Did that sound like hooves to you? Nah, if"       
## [5339] "yeh ask me, that was what's bin killin' the unicorns -- never heard"          
## [5340] "anythin' like it before.\"　　They walked on through the dense, dark"         
## [5341] "trees. Harry kept looking nervously over his shoulder. He had the nasty"      
## [5342] "feeling they were being watched. He was very glad they had Hagrid and"        
## [5343] "his crossbow with them. They had just passed a bend in the path when"         
## [5344] "Hermione grabbed Hagrid's arm.　　\"Hagrid! Look! Red sparks, the others"     
## [5345] "are in trouble!\"　　\"You two wait here!\" Hagrid shouted. \"Stay on the"    
## [5346] "path, I'll come back for yeh!\"　　They heard him crashing away through"      
## [5347] "the undergrowth and stood looking at each other, very scared, until"          
## [5348] "they couldn't hear anything but the rustling of leaves around"                
## [5349] "them.　　\"You don't think they've been hurt, do you?\" whispered"            
## [5350] "Hermione.　　\"I don't care if Malfoy has, but if something's got"            
## [5351] "Neville... it's our fault he's here in the first place.\"　　The minutes"     
## [5352] "dragged by. Their ears seemed sharper than usual. Harry's seemed to be"       
## [5353] "picking up every sigh of the wind, every cracking twig. What was going"       
## [5354] "on? Where were the others?　　At last, a great crunching noise"               
## [5355] "announced Hagrid's return. Malfoy, Neville, and Fang were with him."          
## [5356] "Hagrid was fuming. Malfoy, it seemed, had sneaked up behind Neville and"      
## [5357] "grabbed him as a joke. Neville had panicked and sent up the"                  
## [5358] "sparks.　　\"We'll be lucky ter catch anythin' now, with the racket you"      
## [5359] "two were makin'. Right, we're changin' groups -- Neville, you stay with"      
## [5360] "me an' Hermione, Harry, you go with Fang an' this idiot. I'm sorry,\""        
## [5361] "Hagrid added in a whisper to Harry, \"but he'll have a harder time"           
## [5362] "frightenin' you, an' we've gotta get this done.\"　　So Harry set off"        
## [5363] "into the heart of the forest with Malfoy and Fang. They walked for"           
## [5364] "nearly half an hour, deeper and deeper into the forest, until the path"       
## [5365] "became almost impossible to follow because the trees were so thick."          
## [5366] "Harry thought the blood seemed to be getting thicker. There were"             
## [5367] "splashes on the roots of a tree, as though the poor creature had been"        
## [5368] "thrashing around in pain close by. Harry could see a clearing ahead,"         
## [5369] "through the tangled branches of an ancient oak.　　\"Look --\" he"            
## [5370] "murmured, holding out his arm to stop Malfoy.　　Something bright white"      
## [5371] "was gleaming on the ground. They inched closer.　　It was the unicorn"        
## [5372] "all right, and it was dead. Harry had never seen anything so beautiful"       
## [5373] "and sad. Its long, slender legs were stuck out at odd angles where it"        
## [5374] "had fallen and its mane was spread pearly-white on the dark"                  
## [5375] "leaves.　　Harry had taken one step toward it when a slithering sound"        
## [5376] "made him freeze where he stood. A bush on the edge of the clearing"           
## [5377] "quivered.... Then, out of the shadows, a hooded figure came crawling"         
## [5378] "across the ground like some stalking beast. Harry, Malfoy, and Fang"          
## [5379] "stood transfixed. The cloaked figure reached the unicorn, lowered its"        
## [5380] "head over the wound in the animal's side, and began to drink its"             
## [5381] "blood.　　\"AAAAAAAAAARGH!\"　　Malfoy let out a terrible scream and"         
## [5382] "bolted -- so did Fang. The hooded figure raised its head and looked"          
## [5383] "right at Harry -- unicorn blood was dribbling down its front. It got to"      
## [5384] "its feet and came swiftly toward Harry -- he couldn't move for"               
## [5385] "fear.　　Then a pain like he'd never felt before pierced his head; it"        
## [5386] "was as though his scar were on fire. Half blinded, he staggered"              
## [5387] "backward. He heard hooves behind him, galloping, and something jumped"        
## [5388] "clean over Harry, charging at the figure.　　The pain in Harry's head"        
## [5389] "was so bad he fell to his knees. It took a minute or two to pass. When"       
## [5390] "he looked up, the figure had gone. A centaur was standing over him, not"      
## [5391] "Ronan or Bane; this one looked younger; he had white-blond hair and a"        
## [5392] "palomino body.　　\"Are you all right?\" said the centaur, pulling Harry"     
## [5393] "to his feet.　　\"Yes -- thank you -- what was that?\"　　The centaur"        
## [5394] "didn't answer. He had astonishingly blue eyes, like pale sapphires. He"       
## [5395] "looked carefully at Harry, his eyes lingering on the scar that stood"         
## [5396] "out, livid, on Harry's forehead.　　\"You are the Potter boy,\" he said."     
## [5397] "\"You had better get back to Hagrid. The forest is not safe at this time"     
## [5398] "-- especially for you. Can you ride? It will be quicker this"                 
## [5399] "way.　　\"My name is Firenze,\" he added, as he lowered himself on to his"    
## [5400] "front legs so that Harry could clamber onto his back.　　There was"           
## [5401] "suddenly a sound of more galloping from the other side of the clearing."      
## [5402] "Ronan and Bane came bursting through the trees, their flanks heaving"         
## [5403] "and sweaty.　　\"Firenze!\" Bane thundered. \"What are you doing? You have"   
## [5404] "a human on your back! Have you no shame? Are you a common mule?\"　　\"Do"    
## [5405] "you realize who this is?\" said Firenze. \"This is the Potter boy. The"       
## [5406] "quicker he leaves this forest, the better.\"　　\"What have you been"         
## [5407] "telling him?\" growled Bane. \"Remember, Firenze, we are sworn not to set"    
## [5408] "ourselves against the heavens. Have we not read what is to come in the"       
## [5409] "movements of the planets?\"　　Ronan pawed the ground nervously. \"I'm"       
## [5410] "sure Firenze thought he was acting for the best, \" he said in his"           
## [5411] "gloomy voice.　　Bane kicked his back legs in anger.　　\"For the best!"      
## [5412] "What is that to do with us? Centaurs are concerned with what has been"        
## [5413] "foretold! It is not our business to run around like donkeys after stray"      
## [5414] "humans in our forest!\"　　Firenze suddenly reared on to his hind legs"       
## [5415] "in anger, so that Harry had to grab his shoulders to stay on.　　\"Do"        
## [5416] "you not see that unicorn?\" Firenze bellowed at Bane. \"Do you not"           
## [5417] "understand why it was killed? Or have the planets not let you in on"          
## [5418] "that secret? I set myself against what is lurking in this forest, Bane,"      
## [5419] "yes, with humans alongside me if I must.\"　　And Firenze whisked"            
## [5420] "around; with Harry clutching on as best he could, they plunged off into"      
## [5421] "the trees, leaving Ronan and Bane behind them.　　Harry didn't have a"        
## [5422] "clue what was going on.　　\"Why's Bane so angry?\" he asked. \"What was"     
## [5423] "that thing you saved me from, anyway?\"　　Firenze slowed to a walk,"         
## [5424] "warned Harry to keep his head bowed in case of low-hanging branches,"         
## [5425] "but did not answer Harry's question. They made their way through the"         
## [5426] "trees in silence for so long that Harry thought Firenze didn't want to"       
## [5427] "talk to him anymore. They were passing through a particularly dense"          
## [5428] "patch of trees, however, when Firenze suddenly stopped.　　\"Harry"           
## [5429] "Potter, do you know what unicorn blood is used -for?\"　　\"No,\" said"       
## [5430] "Harry, startled by the odd question. \"We've only used the horn and tail"     
## [5431] "hair in Potions.\"　　\"That is because it is a monstrous thing, to slay"     
## [5432] "a unicorn,\" said Firenze. \"Only one who has nothing to lose, and"           
## [5433] "everything to gain, would commit such a crime. The blood of a unicorn"        
## [5434] "will keep you alive, even if you are an inch from death, but at a"            
## [5435] "terrible price. You have slain something pure and defenseless to save"        
## [5436] "yourself, and you will have but a half-life, a cursed life, from the"         
## [5437] "moment the blood touches your lips.\"　　Harry stared at the back of"         
## [5438] "Firenze's head, which was dappled silver in the moonlight.　　\"But"          
## [5439] "who'd be that desperate?\" he wondered aloud. \"If you're going to be"        
## [5440] "cursed forever, deaths better, isn't it?\"　　\"It is,\" Firenze agreed,"     
## [5441] "\"unless all you need is to stay alive long enough to drink something"        
## [5442] "else -- something that will bring you back to full strength and power"        
## [5443] "-- something that will mean you can never die. Mr. Potter, do you know"       
## [5444] "what is hidden in the school at this very moment?\"　　\"The Sorcerer's"      
## [5445] "Stone! Of course -- the Elixir of Life! But I don't understand who"           
## [5446] "--\"　　\"Can you think of nobody who has waited many years to return to"     
## [5447] "power, who has clung to life, awaiting their chance?\"　　It was as"          
## [5448] "though an iron fist had clenched suddenly around Harry's heart. Over"         
## [5449] "the rustling of the trees, he seemed to hear once more what Hagrid had"       
## [5450] "told him on the night they had met: \"Some say he died. Codswallop, in"       
## [5451] "my opinion. Dunno if he had enough human left in him to die.\"　　\"Do"       
## [5452] "you mean,\" Harry croaked, \"that was Vol-\"　　\"Harry! Harry, are you all"  
## [5453] "right?\"　　Hermione was running toward them down the path, Hagrid"           
## [5454] "puffing along behind her.　　\"I'm fine,\" said Harry, hardly knowing"        
## [5455] "what he was saying. \"The unicorn's dead, Hagrid, it's in that clearing"      
## [5456] "back there.\"　　\"This is where I leave you,\" Firenze murmured as Hagrid"   
## [5457] "hurried off to examine the unicorn. \"You are safe now.\"　　Harry slid"      
## [5458] "off his back.　　\"Good luck, Harry Potter,\" said Firenze. \"The planets"    
## [5459] "have been read wrongly before now, even by centaurs. I hope this is one"      
## [5460] "of those times.\"　　He turned and cantered back into the depths of the"      
## [5461] "forest, leaving Harry shivering behind him.　　Ron had fallen asleep in"      
## [5462] "the dark common room, waiting for them to return. He shouted something"       
## [5463] "about Quidditch fouls when Harry roughly shook him awake. In a matter"        
## [5464] "of seconds, though, he was wide-eyed as Harry began to tell him and"          
## [5465] "Hermione what had happened in the forest.　　Harry couldn't sit down."        
## [5466] "He paced up and down in front of the fire. He was still"                      
## [5467] "shaking.　　\"Snape wants the stone for Voldemort... and Voldemort's"         
## [5468] "waiting in the forest... and all this time we thought Snape just wanted"      
## [5469] "to get rich....\"　　\"Stop saying the name!\" said Ron in a terrified"       
## [5470] "whisper, as if he thought Voldemort could hear them.　　Harry wasn't"         
## [5471] "listening.　　\"Firenze saved me, but he shouldn't have done so.... Bane"     
## [5472] "was furious... he was talking about interfering with what the planets"        
## [5473] "say is going to happen.... They must show that Voldemort's coming"            
## [5474] "back.... Bane thinks Firenze should have let Voldemort kill me.... I"         
## [5475] "suppose that's written in the stars as well.\"　　\"Will you stop saying"     
## [5476] "the name!\" Ron hissed.　　\"So all I've got to wait for now is Snape to"     
## [5477] "steal the Stone,\" Harry went on feverishly, \"then Voldemort will be"        
## [5478] "able to come and finish me off... Well, I suppose Bane'll be"                 
## [5479] "happy.\"　　Hermione looked very frightened, but she had a word of"           
## [5480] "comfort.　　\"Harry, everyone says Dumbledore's the only one"                 
## [5481] "You-Know-Who was ever afraid of With Dumbledore around, You-Know-Who"         
## [5482] "won't touch you. Anyway, who says the centaurs are right? It sounds"          
## [5483] "like fortune-telling to me, and Professor McGonagall says that's a very"      
## [5484] "imprecise branch of magic.\"　　The sky had turned light before they"         
## [5485] "stopped talking. They went to bed exhausted, their throats sore. But"         
## [5486] "the night's surprises weren't over.　　When Harry pulled back his"            
## [5487] "sheets, he found his invisibility cloak folded neatly underneath them."       
## [5488] "There was a note pinned to it:　　Just in case.　　 THROUGH THE"              
## [5489] "TRAPDOOR　　In years to come, Harry would never quite remember how he"        
## [5490] "had managed to get through his exams when he half expected Voldemort to"      
## [5491] "come bursting through the door at any moment. Yet the days crept by,"         
## [5492] "and there could be no doubt that Fluffy was still alive and well behind"      
## [5493] "the locked door.　　It was sweltering hot, especially in the large"           
## [5494] "classroom where they did their written papers. They had been given"           
## [5495] "special, new quills for the exams, which had been bewitched with an"          
## [5496] "AntiCheating spell.　　They had practical exams as well. Professor"           
## [5497] "Flitwick called them one by one into his class to see if they could"          
## [5498] "make a pineapple tapdance across a desk. Professor McGonagall watched"        
## [5499] "them turn a mouse into a snuffbox -- points were given for how pretty"        
## [5500] "the snuffbox was, but taken away if it had whiskers. Snape made them"         
## [5501] "all nervous, breathing down their necks while they tried to remember"         
## [5502] "how to make a Forgetfulness potion.　　Harry did the best he could,"          
## [5503] "trying to ignore the stabbing pains in his forehead, which had been"          
## [5504] "bothering him ever since his trip into the forest. Neville thought"           
## [5505] "Harry had a bad case of exam nerves because Harry couldn't sleep, but"        
## [5506] "the truth was that Harry kept being woken by his old nightmare, except"       
## [5507] "that it was now worse than ever because there was a hooded figure"            
## [5508] "dripping blood in it.　　Maybe it was because they hadn't seen what"          
## [5509] "Harry had seen in the forest, or because they didn't have scars burning"      
## [5510] "on their foreheads, but Ron and Hermione didn't seem as worried about"        
## [5511] "the Stone as Harry. The idea of Voldemort certainly scared them, but he"      
## [5512] "didn't keep visiting them in dreams, and they were so busy with their"        
## [5513] "studying they didn't have much time to fret about what Snape or anyone"       
## [5514] "else might be up to.　　Their very last exam was History of Magic. One"       
## [5515] "hour of answering questions about batty old wizards who'd invented"           
## [5516] "selfstirring cauldrons and they'd be free, free for a whole wonderful"        
## [5517] "week until their exam results came out. When the ghost of Professor"          
## [5518] "Binns told them to put down their quills and roll up their parchment,"        
## [5519] "Harry couldn't help cheering with the rest.　　\"That was far easier"         
## [5520] "than I thought it would be,\" said Hermione as they joined the crowds"        
## [5521] "flocking out onto the sunny grounds. \"I needn't have learned about the"      
## [5522] "1637 Werewolf Code of Conduct or the uprising of Elfric the"                  
## [5523] "Eager.\"　　Hermione always liked to go through their exam papers"            
## [5524] "afterward, but Ron said this made him feel ill, so they wandered down"        
## [5525] "to the lake and flopped under a tree. The Weasley twins and Lee Jordan"       
## [5526] "were tickling the tentacles of a giant squid, which was basking in the"       
## [5527] "warm shallows. \"No more studying,\" Ron sighed happily, stretching out"      
## [5528] "on the grass. \"You could look more cheerful, Harry, we've got a week"        
## [5529] "before we find out how badly we've done, there's no need to worry"            
## [5530] "yet.\"　　Harry was rubbing his forehead.　　\"I wish I knew what this"       
## [5531] "means!\" he burst out angrily. \"My scar keeps hurting -- it's happened"      
## [5532] "before, but never as often as this.\"　　\"Go to Madam Pomfrey,\" Hermione"   
## [5533] "suggested.　　\"I'm not ill,\" said Harry. \"I think it's a warning... it"    
## [5534] "means danger's coming....\"　　Ron couldn't get worked up, it was too"        
## [5535] "hot.　　\"Harry, relax, Hermione's right, the Stone's safe as long as"        
## [5536] "Dumbledore's around. Anyway, we've never had any proof Snape found out"       
## [5537] "how to get past Fluffy. He nearly had his leg ripped off once, he's not"      
## [5538] "going to try it again in a hurry. And Neville will play Quidditch for"        
## [5539] "England before Hagrid lets Dumbledore down.\"　　Harry nodded, but he"        
## [5540] "couldn't shake off a lurking feeling that there was something he'd"           
## [5541] "forgotten to do, something important. When he tried to explain this,"         
## [5542] "Hermione said, \"That's just the exams. I woke up last night and was"         
## [5543] "halfway through my Transfiguration notes before I remembered we'd done"       
## [5544] "that one.\"　　Harry was quite sure the unsettled feeling didn't have"        
## [5545] "anything to do with work, though. He watched an owl flutter toward the"       
## [5546] "school across the bright blue sky, a note clamped in its mouth. Hagrid"       
## [5547] "was the only one who ever sent him letters. Hagrid would never betray"        
## [5548] "Dumbledore. Hagrid would never tell anyone how to get past Fluffy..."         
## [5549] "never... but --　　Harry suddenly jumped to his feet.　　\"Where're you"      
## [5550] "going?\" said Ron sleepily.　　 \"I've just thought of something,\" said"     
## [5551] "Harry. He had turned white. \"We've got to go and see Hagrid,"                
## [5552] "now.\"　　\"Why?\" panted Hermione, hurrying to keep up.　　\"Don't you"      
## [5553] "think it's a bit odd,\" said Harry, scrambling up the grassy slope,"          
## [5554] "\"that what Hagrid wants more than anything else is a dragon, and a"          
## [5555] "stranger turns up who just happens to have an egg in his pocket? How"         
## [5556] "many people wander around with dragon eggs if it's against wizard law?"       
## [5557] "Lucky they found Hagrid, don't you think? Why didn't I see it"                
## [5558] "before?\"　　\"What are you talking about?\" said Ron, but Harry,"            
## [5559] "sprinting across the grounds toward the forest, didn't"                       
## [5560] "answer.　　Hagrid was sitting in an armchair outside his house; his"          
## [5561] "trousers and sleeves were rolled up, and he was shelling peas into a"         
## [5562] "large bowl.　　\"Hullo,\" he said, smiling. \"Finished yer exams? Got time"   
## [5563] "fer a drink?\"　　\"Yes, please,\" said Ron, but Harry cut him"               
## [5564] "off.　　\"No, we're in a hurry. Hagrid, I've got to ask you something."       
## [5565] "You know that night you won Norbert? What did the stranger you were"          
## [5566] "playing cards with look like?\"　　\"Dunno,\" said Hagrid casually, \"he"     
## [5567] "wouldn' take his cloak off.\"　　He saw the three of them look stunned"       
## [5568] "and raised his eyebrows.　　\"It's not that unusual, yeh get a lot o'"        
## [5569] "funny folk in the Hog's Head -- that's the pub down in the village."          
## [5570] "Mighta bin a dragon dealer, mightn' he? I never saw his face, he kept"        
## [5571] "his hood up.\"　　Harry sank down next to the bowl of peas. \"What did"       
## [5572] "you talk to him about, Hagrid? Did you mention Hogwarts at"                   
## [5573] "all?\"　　\"Mighta come up,\" said Hagrid, frowning as he tried to"           
## [5574] "remember. \"Yeah... he asked what I did, an' I told him I was gamekeeper"     
## [5575] "here.... He asked a bit about the sorta creatures I took after... so I"       
## [5576] "told him... an' I said what I'd always really wanted was a dragon..."         
## [5577] "an' then... I can' remember too well, 'cause he kept buyin' me"               
## [5578] "drinks.... Let's see... yeah, then he said he had the dragon egg an' we"      
## [5579] "could play cards fer it if I wanted... but he had ter be sure I could"        
## [5580] "handle it, he didn' want it ter go ter any old home.... So I told him,"       
## [5581] "after Fluffy, a dragon would be easy...\"　　\"And did he -- did he seem"     
## [5582] "interested in Fluffy?\" Harry asked, try ing to keep his voice"               
## [5583] "calm.　　\"Well -- yeah -- how many three-headed dogs d'yeh meet, even"       
## [5584] "around Hogwarts? So I told him, Fluffy's a piece o' cake if yeh know"         
## [5585] "how to calm him down, jus' play him a bit o' music an' he'll go"              
## [5586] "straight off ter sleep --\"　　Hagrid suddenly looked horrified.　　\"I"      
## [5587] "shouldn'ta told yeh that!\" he blurted out. \"Forget I said it! Hey --"       
## [5588] "where're yeh goin'?\"　　Harry, Ron, and Hermione didn't speak to each"       
## [5589] "other at all until they came to a halt in the entrance hall, which"           
## [5590] "seemed very cold and gloomy after the grounds.　　\"We've got to go to"       
## [5591] "Dumbledore,\" said Harry. \"Hagrid told that stranger how to get past"        
## [5592] "Fluffy, and it was either Snape or Voldemort under that cloak -- it"          
## [5593] "must've been easy, once he'd got Hagrid drunk. I just hope Dumbledore"        
## [5594] "believes us. Firenze might back us up if Bane doesn't stop him. Where's"      
## [5595] "Dumbledore's office?\"　　They looked around, as if hoping to see a sign"     
## [5596] "pointing them in the right direction. They had never been told where"         
## [5597] "Dumbledore lived, nor did they know anyone who had been sent to see"          
## [5598] "him.　　\"We'll just have to --\" Harry began, but a voice suddenly rang"     
## [5599] "across the hall.　　\"What are you three doing inside?\"　　It was"           
## [5600] "Professor McGonagall, carrying a large pile of books.　　\"We want to"        
## [5601] "see Professor Dumbledore,\" said Hermione, rather bravely, Harry and Ron"     
## [5602] "thought.　　\"See Professor Dumbledore?\" Professor McGonagall repeated,"     
## [5603] "as though this was a very fishy thing to want to do. \"Why?\"　　Harry"       
## [5604] "swallowed -- now what?　　\"It's sort of secret,\" he said, but he wished"    
## [5605] "at once he hadn't, because Professor McGonagall's nostrils"                   
## [5606] "flared.　　\"Professor Dumbledore left ten minutes ago,\" she said"           
## [5607] "coldly. \"He received an urgent owl from the Ministry of Magic and flew"      
## [5608] "off for London at once.\"　　\"He's gone?\" said Harry frantically."          
## [5609] "\"Now?\"　　\"Professor Dumbledore is a very great wizard, Potter, he has"    
## [5610] "many demands on his time --　　\"But this is important.\"　　\"Something"     
## [5611] "you have to say is more important than the Ministry of Magic,"                
## [5612] "Potter.　　\"Look,\" said Harry, throwing caution to the winds,"              
## [5613] "\"Professor -- it's about the Sorcerer's tone --\"　　Whatever Professor"     
## [5614] "McGonagall had expected, it wasn't that. The books she was carrying"          
## [5615] "tumbled out of her arms, but she didn't pick them up. \"How do you know"      
## [5616] "--?\" she spluttered.　　\"Professor, I think -- I know -- that Sn- that"     
## [5617] "someone's going to try and steal the Stone. I've got to talk to"              
## [5618] "Professor Dumbledore.\"　　She eyed him with a mixture of shock and"          
## [5619] "suspicion.　　\"Professor Dumbledore will be back tomorrow,\" she said"       
## [5620] "finally. I don't know how you found out about the Stone, but rest"            
## [5621] "assured, no one can possibly steal it, it's too well"                         
## [5622] "protected.\"　　\"But Professor --\"　　\"Potter, I know what I'm talking"    
## [5623] "about,\" she said shortly. She bent down and gathered up the fallen"          
## [5624] "books. I suggest you all go back outside and enjoy the"                       
## [5625] "sunshine.\"　　But they didn't.　　\"It's tonight,\" said Harry, once he"     
## [5626] "was sure Professor McGonagall was out of earshot. \"Snape's going"            
## [5627] "through the trapdoor tonight. He's found out everything he needs, and"        
## [5628] "now he's got Dumbledore out of the way. He sent that note, I bet the"         
## [5629] "Ministry of Magic will get a real shock when Dumbledore turns"                
## [5630] "up.\"　　\"But what can we --\"　　Hermione gasped. Harry and Ron wheeled"    
## [5631] "round.　　Snape was standing there.　　\"Good afternoon,\" he said"           
## [5632] "smoothly.　　They stared at him.　　\"You shouldn't be inside on a day"       
## [5633] "like this,\" he said, with an odd, twisted smile.　　\"We were --\" Harry"    
## [5634] "began, without any idea what he was going to say.　　\"You want to be"        
## [5635] "more careful,\" said Snape. \"Hanging around　　like this, people will"       
## [5636] "think you're up to something. And Gryffindor really can't afford to"          
## [5637] "lose any more points, can it?\"　　Harry flushed. They turned to go"          
## [5638] "outside, but Snape called them back.　　\"Be warned, Potter -- any more"      
## [5639] "nighttime wanderings and I will personally make sure you are expelled."       
## [5640] "Good day to you.\"　　He strode off in the direction of the"                  
## [5641] "staffroom.　　Out on the stone steps, Harry turned to the"                    
## [5642] "others.　　\"Right, here's what we've got to do,\" he whispered urgently."    
## [5643] "\"One of us has got to keep an eye on Snape -- wait outside the staff"        
## [5644] "room and follow him if he leaves it. Hermione, you'd better do"               
## [5645] "that.\"　　\"Why me?\"　　\"It's obvious,\" said Ron. \"You can pretend to be"
## [5646] "waiting for Professor Flitwick, you know.\" He put on a high voice, \"'Oh"    
## [5647] "Professor Flitwick, I'm so worried, I think I got question fourteen b"        
## [5648] "wrong....'\"　　\"Oh, shut up,\" said Hermione, but she agreed to go and"     
## [5649] "watch out for Snape.　　\"And we'd better stay outside the third-floor"       
## [5650] "corridor,\" Harry told Ron. \"Come on.\"　　But that part of the plan"        
## [5651] "didn't work. No sooner had they reached the door separating Fluffy from"      
## [5652] "the rest of the school than Professor McGonagall turned up again and"         
## [5653] "this time, she lost her temper.　　\"I suppose you think you're harder"       
## [5654] "to get past than a pack of enchantments!\" she stormed. \"Enough of this"     
## [5655] "nonsense! If I hear you 've come anywhere near here again, I'll take"         
## [5656] "another fifty points from Gryffindor! Yes, Weasley, from my own house!\""     
## [5657] "Harry and Ron went back to the common room, Harry had just said, \"At"        
## [5658] "least Hermione's on Snape's tail,\" when the portrait of the Fat Lady"        
## [5659] "swung open and Hermione came in.　　\"I'm sorry, Harry!\" she wailed."        
## [5660] "\"Snape came out and asked me what I was doing, so I said I was waiting"      
## [5661] "for Flitwick, and Snape went to get him, and I've only just got away, I"      
## [5662] "don't know where Snape went.\"　　\"Well, that's it then, isn't it?\""        
## [5663] "Harry said.　　The other two stared at him. He was pale and his eyes"         
## [5664] "were glittering.　　\"I'm going out of here tonight and I'm going to try"     
## [5665] "and get to the Stone first.\"　　\"You're mad!\" said Ron.　　\"You can't!\"" 
## [5666] "said Hermione. \"After what McGonagall and Snape have said? You'll be"        
## [5667] "expelled!\"　　\"SO WHAP\" Harry shouted. \"Don't you understand? If Snape"   
## [5668] "gets hold of the Stone, Voldemort's coming back! Haven't you heard what"      
## [5669] "it was like when he was trying to take over? There won't be any"              
## [5670] "Hogwarts to get expelled from! He'll flatten it, or turn it into a"           
## [5671] "school for the Dark Arts! Losing points doesn't matter anymore, can't"        
## [5672] "you see? D'you think he'll leave you and your families alone if"              
## [5673] "Gryffindor wins the house cup? If I get caught before I can get to the"       
## [5674] "Stone, well, I'll have to go back to the Dursleys and wait for"               
## [5675] "Voldemort to find me there, it's only dying a bit later than I would"         
## [5676] "have, because I'm never going over to the Dark Side! I'm going through"       
## [5677] "that trapdoor tonight and nothing you two say is going to stop me!"           
## [5678] "Voldemort killed my parents, remember?\"　　He glared at"                     
## [5679] "them.　　\"You're right Harry,\" said Hermione in a small voice.　　\"I'll"   
## [5680] "use the invisibility cloak,\" said Harry. \"It's just lucky I got it"         
## [5681] "back.\"　　\"But will it cover all three of us?\" said Ron.　　\"All -- all"  
## [5682] "three of us?\"　　\"Oh, come off it, you don't think we'd let you go"         
## [5683] "alone?\"　　\"Of course not,\" said Hermione briskly. \"How do you think"     
## [5684] "you'd get to the Stone without us? I'd better go and took through my"         
## [5685] "books, there might be something useful...\"　　\"But if we get caught,"       
## [5686] "you two will be expelled, too.\"　　\"Not if I can help it,\" said"           
## [5687] "Hermione grimly. \"Flitwick told me in secret that I got a hundred and"       
## [5688] "twelve percent on his exam. They're not throwing me out after"                
## [5689] "that.\"　　After dinner the three of them sat nervously apart in the"         
## [5690] "common room. Nobody bothered them; none of the Gryffindors had anything"      
## [5691] "to say to Harry any more, after all. This was the first night he hadn't"      
## [5692] "been upset by it. Hermione was skimming through all her notes, hoping"        
## [5693] "to come across one of the enchantments they were about to try to break."      
## [5694] "Harry and Ron didn't talk much. Both of them were thinking about what"        
## [5695] "they were about to do.　　Slowly, the room emptied as people drifted"         
## [5696] "off to bed.　　\"Better get the cloak,\" Ron muttered, as Lee Jordan"         
## [5697] "finally left, stretching and yawning. Harry ran upstairs to their dark"       
## [5698] "dormitory. He putted out the cloak and then his eyes fell on the flute"       
## [5699] "Hagrid had given him for Christmas. He pocketed it to use on Fluffy --"       
## [5700] "he didn't feel much like singing.　　He ran back down to the common"          
## [5701] "room.　　\"We'd better put the cloak on here, and make sure it covers"        
## [5702] "all three of us -- if Filch spots one of our feet wandering along on"         
## [5703] "its own --\"　　\"What are you doing?\" said a voice from the corner of"      
## [5704] "the room. Neville appeared from behind an armchair, clutching Trevor"         
## [5705] "the toad, who looked as though he'd been making another bid for"              
## [5706] "freedom.　　\"Nothing, Neville, nothing,\" said Harry, hurriedly putting"     
## [5707] "the cloak behind his back.　　Neville stared at their guilty"                 
## [5708] "faces.　　\"You're going out again,\" he said.　　\"No, no, no,\" said"       
## [5709] "Hermione. \"No, we're not. Why don't you go to bed, Neville?\"　　Harry"      
## [5710] "looked at the grandfather clock by the door. They couldn't afford to"         
## [5711] "waste any more time, Snape might even now be playing Fluffy to"               
## [5712] "sleep.　　\"You can't go out,\" said Neville, \"you'll be caught again."      
## [5713] "Gryffindor will be in even more trouble.\"　　\"You don't understand,\""      
## [5714] "said Harry, \"this is important.\"　　But Neville was clearly steeling"       
## [5715] "himself to do something desperate.　　I won't let you do it,\" he said,"      
## [5716] "hurrying to stand in front of the portrait hole. \"I'll -- I'll fight"        
## [5717] "you!\"　　\"Neville, \"Ron exploded, \"get away from that hole and don't be"  
## [5718] "an idiot --\"　　\"Don't you call me an idiot!\" said Neville. I don't"       
## [5719] "think you should be breaking any more rules! And you were the one who"        
## [5720] "told me to stand up to people!\"　　\"Yes, but not to us,\" said Ron in"      
## [5721] "exasperation. \"Neville, you don't know what you're doing.\"　　He took a"    
## [5722] "step forward and Neville dropped Trevor the toad, who leapt out of"           
## [5723] "sight.　　\"Go on then, try and hit me!\" said Neville, raising his"          
## [5724] "fists. \"I'm ready!\"　　Harry turned to Hermione.　　\"Do something,\" he"   
## [5725] "said desperately.　　Hermione stepped forward.　　\"Neville,\" she said,"     
## [5726] "\"I'm really, really sorry about this.\"　　She raised her"                   
## [5727] "wand.　　\"Petrificus Totalus!\" she cried, pointing it at"                   
## [5728] "Neville.　　Neville's arms snapped to his sides. His legs sprang"             
## [5729] "together. His whole body rigid, he swayed where he stood and then fell"       
## [5730] "flat on his face, stiff as a board.　　Hermione ran to turn him over."        
## [5731] "Neville's jaws were jammed together so he couldn't speak. Only his eyes"      
## [5732] "were moving, looking at them in horror.　　\"What've you done to him?\""      
## [5733] "Harry whispered.　　\"It's the full Body-Bind,\" said Hermione miserably."    
## [5734] "\"Oh, Neville, I'm so sorry.\"　　\"We had to, Neville, no time to"           
## [5735] "explain,\" said Harry.　　\"You'll understand later, Neville,\" said Ron"     
## [5736] "as they stepped over him and pulled on the invisibility cloak.　　But"        
## [5737] "leaving Neville lying motionless on the floor didn't feel like a very"        
## [5738] "good omen. In their nervous state, every statue's shadow looked like"         
## [5739] "Filch, every distant breath of wind sounded like Peeves swooping down"        
## [5740] "on them. At the foot of the first set of stairs, they spotted Mrs."           
## [5741] "Norris skulking near the top.　　\"Oh, let's kick her, just this once,\""     
## [5742] "Ron whispered in Harry's ear, but Harry shook his head. As they climbed"      
## [5743] "carefully around her, Mrs. Norris turned her lamplike eyes on them, but"      
## [5744] "didn't do anything.　　They didn't meet anyone else until they reached"       
## [5745] "the staircase up to the third floor. Peeves was bobbing halfway up,"          
## [5746] "loosening the carpet so that people would trip.　　\"Who's there?\" he"       
## [5747] "said suddenly as they climbed toward him. He narrowed his wicked black"       
## [5748] "eyes. \"Know you're there, even if I can't see you. Are you ghoulie or"       
## [5749] "ghostie or wee student beastie?\"　　He rose up in the air and floated"       
## [5750] "there, squinting at them.　　\"Should call Filch, I should, if"               
## [5751] "something's a-creeping around unseen.\"　　Harry had a sudden"                
## [5752] "idea.　　\"Peeves,\" he said, in a hoarse whisper, \"the Bloody Baron has"    
## [5753] "his own reasons for being invisible.\"　　Peeves almost fell out of the"      
## [5754] "air in shock. He caught himself in time and hovered about a foot off"         
## [5755] "the stairs.　　\"So sorry, your bloodiness, Mr. Baron, Sir,\" he said"        
## [5756] "greasily. \"My mistake, my mistake -- I didn't see you -- of course I"        
## [5757] "didn't, you're invisible -- forgive old Peevsie his little joke,"             
## [5758] "sir.\"　　\"I have business here, Peeves,\" croaked Harry. \"Stay away from"  
## [5759] "this place tonight.\"　　\"I will, sir, I most certainly will,\" said"        
## [5760] "Peeves, rising up in the air again. \"Hope your business goes well,"          
## [5761] "Baron, I'll not bother you.\"　　And he scooted off　　\"Brilliant,"          
## [5762] "Harry!\" whispered Ron.　　A few seconds later, they were there, outside"     
## [5763] "the third-floor corridor -- and the door was already ajar.　　\"Well,"        
## [5764] "there you are,\" Harry said quietly, \"Snape's already got past"              
## [5765] "Fluffy.\"　　Seeing the open door somehow seemed to impress upon all"         
## [5766] "three of them what was facing them. Underneath the cloak, Harry turned"       
## [5767] "to the other two.　　\"If you want to go back, I won't blame you,\" he"       
## [5768] "said. \"You can take the cloak, I won't need it now.\"　　\"Don't be"         
## [5769] "stupid,\" said Ron.　　\"We're coming,\" said Hermione.　　Harry pushed"      
## [5770] "the door open.　　As the door creaked, low, rumbling growls met their"        
## [5771] "ears. All three of the dog's noses sniffed madly in their direction,"         
## [5772] "even though it couldn't see them.　　\"What's that at its feet?\""            
## [5773] "Hermione whispered.　　\"Looks like a harp,\" said Ron. \"Snape must have"    
## [5774] "left it there.\"　　\"It must wake up the moment you stop playing,\" said"    
## [5775] "Harry. \"Well, here goes...\"　　He put Hagrid's flute to his lips and"       
## [5776] "blew. It wasn't really a tune, but from the first note the beast's eyes"      
## [5777] "began to droop. Harry hardly drew breath. Slowly, the dog's growls"           
## [5778] "ceased -- it tottered on its paws and fell to its knees, then it"             
## [5779] "slumped to the ground, fast asleep.　　\"Keep playing,\" Ron warned Harry"    
## [5780] "as they slipped out of the cloak and crept toward the trapdoor. They"         
## [5781] "could feel the dog's hot, smelly breath as they approached the giant"         
## [5782] "heads. \"I think we'll be able to pull the door open,\" said Ron, peering"    
## [5783] "over the dog's back. \"Want to go first, Hermione?\"　　\"No, I"              
## [5784] "don't!\"　　\"All right.\" Ron gritted his teeth and stepped carefully"       
## [5785] "over the dog's legs. He bent and pulled the ring of the trapdoor, which"      
## [5786] "swung up and open.　　\"What can you see?\" Hermione said"                    
## [5787] "anxiously.　　\"Nothing -- just black -- there's no way of climbing"          
## [5788] "down, we'll just have to drop.\"　　Harry, who was still playing the"         
## [5789] "flute, waved at Ron to get his attention and pointed at"                      
## [5790] "himself.　　\"You want to go first? Are you sure?\" said Ron. \"I don't"      
## [5791] "know how deep this thing goes. Give the flute to Hermione so she can"         
## [5792] "keep him asleep.\"　　Harry handed the flute over. In the few seconds'"       
## [5793] "silence, the dog growled and twitched, but the moment Hermione began to"      
## [5794] "play, it fell back into its deep sleep.　　Harry climbed over it and"         
## [5795] "looked down through the trapdoor. There was no sign of the"                   
## [5796] "bottom.　　He lowered himself through the hole until he was hanging on"       
## [5797] "by his fingertips. Then he looked up at Ron and said, \"If anything"          
## [5798] "happens to me, don't follow. Go straight to the owlery and send Hedwig"       
## [5799] "to Dumbledore, right?\"　　\"Right,\" said Ron.　　\"See you in a minute, I"  
## [5800] "hope...　　And Harry let go. Cold, damp air rushed past him as he fell"       
## [5801] "down, down, down and -- FLUMP. With a funny, muffled sort of thump he"        
## [5802] "landed on something soft. He sat up and felt around, his eyes not used"       
## [5803] "to the gloom. It felt as though he was sitting on some sort of"               
## [5804] "plant.　　\"It's okay!\" he called up to the light the size of a postage"     
## [5805] "stamp, which was the open trapdoor, \"it's a soft landing, you can"           
## [5806] "jump!\"　　Ron followed right away. He landed, sprawled next to"              
## [5807] "Harry.　　\"What's this stuff?\" were his first words.　　\"Dunno, some"      
## [5808] "sort of plant thing. I suppose it's here to break the fall. Come on,"         
## [5809] "Hermione!\"　　The distant music stopped. There was a loud bark from the"     
## [5810] "dog, but Hermione had already jumped. She landed on Harry's other"            
## [5811] "side.　　\"We must be miles under the school , she said.　　\"Lucky this"     
## [5812] "plant thing's here, really,\" said Ron.　　\"Lucky!\" shrieked Hermione."     
## [5813] "\"Look at you both!\"　　She leapt up and struggled toward a damp wall."      
## [5814] "She had to struggle because the moment she had landed, the plant had"         
## [5815] "started to twist snakelike tendrils around her ankles. As for Harry and"      
## [5816] "Ron, their legs had already been bound tightly in long creepers without"      
## [5817] "their noticing.　　Hermione had managed to free herself before the"           
## [5818] "plant got a firm grip on her. Now she watched in horror as the two boys"      
## [5819] "fought to pull the plant off them, but the more they strained against"        
## [5820] "it, the tighter and faster the plant wound around them.　　\"Stop"            
## [5821] "moving!\" Hermione ordered them. \"I know what this is -- it's Devil's"       
## [5822] "Snare!\"　　\"Oh, I'm so glad we know what it's called, that's a great"       
## [5823] "help,\" snarled Ron, leaning back, trying to stop the plant from curling"     
## [5824] "around his neck. \"Shut up, I'm trying to remember how to kill it!\" said"    
## [5825] "Hermione.　　\"Well, hurry up, I can't breathe!\" Harry gasped, wrestling"    
## [5826] "with it as it curled around his chest.　　\"Devil's Snare, Devil's"           
## [5827] "Snare... what did Professor Sprout say? -- it likes the dark and the"         
## [5828] "damp　　\"So light a fire!\" Harry choked.　　\"Yes -- of course -- but"      
## [5829] "there's no wood!\" Hermione cried, wringing her hands.　　\"HAVE YOU GONE"    
## [5830] "MAD?\" Ron bellowed. \"ARE YOU A WITCH OR NOT?\"　　\"Oh, right!\" said"      
## [5831] "Hermione, and she whipped out her wand, waved it, muttered something,"        
## [5832] "and sent a jet of the same bluebell flames she had used on Snape at the"      
## [5833] "plant. In a matter of seconds, the two boys felt it loosening its grip"       
## [5834] "as it cringed away from the light and warmth. Wriggling and flailing,"        
## [5835] "it unraveled itself from their bodies, and they were able to pull"            
## [5836] "free.　　\"Lucky you pay attention in Herbology, Hermione,\" said Harry"      
## [5837] "as he joined her by the wall, wiping sweat off his face.　　\"Yeah,\""        
## [5838] "said Ron, \"and lucky Harry doesn't lose his head in a crisis --"             
## [5839] "'there's no wood,' honestly.\"　　\"This way,\" said Harry, pointing down"    
## [5840] "a stone passageway, which was the only way forward.　　All they could"        
## [5841] "hear apart from their footsteps was the gentle drip of water trickling"       
## [5842] "down the walls. The passageway sloped downward, and Harry was reminded"       
## [5843] "of Gringotts. With an unpleasant jolt of the heart, he remembered the"        
## [5844] "dragons said to be guarding vaults in the wizards' bank. If they met a"       
## [5845] "dragon, a fully-grown dragon -- Norbert had been bad enough...　　\"Can"      
## [5846] "you hear something?\" Ron whispered.　　Harry listened. A soft rustling"      
## [5847] "and clinking seemed to be coming from up ahead.　　\"Do you think it's a"     
## [5848] "ghost?\"　　\"I don't know... sounds like wings to me.\"　　\"There's light"  
## [5849] "ahead -- I can see something moving.\"　　They reached the end of the"        
## [5850] "passageway and saw before them a brilliantly lit chamber, its ceiling"        
## [5851] "arching high above them. It was full of small, jewel-bright birds,"           
## [5852] "fluttering and tumbling all around the room. On the opposite side of"         
## [5853] "the chamber was a heavy wooden door.　　\"Do you think they'll attack us"     
## [5854] "if we cross the room?\" said Ron.　　\"Probably,\" said Harry. \"They don't"  
## [5855] "look very vicious, but I suppose if they all swooped down at once..."         
## [5856] "well, there's no other choice... I'll run.\"　　He took a deep breath,"       
## [5857] "covered his face with his arms, and sprinted across the room. He"             
## [5858] "expected to feel sharp beaks and claws tearing at him any second, but"        
## [5859] "nothing happened. He reached the door untouched. He pulled the handle,"       
## [5860] "but it was locked.　　The other two followed him. They tugged and"            
## [5861] "heaved at the door, but it wouldn't budge, not even when Hermione tried"      
## [5862] "her Alohomora charm.　　\"Now what?\" said Ron.　　\"These birds... they"     
## [5863] "can't be here just for decoration,\" said Hermione.　　They watched the"      
## [5864] "birds soaring overhead, glittering -- glittering?　　\"They're not"           
## [5865] "birds!\" Harry said suddenly. \"They're keys! Winged keys -- look"            
## [5866] "carefully. So that must mean...\" he looked around the chamber while the"     
## [5867] "other two squinted up at the flock of keys. \"... yes -- look!"               
## [5868] "Broomsticks! We've got to catch the key to the door!\"　　\"But there are"    
## [5869] "hundreds of them!\"　　Ron examined the lock on the door.　　\"We're"         
## [5870] "looking for a big, old-fashioned one -- probably silver, like the"            
## [5871] "handle.\"　　They each seized a broomstick and kicked off into the air,"      
## [5872] "soaring into the midst of the cloud of keys. They grabbed and snatched,"      
## [5873] "but the bewitched keys darted and dived so quickly it was almost"             
## [5874] "impossible to catch one.　　Not for nothing, though, was Harry the"           
## [5875] "youngest Seeker in a century. He had a knack for spotting things other"       
## [5876] "people didn't. After a minute's weaving about through the whirl of"           
## [5877] "rainbow feathers, he noticed a large silver key that had a bent wing,"        
## [5878] "as if it had already been caught and stuffed roughly into the"                
## [5879] "keyhole.　　\"That one!\" he called to the others. \"That big one -- there"   
## [5880] "-- no, there -- with bright blue wings -- the feathers are all crumpled"      
## [5881] "on one side.\"　　Ron went speeding in the direction that Harry was"          
## [5882] "pointing, crashed into the ceiling, and nearly fell off his"                  
## [5883] "broom.　　\"We've got to close in on it!\" Harry called, not taking his"      
## [5884] "eyes off the key with the damaged wing. \"Ron, you come at it from above"     
## [5885] "-- Hermione, stay below and stop it from going down and I'll try and"         
## [5886] "catch it. Right, NOW!\"　　Ron dived, Hermione rocketed upward, the key"      
## [5887] "dodged them both, and Harry streaked after it; it sped toward the wall,"      
## [5888] "Harry leaned forward and with a nasty, crunching noise, pinned it"            
## [5889] "against the stone with one hand. Ron and Hermione's cheers echoed"            
## [5890] "around the high chamber.　　They landed quickly, and Harry ran to the"        
## [5891] "door, the key struggling in his hand. He rammed it into the lock and"         
## [5892] "turned -- it worked. The moment the lock had clicked open, the key took"      
## [5893] "flight again, looking very battered now that it had been caught"              
## [5894] "twice.　　\"Ready?\" Harry asked the other two, his hand on the door"         
## [5895] "handle. They nodded. He pulled the door open.　　The next chamber was"        
## [5896] "so dark they couldn't see anything at all. But as they stepped into it,"      
## [5897] "light suddenly flooded the room to reveal an astonishing sight.　　They"      
## [5898] "were standing on the edge of a huge chessboard, behind the black"             
## [5899] "chessmen, which were all taller than they were and carved from what"          
## [5900] "looked like black stone. Facing them, way across the chamber, were the"       
## [5901] "white pieces. Harry, Ron and Hermione shivered slightly -- the towering"      
## [5902] "white chessmen had no faces.　　\"Now what do we do?\" Harry"                 
## [5903] "whispered.　　\"It's obvious, isn't it?\" said Ron. \"We've got to play"      
## [5904] "our way across the room.\"　　Behind the white pieces they could see"         
## [5905] "another door.　　\"How?\" said Hermione nervously.　　\"I think,\" said"      
## [5906] "Ron, \"we're going to have to be chessmen.\"　　He walked up to a black"      
## [5907] "knight and put his hand out to touch the knight's horse. At once, the"        
## [5908] "stone sprang to life. The horse pawed the ground and the knight turned"       
## [5909] "his helmeted head to look down at Ron.　　\"Do we -- er -- have to join"      
## [5910] "you to get across?\" The black knight nodded. Ron turned to the other"        
## [5911] "two.　　\"This needs thinking about he said. I suppose we've got to take"     
## [5912] "the place of three of the black pieces....\"　　Harry and Hermione"           
## [5913] "stayed quiet, watching Ron think. Finally he said, \"Now, don't be"           
## [5914] "offended or anything, but neither of you are that good at chess"              
## [5915] "--\"　　\"We're not offended,\" said Harry quickly. \"Just tell us what to"   
## [5916] "do.\"　　\"Well, Harry, you take the place of that bishop, and Hermione,"     
## [5917] "YOU 90 next to him instead of that castle.\"　　\"What about"                 
## [5918] "you?\"　　\"I'm going to be a knight,\" said Ron.　　The chessmen seemed"     
## [5919] "to have been listening, because at these words a knight, a bishop, and"       
## [5920] "a castle turned their backs on the white pieces and walked off the"           
## [5921] "board, leaving three empty squares that Harry, Ron, and Hermione"             
## [5922] "took.　　\"White always plays first in chess,\" said Ron, peering across"     
## [5923] "the board. \"Yes... look...\"　　A white pawn had moved forward two"          
## [5924] "squares.　　Ron started to direct the black pieces. They moved silently"      
## [5925] "wherever he sent them. Harry's knees were trembling. What if they"            
## [5926] "lost?　　\"Harry -- move diagonally four squares to the right.\"　　Their"    
## [5927] "first real shock came when their other knight was taken. The white"           
## [5928] "queen smashed him to the floor and dragged him off the board, where he"       
## [5929] "lay quite still, facedown.　　\"Had to let that happen,\" said Ron,"          
## [5930] "looking shaken. \"Leaves you free to take that bishop, Hermione, go"          
## [5931] "on.\"　　Every time one of their men was lost, the white pieces showed"       
## [5932] "no mercy. Soon there was a huddle of limp black players slumped along"        
## [5933] "the wall. Twice, Ron only just noticed in time that Harry and Hermione"       
## [5934] "were in danger. He himself darted around the board, taking almost as"         
## [5935] "many white pieces as they had lost black ones.　　\"We're nearly there,\""    
## [5936] "he muttered suddenly. \"Let me think let me think...\"　　The white queen"    
## [5937] "turned her blank face toward him.　　\"Yes...\" said Ron softly, \"It's"      
## [5938] "the only way... I've got to be taken.\"　　\"NOF Harry and Hermione"          
## [5939] "shouted.　　\"That's chess!\" snapped Ron. \"You've got to make some"         
## [5940] "sacrifices! I take one step forward and she'll take me -- that leaves"        
## [5941] "you free to checkmate the king, Harry!\"　　\"But --\"　　\"Do you want to"   
## [5942] "stop Snape or not?\"　　\"Ron --\"　　\"Look, if you don't hurry up, he'll"   
## [5943] "already have the Stone!\"　　There was no alternative.　　\"Ready?\" Ron"     
## [5944] "called, his face pale but determined. \"Here I go - now, don't hang"          
## [5945] "around once you've won.\"　　He stepped forward, and the white queen"         
## [5946] "pounced. She struck Ron hard across the head with her stone arm, and he"      
## [5947] "crashed to the floor - Hermione screamed but stayed on her square - the"      
## [5948] "white queen dragged Ron to one side. He looked as if he'd been knocked"       
## [5949] "out.　　Shaking, Harry moved three spaces to the left.　　The white"          
## [5950] "king took off his crown and threw it at Harry's feet. They had won. The"      
## [5951] "chessmen parted and bowed, leaving the door ahead clear. With one last"       
## [5952] "desperate look back at Ron, Harry and Hermione charged through the door"      
## [5953] "and up the next passageway.　　\"What if he's --?\"　　\"He'll be all"        
## [5954] "right,\" said Harry, trying to convince himself. \"What do you reckon's"      
## [5955] "next?\"　　\"We've had Sprout's, that was the Devil's Snare; Flitwick"        
## [5956] "must've put charms on the keys; McGonagall transfigured the chessmen to"      
## [5957] "make them alive; that leaves Quirrell's spell, and Snape's.\"　　They"        
## [5958] "had reached another door.　　\"All right?\" Harry whispered.　　\"Go"         
## [5959] "on.\"　　Harry pushed it open.　　A disgusting smell filled their"            
## [5960] "nostrils, making both of them pull their robes up over their noses."          
## [5961] "Eyes watering, they saw, flat on the floor in front of them, a troll"         
## [5962] "even larger than the one they had tackled, out cold with a bloody lump"       
## [5963] "on its head.　　\"I'm glad we didn't have to fight that one,\" Harry"         
## [5964] "whispered as they stepped carefully over one of its massive legs. \"Come"     
## [5965] "on, I can't breathe.\"　　He pulled open the next door, both of them"         
## [5966] "hardly daring to look at what came next - but there was nothing very"         
## [5967] "frightening in here, just a table with seven differently shaped bottles"      
## [5968] "standing on it in a line.　　\"Snape's,\" said Harry. \"What do we have to"   
## [5969] "do?\"　　They stepped over the threshold, and immediately a fire sprang"      
## [5970] "up behind them in the doorway. It wasn't ordinary fire either; it was"        
## [5971] "purple. At the same instant, black flames shot up in the doorway"             
## [5972] "leading onward. They were trapped.　　\"Look!\" Hermione seized a roll of"    
## [5973] "paper lying next to the bottles. Harry looked over her shoulder to read"      
## [5974] "it:　　Danger lies before you, while safety lies behind,　　Two of us"        
## [5975] "will help you, which ever you would find,　　One among us seven will"         
## [5976] "let you move ahead,　　Another will transport the drinker back"               
## [5977] "instead,　　Two among our number hold only nettle wine,　　Three of us"       
## [5978] "are killers, waiting bidden in line.　　Choose, unless you wish to stay"      
## [5979] "here forevermore,　　To help you in your choice, we give you these"           
## [5980] "clues four:　　First, however slyly the poison tries to hide　　You"          
## [5981] "will always find some on nettle wine's left side;　　Second, different"       
## [5982] "are those who stand at either end,　　But if you would move onward,"          
## [5983] "neither is your friend;　　Third, as you see clearly, all are different"      
## [5984] "size,　　Neither dwarf nor giant holds death in their"                        
## [5985] "insides;　　Fourth, the second left and the second on the right　　Are"       
## [5986] "twins once you taste them, though different at first sight.　　Hermione"      
## [5987] "let out a great sigh and Harry, amazed, saw that she was smiling, the"        
## [5988] "very last thing he felt like doing.　　\"Brilliant,\" said Hermione."         
## [5989] "\"This isn't magic -- it's logic -- a puzzle. A lot of the greatest"          
## [5990] "wizards haven't got an ounce of logic, they'd be stuck in here"               
## [5991] "forever.\"　　\"But so will we, won't we?\" \"Of course not,\" said"          
## [5992] "Hermione. \"Everything we need is here on this paper. Seven bottles:"         
## [5993] "three are poison; two are wine; one will get us safely through the"           
## [5994] "black fire, and one will get us back through the purple.\"　　\"But how"      
## [5995] "do we know which to drink?\"　　\"Give me a minute.\"　　Hermione read the"   
## [5996] "paper several times. Then she walked up and down the line of bottles,"        
## [5997] "muttering to herself and pointing at them. At last, she clapped her"          
## [5998] "hands.　　\"Got it,\" she said. \"The smallest bottle will get us through"    
## [5999] "the black fire -- toward the Stone.\"　　Harry looked at the tiny"            
## [6000] "bottle.　　\"There's only enough there for one of us,\" he said. \"That's"    
## [6001] "hardly one swallow.\"　　They looked at each other.　　\"Which one will"      
## [6002] "get you back through the purple flames?\"　　Hermione pointed at a"           
## [6003] "rounded bottle at the right end of the line.　　\"You drink that,\" said"     
## [6004] "Harry. \"No, listen, get back and get Ron. Grab brooms from the flying-"      
## [6005] "key room, they'll get you out of the trapdoor and past Fluffy -- go"          
## [6006] "straight to the owlery and send Hedwig to Dumbledore, we need him. I"         
## [6007] "might be able to hold Snape off for a while, but I'm no match for him,"       
## [6008] "really.\"　　\"But Harry -- what if You-Know-Who's with him?\"　　\"Well --"  
## [6009] "I was lucky once, wasn't I?\" said Harry, pointing at his scar. \"I might"    
## [6010] "get lucky again.\"　　Hermione's lip trembled, and she suddenly dashed"       
## [6011] "at Harry and threw her arms around him.　　\"Hermione!\"　　\"Harry --"       
## [6012] "you're a great wizard, you know.\"　　\"I'm not as good as you,\" said"       
## [6013] "Harry, very embarrassed, as she let go of him.　　\"Me!\" said Hermione."     
## [6014] "\"Books! And cleverness! There are more important things -- friendship"       
## [6015] "and bravery and -- oh Harry -- be careful!\"　　\"You drink first,\" said"    
## [6016] "Harry. \"You are sure which is which, aren't you?\"　　\"Positive,\" said"    
## [6017] "Hermione. She took a long drink from the round bottle at the end, and"        
## [6018] "shuddered.　　\"It's not poison?\" said Harry anxiously.　　\"No -- but"      
## [6019] "it's like ice.\"　　\"Quick, go, before it wears off.\"　　\"Good luck --"    
## [6020] "take care.\"　　\"GO!\"　　Hermione turned and walked straight through the"   
## [6021] "purple fire.　　Harry took a deep breath and picked up the smallest"          
## [6022] "bottle. He turned to face the black flames.　　\"Here I come,\" he said,"     
## [6023] "and he drained the little bottle in one gulp.　　It was indeed as"            
## [6024] "though ice was flooding his body. He put the bottle down and walked"          
## [6025] "forward; he braced himself, saw the black flames licking his body, but"       
## [6026] "couldn't feel them -- for a moment he could see nothing but dark fire"        
## [6027] "-- then he was on the other side, in the last chamber.　　There was"          
## [6028] "already someone there -- but it wasn't Snape. It wasn't even"                 
## [6029] "Voldemort.　　 THE MAN WITH TWO FACES　　It was Quirrell.　　\"You!\""        
## [6030] "gasped Harry.　　Quirrell smiled. His face wasn't twitching at"               
## [6031] "all.　　\"Me,\" he said calmly. \"I wondered whether I'd be meeting you"      
## [6032] "here, Potter.\"　　\"But I thought -- Snape --\"　　\"Severus?\" Quirrell"    
## [6033] "laughed, and it wasn't his usual quivering treble, either, but cold and"      
## [6034] "sharp. \"Yes, Severus does seem the type, doesn't he? So useful to have"      
## [6035] "him swooping around like an overgrown bat. Next to him, who would"            
## [6036] "suspect p-p-poor, st-stuttering P-Professor Quirrell?\"　　Harry"             
## [6037] "couldn't take it in. This couldn't be true, it couldn't.　　\"But Snape"      
## [6038] "tried to kill me!\"　　\"No, no, no. I tried to kill you. Your friend"        
## [6039] "Miss Granger accidentally knocked me over as she rushed to set fire to"       
## [6040] "Snape at that Quidditch match. She broke my eye contact with you."            
## [6041] "Another few seconds and I'd have got you off that broom. I'd have"            
## [6042] "managed it before then if Snape hadn't been muttering a countercurse,"        
## [6043] "trying to save you.\"　　\"Snape was trying to save me?\"　　\"Of course,\""  
## [6044] "said Quirrell coolly. \"\\Why do you think he wanted to referee your next"    
## [6045] "match? He was trying to make sure I didn't do it again. Funny,"               
## [6046] "really... he needn't have bothered. I couldn't do anything with"              
## [6047] "Dumbledore watching. All the other teachers thought Snape was trying to"      
## [6048] "stop Gryffindor from winning, he did make himself unpopular... and what"      
## [6049] "a waste of time, when after all that, I'm going to kill you"                  
## [6050] "tonight.\"　　Quirrell snapped his fingers. Ropes sprang out of thin air"     
## [6051] "and wrapped themselves tightly around Harry.　　\"You're too nosy to"         
## [6052] "live, Potter. Scurrying around the school on Halloween like that, for"        
## [6053] "all I knew you'd seen me coming to look at what was guarding the"             
## [6054] "Stone.\"　　\"You let the troll in?\"　　\"Certainly. I have a special gift"  
## [6055] "with trolls -- you must have seen what I did to the one in the chamber"       
## [6056] "back there? Unfortunately, while everyone else was running around"            
## [6057] "looking for it, Snape, who already suspected me, went straight to the"        
## [6058] "third floor to head me off -- and not only did my troll fail to beat"         
## [6059] "you to death, that three-headed dog didn't even manage to bite Snape's"       
## [6060] "leg off properly.　　\"Now, wait quietly, Potter. I need to examine this"     
## [6061] "interesting mirror.　　It was only then that Harry realized what was"         
## [6062] "standing behind Quirrell. It was the Mirror of Erised.　　\"This mirror"      
## [6063] "is the key to finding the Stone,\" Quirrell murmured, tapping his way"        
## [6064] "around the frame. \"Trust Dumbledore to come up with something like"          
## [6065] "this... but he's in London... I'll be far away by the time he gets"           
## [6066] "back....\"　　All Harry could think of doing was to keep Quirrell"            
## [6067] "talking and stop him from concentrating on the mirror.　　\"I saw you"        
## [6068] "and Snape in the forest --\" he blurted out.　　\"Yes,\" said Quirrell"       
## [6069] "idly, walking around the mirror to look at the back. \"He was on to me"       
## [6070] "by that time, trying to find out how far I'd got. He suspected me all"        
## [6071] "along. Tried to frighten me - as though he could, when I had Lord"            
## [6072] "Voldemort on my side....\"　　Quirrell came back out from behind the"         
## [6073] "mirror and stared hungrily into it.　　\"I see the Stone... I'm"              
## [6074] "presenting it to my master... but where is it?\"　　Harry struggled"          
## [6075] "against the ropes binding him, but they didn't give. He had to keep"          
## [6076] "Quirrell from giving his whole attention to the mirror.　　\"But Snape"       
## [6077] "always seemed to hate me so much.\"　　\"Oh, he does,\" said Quirrell"        
## [6078] "casually, \"heavens, yes. He was at Hogwarts with your father, didn't"        
## [6079] "you know? They loathed each other. But he never wanted you"                   
## [6080] "dead.\"　　\"But I heard you a few days ago, sobbing -- I thought Snape"      
## [6081] "was threatening you....\"　　For the first time, a spasm of fear flitted"     
## [6082] "across Quirrell's face.　　\"Sometimes,\" he said, \"I find it hard to"       
## [6083] "follow my master's instructions -- he is a great wizard and I am weak"        
## [6084] "--\"　　\"You mean he was there in the classroom with you?\" Harry"           
## [6085] "gasped.　　\"He is with me wherever I go,\" said Quirrell quietly. \"I met"   
## [6086] "him when I traveled around the world. A foolish young man I was then,"        
## [6087] "full of ridiculous ideas about good and evil. Lord Voldemort showed me"       
## [6088] "how wrong I was. There is no good and evil, there is only power, and"         
## [6089] "those too weak to seek it.... Since then, I have served him faithfully,"      
## [6090] "although I have let him down many times. He has had to be very hard on"       
## [6091] "me.\" Quirrell shivered suddenly. \"He does not forgive mistakes easily."     
## [6092] "When I failed to steal the stone from Gringotts, he was most"                 
## [6093] "displeased. He punished me... decided he would have to keep a closer"         
## [6094] "watch on me....\"　　Quirrell's voice trailed away. Harry was"                
## [6095] "remembering his trip to Diagon Alley -how could he have been so stupid?"      
## [6096] "He'd seen Quirrell there that very day, shaken hands with him in the"         
## [6097] "Leaky Cauldron.　　Quirrell cursed under his breath.　　\"I don't"            
## [6098] "understand... is the Stone inside the mirror? Should I break"                 
## [6099] "it?\"　　Harry's mind was racing.　　What I want more than anything else"     
## [6100] "in the world at the moment, he thought, is to find the Stone before"          
## [6101] "Quirrell does. So if I look in the mirror, I should see myseff finding"       
## [6102] "it -- which means I'll see where it's hidden! But how can I look"             
## [6103] "without Quirrell realizing what I'm up to?　　He tried to edge to the"        
## [6104] "left, to get in front of the glass without Quirrell noticing, but the"        
## [6105] "ropes around his ankles were too tight: he tripped and fell over."            
## [6106] "Quirrell ignored him. He was still talking to himself. \"What does this"      
## [6107] "mirror do? How does it work? Help me, Master!\"　　And to Harry's"            
## [6108] "horror, a voice answered, and the voice seemed to come from Quirrell"         
## [6109] "himself　　\"Use the boy... Use the boy...\"　　Quirrell rounded on"          
## [6110] "Harry.　　\"Yes -- Potter -- come here.\"　　He clapped his hands once,"      
## [6111] "and the ropes binding Harry fell off. Harry got slowly to his"                
## [6112] "feet.　　\"Come here,\" Quirrell repeated. \"Look in the mirror and tell"     
## [6113] "me what you see.\"　　Harry walked toward him.　　I must lie, he thought"     
## [6114] "desperately. I must look and lie about what I see, that's"                    
## [6115] "all.　　Quirrell moved close behind him. Harry breathed in the funny"         
## [6116] "smell that seemed to come from Quirrell's turban. He closed his eyes,"        
## [6117] "stepped in front of the mirror, and opened them again.　　He saw his"         
## [6118] "reflection, pale and scared-looking at first. But a moment later, the"        
## [6119] "reflection smiled at him. It put its hand into its pocket and pulled"         
## [6120] "out a blood-red stone. It winked and put the Stone back in its pocket"        
## [6121] "-- and as it did so, Harry felt something heavy drop into his real"           
## [6122] "pocket. Somehow -- incredibly -- he'd gotten the Stone.　　\"Well?\" said"    
## [6123] "Quirrell impatiently. \"What do you see?\"　　Harry screwed up his"           
## [6124] "courage.　　\"I see myself shaking hands with Dumbledore,\" he invented."     
## [6125] "\"I -- I've won the house cup for Gryffindor.\"　　 Quirrell cursed"          
## [6126] "again.　　\"Get out of the way,\" he said. As Harry moved aside, he felt"     
## [6127] "the Sorcerer's Stone against his leg. Dare he make a break for"               
## [6128] "it?　　But he hadn't walked five paces before a high voice spoke,"            
## [6129] "though Quirrell wasn't moving his lips.　　\"He lies... He"                   
## [6130] "lies...\"　　\"Potter, come back here!\" Quirrell shouted. \"Tell me the"     
## [6131] "truth! What did you just see?\"　　The high voice spoke again.　　\"Let"      
## [6132] "me speak to him... face-to-face...\"　　\"Master, you are not strong"         
## [6133] "enough!\"　　\"I have strength enough... for this....\"　　Harry felt as"     
## [6134] "if Devil's Snare was rooting him to the spot. He couldn't move a"             
## [6135] "muscle. Petrified, he watched as Quirrell reached up and began to"            
## [6136] "unwrap his turban. What was going on? The turban fell away. Quirrell's"       
## [6137] "head looked strangely small without it. Then he turned slowly on the"         
## [6138] "spot.　　Harry would have screamed, but he couldn't make a sound. Where"      
## [6139] "there should have been a back to Quirrell's head, there was a face, the"      
## [6140] "most terrible face Harry had ever seen. It was chalk white with glaring"      
## [6141] "red eyes and slits for nostrils, like a snake.　　\"Harry Potter...\" it"     
## [6142] "whispered.　　Harry tried to take a step backward but his legs wouldn't"      
## [6143] "move.　　\"See what I have become?\" the face said. \"Mere shadow and"        
## [6144] "vapor ... I have form only when I can share another's body... but there"      
## [6145] "have always been those willing to let me into their hearts and"               
## [6146] "minds.... Unicorn blood has strengthened me, these past weeks... you"         
## [6147] "saw faithful Quirrell drinking it for me in the forest... and once I"         
## [6148] "have the Elixir of Life, I will be able to create a body of my own...."       
## [6149] "Now... why don't you give me that Stone in your pocket?\"　　So he knew."     
## [6150] "The feeling suddenly surged back into Harry's legs. He stumbled"              
## [6151] "backward.　　\"Don't be a fool,\" snarled the face. \"Better save your own"   
## [6152] "life and join me... or you'll meet the same end as your parents...."          
## [6153] "They died begging me for mercy...\"　　\"LIAR!\" Harry shouted"               
## [6154] "suddenly.　　Quirrell was walking backward at him, so that Voldemort"         
## [6155] "could still see him. The evil face was now smiling.　　\"How"                 
## [6156] "touching...\" it hissed. \"I always value bravery... Yes, boy, your"          
## [6157] "parents were brave.... I killed your father first; and he put up a"           
## [6158] "courageous fight... but your mother needn't have died... she was trying"      
## [6159] "to protect you.... Now give me the Stone, unless you want her to have"        
## [6160] "died in vain.\"　　\"NEVER!\"　　Harry sprang toward the flame door, but"     
## [6161] "Voldemort screamed \"SEIZE HIM!\" and the next second, Harry felt"            
## [6162] "Quirrell's hand close on his wrist. At once, a needle-sharp pain seared"      
## [6163] "across Harry's scar; his head felt as though it was about to split in"        
## [6164] "two; he yelled, struggling with all his might, and to his surprise,"          
## [6165] "Quirrell let go of him. The pain in his head lessened -- he looked"           
## [6166] "around wildly to see where Quirrell had gone, and saw him hunched in"         
## [6167] "pain, looking at his fingers -- they were blistering before his"              
## [6168] "eyes.　　\"Seize him! SEIZE HIM!\" shrieked Voldemort again, and Quirrell"    
## [6169] "lunged, knocking Harry clean off his feet' landing on top of him, both"       
## [6170] "hands around Harry's neck -- Harry's scar was almost blinding him with"       
## [6171] "pain, yet he could see Quirrell howling in agony.　　\"Master, I cannot"      
## [6172] "hold him -- my hands -- my hands!\"　　And Quirrell, though pinning"          
## [6173] "Harry to the ground with his knees, let go of his neck and stared,"           
## [6174] "bewildered, at his own palms -- Harry could see they looked burned,"          
## [6175] "raw, red, and shiny.　　\"Then kill him, fool, and be done!\" screeched"      
## [6176] "Voldemort.　　Quirrell raised his hand to perform a deadly curse, but"        
## [6177] "Harry, by instinct, reached up and grabbed Quirrell's face"                   
## [6178] "--　　\"AAAARGH!\"　　Quirrell rolled off him, his face blistering, too,"     
## [6179] "and then Harry knew: Quirrell couldn't touch his bare skin, not without"      
## [6180] "suffering terrible pain -- his only chance was to keep hold of"               
## [6181] "Quirrell, keep him in enough pain to stop him from doing a"                   
## [6182] "curse.　　Harry jumped to his feet, caught Quirrell by the arm, and"          
## [6183] "hung on as tight as he could. Quirrell screamed and tried to throw"           
## [6184] "Harry off -- the pain in Harry's head was building -- he couldn't see"        
## [6185] "-- he could only hear Quirrell's terrible shrieks and Voldemort's yells"      
## [6186] "of, \"KILL HIM! KILL HIM!\" and other voices, maybe in Harry's own head,"     
## [6187] "crying, \"Harry! Harry!\"　　He felt Quirrell's arm wrenched from his"        
## [6188] "grasp, knew all was lost, and fell into blackness, down ... down..."          
## [6189] "down...　　Something gold was glinting just above him. The Snitch! He"        
## [6190] "tried to catch it, but his arms were too heavy.　　He blinked. It"            
## [6191] "wasn't the Snitch at all. It was a pair of glasses. How strange.　　He"       
## [6192] "blinked again. The smiling face of Albus Dumbledore swam into view"           
## [6193] "above him.　　\"Good afternoon, Harry,\" said Dumbledore. Harry stared at"    
## [6194] "him. Then he remembered: \"Sir! The Stone! It was Quirrell! He's got the"     
## [6195] "Stone! Sir, quick --\"　　\"Calm yourself, dear boy, you are a little"        
## [6196] "behind the times,\" said Dumbledore. \"Quirrell does not have the"            
## [6197] "Stone.\"　　\"Then who does? Sir, I --\"　　\"Harry, please relax, or Madam"  
## [6198] "Pomfrey will have me thrown out.　　Harry swallowed and looked around"        
## [6199] "him. He realized he must be in the hospital wing. He was lying in a bed"      
## [6200] "with white linen sheets, and next to him was a table piled high with"         
## [6201] "what looked like half the candy shop.　　\"Tokens from your friends and"      
## [6202] "admirers,\" said Dumbledore, beaming. \"What happened down in the"            
## [6203] "dungeons between you and Professor Quirrell is a complete secret, so,"        
## [6204] "naturally, the whole school knows. I believe your friends Misters Fred"       
## [6205] "and George Weasley were responsible for trying to send you a toilet"          
## [6206] "seat. No doubt they thought it would amuse you. Madam Pomfrey, however,"      
## [6207] "felt it might not be very hygienic, and confiscated it.\"　　\"How long"      
## [6208] "have I been in here?\"　　\"Three days. Mr. Ronald Weasley and Miss"          
## [6209] "Granger will be most relieved you have come round, they have been"            
## [6210] "extremely worried.\"　　\"But sit, the Stone　　I see you are not to be"      
## [6211] "distracted. Very well, the Stone. Professor Quirrell did not manage to"
