## [6212] "take it from you. I arrived in time to prevent that, although you were"       
## [6213] "doing very well on your own, I must say.　　\"You got there? You got"         
## [6214] "Hermione's owl?\"　　\"We must have crossed in midair. No sooner had I"       
## [6215] "reached London than it became clear to me that the place I should be"         
## [6216] "was the one I had just left. I arrived just in time to pull Quirrell"         
## [6217] "off you.\"　　\"It was you.\"　　\"I feared I might be too late.\"　　\"You"  
## [6218] "nearly were, I couldn't have kept him off the Stone much longer"              
## [6219] "--\"　　\"Not the Stone, boy, you -- the effort involved nearly killed"       
## [6220] "you. For one terrible moment there, I was afraid it had. As for the"          
## [6221] "Stone, it has been destroyed.\"　　\"Destroyed?\" said Harry blankly. \"But"  
## [6222] "your friend -- Nicolas Flamel --\"　　\"Oh, you know about Nicolas?\" said"   
## [6223] "Dumbledore, sounding quite delighted. \"You did do the thing properly,"       
## [6224] "didn't you? Well, Nicolas and I have had a little chat, and agreed it's"      
## [6225] "all for the best.\"　　\"But that means he and his wife will die, won't"      
## [6226] "they?\"　　\"They have enough Elixir stored to set their affairs in order"    
## [6227] "and then, yes, they will die.\"　　Dumbledore smiled at the look of"          
## [6228] "amazement on Harry's face.　　\"To one as young as you, I'm sure it"          
## [6229] "seems incredible, but to Nicolas and Perenelle, it really is like going"      
## [6230] "to bed after a very, very long day. After all, to the well-organized"         
## [6231] "mind, death is but the next great adventure. You know, the Stone was"         
## [6232] "really not such a wonderful thing. As much money and life as you could"       
## [6233] "want! The two things most human beings would choose above all -- the"         
## [6234] "trouble is, humans do have a knack of choosing precisely those things"        
## [6235] "that are worst for them.\" Harry lay there, lost for words. Dumbledore"       
## [6236] "hummed a little and smiled at the ceiling.　　\"Sir?\" said Harry. \"I've"    
## [6237] "been thinking... sir -- even if the Stone's gone, Vol-, I mean,"              
## [6238] "You-Know- Who --\"　　\"Call him Voldemort, Harry. Always use the proper"     
## [6239] "name for things. Fear of a name increases fear of the thing"                  
## [6240] "itself.\"　　\"Yes, sir. Well, Voldemort's going to try other ways of"        
## [6241] "coming back, isn't he? I mean, he hasn't gone, has he?\"　　\"No, Harry,"     
## [6242] "he has not. He is still out there somewhere, perhaps looking for"             
## [6243] "another body to share... not being truly alive, he cannot be killed. He"      
## [6244] "left Quirrell to die; he shows just as little mercy to his followers as"      
## [6245] "his enemies. Nevertheless, Harry, while you may only have delayed his"        
## [6246] "return to power, it will merely take someone else who is prepared to"         
## [6247] "fight what seems a losing battle next time -- and if he is delayed"           
## [6248] "again, and again, why, he may never return to power.\"　　Harry nodded,"      
## [6249] "but stopped quickly, because it made his head hurt. Then he said, \"Sir,"     
## [6250] "there are some other things I'd like to know, if you can tell me..."          
## [6251] "things I want to know the truth about....\"　　\"The truth.\" Dumbledore"     
## [6252] "sighed. \"It is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be"      
## [6253] "treated with great caution. However, I shall answer your questions"           
## [6254] "unless I have a very good reason not to, in which case I beg you'll"          
## [6255] "forgive me. I shall not, of course, lie.\"　　\"Well... Voldemort said"       
## [6256] "that he only killed my mother because she tried to stop him from"             
## [6257] "killing me. But why would he want to kill me in the first"                    
## [6258] "place?\"　　Dumbledore sighed very deeply this time.　　\"Alas, the first"    
## [6259] "thing you ask me, I cannot tell you. Not today. Not now. You will know,"      
## [6260] "one day... put it from your mind for now, Harry. When you are older..."       
## [6261] "I know you hate to hear this... when you are ready, you will"                 
## [6262] "know.\"　　And Harry knew it would be no good to argue.　　\"But why"         
## [6263] "couldn't Quirrell touch me?\"　　\"Your mother died to save you. If there"    
## [6264] "is one thing Voldemort cannot understand, it is love. He didn't realize"      
## [6265] "that love as powerful as your mother's for you leaves its own mark. Not"      
## [6266] "a scar, no visible sign... to have been loved so deeply, even though"         
## [6267] "the person who loved us is gone, will give us some protection forever."       
## [6268] "It is in your very skin. Quirrell, full of hatred, greed, and ambition,"      
## [6269] "sharing his soul with Voldemort, could not touch you for this reason."        
## [6270] "It was agony to touch a person marked by something so"                        
## [6271] "good.\"　　Dumbledore now became very interested in a bird out on the"        
## [6272] "windowsill, which gave Harry time to dry his eyes on the sheet. When he"      
## [6273] "had found his voice again, Harry said, \"And the invisibility cloak - do"     
## [6274] "you know who sent it to me?\"　　\"Ah - your father happened to leave it"     
## [6275] "in my possession, and I thought you might like it.\" Dumbledore's eyes"       
## [6276] "twinkled. \"Useful things... your father used it mainly for sneaking off"     
## [6277] "to the kitchens to steal food when he was here.\"　　\"And there's"           
## [6278] "something else...\"　　\"Fire away.\"　　\"Quirrell said Snape"               
## [6279] "--\"　　\"Professor Snape, Harry.\" \"Yes, him -- Quirrell said he hates me"  
## [6280] "because he hated my father. Is that true?\"　　\"Well, they did rather"       
## [6281] "detest each other. Not unlike yourself and Mr. Malfoy. And then, your"        
## [6282] "father did something Snape could never forgive.\"　　\"What?\"　　\"He"       
## [6283] "saved his life.\"　　\"What?\"　　\"Yes...\" said Dumbledore dreamily."       
## [6284] "\"Funny, the way people's minds work, isn't it? Professor Snape couldn't"     
## [6285] "bear being in your father's debt.... I do believe he worked so hard to"       
## [6286] "protect you this year because he felt that would make him and your"           
## [6287] "father even. Then he could go back to hating your father's memory in"         
## [6288] "peace....\"　　Harry tried to understand this but it made his head"           
## [6289] "pound, so he stopped.　　\"And sir, there's one more thing...\"　　\"Just"    
## [6290] "the one?\"　　\"How did I get the Stone out of the mirror?\"　　\"Ah, now,"   
## [6291] "I'm glad you asked me that. It was one of my more brilliant ideas, and"       
## [6292] "between you and me, that's saying something. You see, only one who"           
## [6293] "wanted to find the Stone -- find it, but not use it -- would be able to"      
## [6294] "get it, otherwise they'd just see themselves making gold or drinking"         
## [6295] "Elixir of Life. My brain surprises even me sometimes.... Now, enough"         
## [6296] "questions. I suggest you make a start on these sweets. Ah! Bettie"            
## [6297] "Bott's Every Flavor Beans! I was unfortunate enough in my youth to come"      
## [6298] "across a vomitflavored one, and since then I'm afraid I've rather lost"       
## [6299] "my liking for them -- but I think I'll be safe with a nice toffee,"           
## [6300] "don't you?\"　　He smiled and popped the golden-brown bean into his"          
## [6301] "mouth. Then he choked and said, \"Alas! Ear wax!\"　　Madam Pomfrey, the"     
## [6302] "nurse, was a nice woman, but very strict.　　\"Just five minutes,\" Harry"    
## [6303] "pleaded.　　\"Absolutely not.\"　　\"You let Professor Dumbledore"            
## [6304] "in...\"　　\"Well, of course, that was the headmaster, quite different."      
## [6305] "You need rest.\"　　\"I am resting, look, lying down and everything. Oh,"     
## [6306] "go on, Madam Pomfrey...\"　　\"Oh, very well,\" she said. \"But five"         
## [6307] "minutes only.\"　　And she let Ron and Hermione"                              
## [6308] "in.　　\"Harry!\"　　Hermione looked ready to fling her arms around him"      
## [6309] "again, but Harry was glad she held herself in as his head was still"          
## [6310] "very sore.　　\"Oh, Harry, we were sure you were going to -- Dumbledore"      
## [6311] "was so worried --\"　　\"The whole school's talking about it,\" said Ron."    
## [6312] "\"What really happened?\"　　It was one of those rare occasions when the"     
## [6313] "true story is even more strange and exciting than the wild rumors."           
## [6314] "Harry told them everything: Quirrell; the mirror; the Stone; and"             
## [6315] "Voldemort. Ron and Hermione were a very good audience; they gasped in"        
## [6316] "all the right places, and when Harry told them what was under"                
## [6317] "Quirrell's turban, Hermione screamed out loud.　　\"So the Stone's"           
## [6318] "gone?\" said Ron finally. \"Flamel's just going to die?\"　　\"That's what"   
## [6319] "I said, but Dumbledore thinks that -- what was it? -- 'to the"                
## [6320] "well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure.　　\"I"           
## [6321] "always said he was off his rocker,\" said Ron, looking quite impressed"       
## [6322] "at how crazy his hero was.　　\"So what happened to you two?\" said"          
## [6323] "Harry.　　\"Well, I got back all right,\" said Hermione. \"I brought Ron"     
## [6324] "round -- that took a while -- and we were dashing up to the owlery to"        
## [6325] "contact Dumbledore when we met him in the entrance hall -- he already"        
## [6326] "knew -- he just said, 'Harry's gone after him, hasn't he?' and hurtled"       
## [6327] "off to the third floor.\"　　\"D'you think he meant you to do it?\" said"     
## [6328] "Ron. \"Sending you your father's cloak and everything?\"　　\"Well, \""       
## [6329] "Hermione exploded, \"if he did -- I mean to say that's terrible -- you"       
## [6330] "could have been killed.\"　　\"No, it isn't,\" said Harry thoughtfully."      
## [6331] "\"He's a funny man, Dumbledore. I think he sort of wanted to give me a"       
## [6332] "chance. I think he knows more or less everything that goes on here, you"      
## [6333] "know. I reckon he had a pretty good idea we were going to try, and"           
## [6334] "instead of stopping us, he just taught us enough to help. I don't think"      
## [6335] "it was an accident he let me find out how the mirror worked. It's"            
## [6336] "almost like he thought I had the right to face Voldemort if I"                
## [6337] "could....\"　　\"Yeah, Dumbledore's off his rocker, all right,\" said Ron"    
## [6338] "proudly. \"Listen, you've got to be up for the end-of-year feast"             
## [6339] "tomorrow. The points are all in and Slytherin won, of course -- you"          
## [6340] "missed the last Quidditch match, we were steamrollered by Ravenclaw"          
## [6341] "without you -- but the food'll be good.\"　　At that moment, Madam"           
## [6342] "Pomfrey bustled over.　　\"You've had nearly fifteen minutes, now OUT\""      
## [6343] "she said firmly.　　After a good night's sleep, Harry felt nearly back"       
## [6344] "to normal.　　I want to go to the feast,\" he told Madam Pomfrey as she"      
## [6345] "straightened his many candy boxes. I can, can't I?\"　　\"Professor"          
## [6346] "Dumbledore says you are to be allowed to go,\" she said stiffily, as"         
## [6347] "though in her opinion Professor Dumbledore didn't realize how risky"          
## [6348] "feasts could be. \"And you have another visitor.\"　　\"Oh, good,\" said"     
## [6349] "Harry. \"Who is it?\"　　Hagrid sidled through the door as he spoke. As"      
## [6350] "usual when he was indoors, Hagrid looked too big to be allowed. He sat"       
## [6351] "down next to Harry, took one look at him, and burst into"                     
## [6352] "tears.　　\"It's -- all -- my -- ruddy -- fault!\" he sobbed, his face in"    
## [6353] "his hands. I told the evil git how ter get past Fluffy! I told him! It"       
## [6354] "was the only thing he didn't know, an' I told him! Yeh could've died!"        
## [6355] "All fer a dragon egg! I'll never drink again! I should be chucked out"        
## [6356] "an' made ter live as a Muggle!\"　　\"Hagrid!\" said Harry, shocked to see"   
## [6357] "Hagrid shaking with grief and remorse, great tears leaking down into"         
## [6358] "his beard. \"Hagrid, he'd have found out somehow, this is Voldemort"          
## [6359] "we're talking about, he'd have found out even if you hadn't told"             
## [6360] "him.\"　　\"Yeh could've died!\" sobbed Hagrid. \"An' don' say the"           
## [6361] "name!\"　　\"VOLDEMORT!\" Harry bellowed, and Hagrid was so shocked, he"      
## [6362] "stopped crying. \"I've met him and I'm calling him by his name. Please"       
## [6363] "cheer up, Hagrid, we saved the Stone, it's gone, he can't use it. Have"       
## [6364] "a Chocolate Frog, I've got loads....\"　　Hagrid wiped his nose on the"       
## [6365] "back of his hand and said, \"That reminds me. I've got yeh a"                 
## [6366] "present.\"　　\"It's not a stoat sandwich, is it?\" said Harry anxiously,"    
## [6367] "and at last Hagrid gave a weak chuckle. \"Nah. Dumbledore gave me the"        
## [6368] "day off yesterday ter fix it. 'Course, he shoulda sacked me instead --"       
## [6369] "anyway, got yeh this...\"　　It seemed to be a handsome, leather-covered"     
## [6370] "book. Harry opened it curiously. It was full of wizard photographs."          
## [6371] "Smiling and waving at him from every page were his mother and"                
## [6372] "father.　　\"Sent owls off ter all yer parents' old school friends,"          
## [6373] "askin' fer photos... knew yeh didn' have any... d'yeh like"                   
## [6374] "it?\"　　Harry couldn't speak, but Hagrid understood.　　Harry made his"      
## [6375] "way down to the end-of-year feast alone that night. He had been held up"      
## [6376] "by Madam Pomfrey's fussing about, insisting on giving him one last"           
## [6377] "checkup, so the Great Hall was already full. It was decked out in the"        
## [6378] "Slytherin colors of green and silver to celebrate Slytherin's winning"        
## [6379] "the house cup for the seventh year in a row. A huge banner showing the"       
## [6380] "Slytherin serpent covered the wall behind the High Table.　　When Harry"      
## [6381] "walked in there was a sudden hush, and then everybody started talking"        
## [6382] "loudly at once. He slipped into a seat between Ron and Hermione at the"       
## [6383] "Gryffindor table and tried to ignore the fact that people were standing"      
## [6384] "up to look at him.　　Fortunately, Dumbledore arrived moments later."         
## [6385] "The babble died away.　　\"Another year gone!\" Dumbledore said"              
## [6386] "cheerfully. \"And I must trouble you with an old man's wheezing waffle"       
## [6387] "before we sink our teeth into our delicious feast. What a year it has"        
## [6388] "been! Hopefully your heads are all a little fuller than they were..."         
## [6389] "you have the whole summer ahead to get them nice and empty before next"       
## [6390] "year starts....　　\"Now, as I understand it, the house cup here needs"       
## [6391] "awarding, and the points stand thus: In fourth place, Gryffindor, with"       
## [6392] "three hundred and twelve points; in third, Hufflepuff, with three"            
## [6393] "hundred and fifty-two; Ravenclaw has four hundred and twenty-six and"         
## [6394] "Slytherin, four hundred and seventy- two.\"　　A storm of cheering and"       
## [6395] "stamping broke out from the Slytherin table. Harry could see Draco"           
## [6396] "Malfoy banging his goblet on the table. It was a sickening"                   
## [6397] "sight.　　\"Yes, Yes, well done, Slytherin,\" said Dumbledore. \"However,"    
## [6398] "recent events must be taken into account.\"　　The room went very still."     
## [6399] "The Slytherins' smiles faded a little.　　\"Ahem,\" said Dumbledore. \"I"     
## [6400] "have a few last-minute points to dish out. Let me see. Yes...　　\"First"     
## [6401] "-- to Mr. Ronald Weasley...\"　　Ron went purple in the face; he looked"      
## [6402] "like a radish with a bad sunburn.　　\"...for the best-played game of"        
## [6403] "chess Hogwarts has seen in many years, I award Gryffindor house fifty"        
## [6404] "points.\"　　Gryffindor cheers nearly raised the bewitched ceiling; the"      
## [6405] "stars overhead seemed to quiver. Percy could be heard telling the other"      
## [6406] "prefects, \"My brother, you know! My youngest brother! Got past"              
## [6407] "McGonagall's giant chess set!\"　　At last there was silence"                 
## [6408] "again.　　\"Second -- to Miss Hermione Granger... for the use of cool"        
## [6409] "logic in the face of fire, I award Gryffindor house fifty"                    
## [6410] "points.\"　　Hermione buried her face in her arms; Harry strongly"            
## [6411] "suspected she had burst into tears. Gryffindors up and down the table"        
## [6412] "were beside themselves -- they were a hundred points up. \"Third -- to"       
## [6413] "Mr. Harry Potter...\" said Dumbledore. The room went deadly quiet for"        
## [6414] "pure nerve and outstanding courage, I award Gryffindor house sixty"           
## [6415] "points.\"　　The din was deafening. Those who could add up while yelling"     
## [6416] "themselves hoarse knew that Gryffindor now had four hundred and"              
## [6417] "seventy-two points -- exactly the same as Slytherin. They had tied for"       
## [6418] "the house cup -- if only Dumbledore had given Harry just one more"            
## [6419] "point.　　Dumbledore raised his hand. The room gradually fell"                
## [6420] "silent.　　\"There are all kinds of courage,\" said Dumbledore, smiling."     
## [6421] "\"It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just"      
## [6422] "as much to stand up to our friends. I therefore award ten points to Mr."      
## [6423] "Neville Longbottom.\"　　Someone standing outside the Great Hall might"       
## [6424] "well have thought some sort of explosion had taken place, so loud was"        
## [6425] "the noise that erupted from the Gryffindor table. Harry, Ron, and"            
## [6426] "Hermione stood up to yell and cheer as Neville, white with shock,"            
## [6427] "disappeared under a pile of people hugging him. He had never won so"          
## [6428] "much as a point for Gryffindor before. Harry, still cheering, nudged"         
## [6429] "Ron in the ribs and pointed at Malfoy, who couldn't have looked more"         
## [6430] "stunned and horrified if he'd just had the Body-Bind Curse put on"            
## [6431] "him.　　\"Which means, Dumbledore called over the storm of applause, for"     
## [6432] "even Ravenclaw and Hufflepuff were celebrating the downfall of"               
## [6433] "Slytherin, \"we need a little change of decoration.\"　　He clapped his"      
## [6434] "hands. In an instant, the green hangings became scarlet and the silver"       
## [6435] "became gold; the huge Slytherin serpent vanished and a towering"              
## [6436] "Gryffindor lion took its place. Snape was shaking Professor"                  
## [6437] "McGonagall's hand, with a horrible, forced smile. He caught Harry's eye"      
## [6438] "and Harry knew at once that Snape's feelings toward him hadn't changed"       
## [6439] "one jot. This didn't worry Harry. It seemed as though life would be"          
## [6440] "back to normal next year, or as normal as it ever was at"                     
## [6441] "Hogwarts.　　It was the best evening of Harry's life, better than"            
## [6442] "winning at Quidditch, or Christmas, or knocking out mountain trolls..."       
## [6443] "he would never, ever forget tonight.　　Harry had almost forgotten that"      
## [6444] "the exam results were still to come, but come they did. To their great"       
## [6445] "surprise, both he and Ron passed with good marks; Hermione, of course,"       
## [6446] "had the best grades of the first years. Even Neville scraped through,"        
## [6447] "his good Herbology mark making up for his abysmal Potions one. They had"      
## [6448] "hoped that Goyle, who was almost as stupid as he was mean, might be"          
## [6449] "thrown out, but he had passed, too. It was a shame, but as Ron said,"         
## [6450] "you couldn't have everything in life.　　And suddenly, their wardrobes"       
## [6451] "were empty, their trunks were packed, Neville's toad was found lurking"       
## [6452] "in a corner of the toilets; notes were handed out to all students,"           
## [6453] "warning them not to use magic over the holidays (\"I always hope they'll"     
## [6454] "forget to give us these,\" said Fred Weasley sadly); Hagrid was there to"     
## [6455] "take them down to the fleet of boats that sailed across the lake; they"       
## [6456] "were boarding the Hogwarts Express; talking and laughing as the"              
## [6457] "countryside became greener and tidier; eating Bettie Bott's Every"            
## [6458] "Flavor Beans as they sped past Muggle towns; pulling off their wizard"        
## [6459] "robes and putting on jackets and coats; pulling into platform nine and"       
## [6460] "three-quarters at King's Cross Station.　　It took quite a while for"         
## [6461] "them all to get off the platform. A wizened old guard was up by the"          
## [6462] "ticket barrier, letting them go through the gate in twos and threes so"       
## [6463] "they didn't attract attention by all bursting out of a solid wall at"         
## [6464] "once and alarming the Muggles.　　\"You must come and stay this summer,\""    
## [6465] "said Ron, \"both of you -- I'll send you an owl.\"　　\"Thanks,\" said"       
## [6466] "Harry, \"I'll need something to look forward to.\" People jostled them as"    
## [6467] "they moved forward toward the gateway back to the Muggle world. Some of"      
## [6468] "them called:　　\"Bye, Harry!\"　　\"See you, Potter!\"　　\"Still famous,\"" 
## [6469] "said Ron, grinning at him.　　\"Not where I'm going, I promise you,\""        
## [6470] "said Harry.　　He, Ron, and Hermione passed through the gateway"              
## [6471] "together. \"There he is, Mom, there he is, look!\"　　It was Ginny"           
## [6472] "Weasley, Ron's younger sister, but she wasn't pointing at"                    
## [6473] "Ron.　　\"Harry Potter!\" she squealed. \"Look, Mom! I can see　　\"Be"       
## [6474] "quiet, Ginny, and it's rude to point.\"　　Mrs. Weasley smiled down at"       
## [6475] "them.　　\"Busy year?\" she said.　　\"Very,\" said Harry. \"Thanks for the"  
## [6476] "fudge and the sweater, Mrs. Weasley.\"　　\"Oh, it was nothing,"              
## [6477] "dear.\"　　\"Ready, are you?\"　　It was Uncle Vernon, still purple-faced,"   
## [6478] "still mustached, still looking furious at the nerve of Harry, carrying"       
## [6479] "an owl in a cage in a station full of ordinary people. Behind him stood"      
## [6480] "Aunt Petunia and Dudley, looking terrified at the very sight of"              
## [6481] "Harry.　　\"You must be Harry's family!\" said Mrs. Weasley.　　\"In a"       
## [6482] "manner of speaking,\" said Uncle Vernon. \"Hurry up, boy, we haven't got"     
## [6483] "all day.\" He walked away.　　Harry hung back for a last word with Ron"       
## [6484] "and Hermione.　　\"See you over the summer, then.\"　　\"Hope you have --"    
## [6485] "er -- a good holiday,\" said Hermione, looking uncertainly after Uncle"       
## [6486] "Vernon, shocked that anyone could be so unpleasant.　　\"Oh, I will,\""       
## [6487] "said Harry, and they were surprised at the grin that was spreading over"      
## [6488] "his face. \"They don't know we're not allowed to use magic at home. I'm"      
## [6489] "going to have a lot of fun with Dudley this summer....\"　　THE END"

web scraping

We will be using the rvest package. The meat and potatoes function of rvest is read_html(), which takes a URL as its argument. Check out some of the documentation here.

Let’s read in a webpage with some text embedded in it.

# bourdain <-
# read_html('https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/1999/04/19/dont-eat-before-reading-this')
